Header.Description: Metadata attributes that characterize CMOR variables. Each variable is uniquely idenfied by a compound name comprised of a CMIP6-era table name and a short variable name.

3hr.clt.comment: for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Include both large-scale and convective cloud.  This is a 3-hour mean.

3hr.ficeberg.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
3hr.ficeberg.long_name: Water Flux into Sea Water from Icebergs
3hr.ficeberg.comment: computed as the iceberg melt water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

3hr.flandice.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
3hr.flandice.long_name: Water Flux into Sea Water from Land Ice
3hr.flandice.comment: Computed as the water flux into the ocean due to land ice (runoff water from surface and base of land ice or melt from base of ice shelf or vertical ice front) into the ocean divided by the area ocean portion of the grid cell

3hr.friver.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
3hr.friver.long_name: Water Flux into Sea Water from Rivers
3hr.friver.comment: computed as the river flux of water into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

3hr.hfds.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
3hr.hfds.long_name: Downward Heat Flux at Sea Water Surface
3hr.hfds.comment: This is the net flux of heat entering the liquid water column through its upper surface (excluding any "flux adjustment") .

3hr.hfrunoffds.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
3hr.hfrunoffds.long_name: Temperature Flux Due to Runoff Expressed as Heat Flux into Sea Water
3hr.hfrunoffds.comment: Heat flux associated with liquid water which drains from land. It is calculated relative to the heat that would be transported by runoff water entering the sea at zero degrees Celsius.

3hr.mrro.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
3hr.mrro.comment: the total runoff (including "drainage" through the base of the soil model) leaving the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell, averaged over the 3-hour interval.

3hr.mrsol.comment: In response to the opportunity "Accurate assessment of land-atmosphere coupling", I'm proposing a soil moisture for multiple layers in a frequency of 3hr.

3hr.mrsos.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: point
3hr.mrsos.long_name: Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column
3hr.mrsos.comment: the mass of water in all phases in a thin surface soil layer.

3hr.pr.comment: at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases.  This is the 3-hour mean precipitation flux.

3hr.prsn.comment: at surface.  Includes precipitation of all forms water in the solid phase.  This is the 3-hour mean snowfall flux.

3hr.ps.comment: sampled synoptically to diagnose atmospheric tides, this is better than mean sea level pressure.

3hr.rsntds.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
3hr.rsntds.long_name: Net Downward Shortwave Radiation at Sea Water Surface
3hr.rsntds.comment: This is the flux into the surface of liquid sea water only. This excludes shortwave flux absorbed by sea ice, but includes any light that passes through the ice and is absorbed by the ocean.

3hr.sfdsi.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
3hr.sfdsi.long_name: Downward Sea Ice Basal Salt Flux
3hr.sfdsi.comment: This field is physical, and it arises since sea ice has a nonzero salt content, so it exchanges salt with the liquid ocean upon melting and freezing.

3hr.tauuo.long_name: Sea Water Surface Downward X Stress
3hr.tauuo.comment: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.

3hr.tauvo.long_name: Sea Water Surface Downward Y Stress
3hr.tauvo.comment: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.

3hr.tos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: point
3hr.tos.comment: temperature of surface of open ocean, sampled synoptically.

3hr.tslsi.cell_methods: area: mean (comment: over land and sea ice) time: point
3hr.tslsi.long_name: Surface Temperature Where Land or Sea Ice
3hr.tslsi.comment: Surface temperature of all surfaces except open ocean, sampled synoptically.

3hr.ua100m.comment: 3-hourly u-wind at 100m3-hourly u-wind at 100m3-hourly u-wind at 100m3-hourly u-wind at 100m3-hourly u-wind at 100m3-hourly u-wind at 100m3-hourly u-wind at 100m3-hourly u-wind at 100m

3hr.wfo.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
3hr.wfo.comment: Computed as the water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell. This is the sum \*wfonocorr\* and \*wfcorr\*.

6hrLev.bs550aer.comment: Aerosol  Backscatter at wavelength 550nm and scattering angle 180 degrees, computed from extinction and lidar ratio

6hrLev.hus.comment: Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air.

6hrLev.ps.comment: surface pressure, not mean sea level pressure

6hrLev.ua.comment: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).

6hrLev.va.comment: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).

6hrPlev.hurs.comment: The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

6hrPlev.pr.comment: includes both liquid and solid phases

6hrPlev.prhmax.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

6hrPlev.prsn.comment: at surface. Includes precipitation of all forms water in the solid phase.

6hrPlev.ps.comment: surface pressure, not mean sea level pressure

6hrPlev.rsds.comment: Surface solar irradiance for UV calculations.

6hrPlev.rv850.comment: Relative vorticity is the upward component of the vorticity vector i.e. the component which arises from horizontal velocity.

6hrPlev.uas.comment: Eastward component of the near-surface (usually, 10 meters)  wind

6hrPlev.zg1000.comment: Geopotential height on the 1000 hPa surface

6hrPlevPt.hur500.comment: Relative humidity at 500 hPa, 6 hourly instantaneous

6hrPlevPt.hus7h.cell_methods: area: mean where air time: point

6hrPlevPt.intuaw.long_name: 6 hourly instantaneous vertical integral of zonal water vapor flux
6hrPlevPt.intuaw.comment: This is the same as intuaw but defined on 6hrPlevPt

6hrPlevPt.intvaw.long_name: 6 hourly instantaneous integral of meridional moisture flux
6hrPlevPt.intvaw.comment: Same as intvaw but 6 hourly instantaneous

6hrPlevPt.pr.comment: This is the total precipitation at the surface

6hrPlevPt.prw.long_name: 6 hourly instantaneous vertically integrated water vapor

6hrPlevPt.rv850.cell_methods: area: mean where air time: point
6hrPlevPt.rv850.comment: Relative vorticity is the upward component of the vorticity vector i.e. the component which arises from horizontal velocity.

6hrPlevPt.ta.cell_methods: area: mean where air time: point

6hrPlevPt.taUTLS.long_name: 6 hourly instantaneous temperature in the UTLS region
6hrPlevPt.taUTLS.comment: 6 hourly instantaneous temperature at 3 pressure levels in the UTLS region (100, 150 and 225 hPa)

6hrPlevPt.taUTLSadd.long_name: 6 hourly instantaneous temperature in additional levels within the UTLS region
6hrPlevPt.taUTLSadd.comment: 6 hourly instantaneous temperature at 2 additional pressure levels in the UTLS region (175 and 225 hPa)

6hrPlevPt.ts.comment: Temperature of the lower boundary of the atmosphere

6hrPlevPt.ua.cell_methods: area: mean where air time: point
6hrPlevPt.ua.comment: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).

6hrPlevPt.uaUTLSadd.long_name: 6 hourly instantaneous northward wind in additional levels within the UTLS region
6hrPlevPt.uaUTLSadd.comment: 6 hourly instantaneous northward wind at 2 additional pressure levels in the UTLS region (175 and 225 hPa)

6hrPlevPt.va.cell_methods: area: mean where air time: point
6hrPlevPt.va.comment: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).

6hrPlevPt.va200.comment: Northward wind at 200 hPa, 6 hourly instantaneous

6hrPlevPt.vaUTLS.long_name: 6 hourly instantaneous eastward wind in the UTLS region
6hrPlevPt.vaUTLS.comment: 6 hourly instantaneous eastward wind at 3 pressure levels in the UTLS region (100, 150 and 225 hPa)

6hrPlevPt.vaUTLSadd.long_name: 6 hourly instantaneous eastward wind in additional levels within the UTLS region
6hrPlevPt.vaUTLSadd.comment: 6 hourly instantaneous eastward wind at 2 additional pressure levels in the UTLS region (175 and 225 hPa)

6hrPlevPt.zg.cell_methods: area: mean where air time: point
6hrPlevPt.zg.comment: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.

6hrPlevPt.zg500.cell_methods: area: mean where air time: point
6hrPlevPt.zg500.comment: geopotential height on the 500 hPa surface

6hrPlevPt.zg700.comment: 700 hPa geopotential height at 6 hourly instantaneous frequency

6hrPlevPt.zg7h.cell_methods: area: mean where air time: point
6hrPlevPt.zg7h.comment: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.

6hrPlevPt.zg925.comment: Geopotential Height at 925 hPa, 6 hourly instantaneous

AERday.co.comment: This is the daily mean for CO volume mixing ratio in lowest model layer

AERday.cod.comment: The optical thickness is the integral along the path of radiation of a volume scattering/absorption/attenuation coefficient. The radiative flux is reduced by a factor exp(-optical_thickness) on traversing the path. A coordinate variable of radiation_wavelength or radiation_frequency can be specified to indicate that the optical thickness applies at specific wavelengths or frequencies. The atmosphere optical thickness applies to radiation passing through the entire atmosphere. "Cloud" means the component of extinction owing to the presence of liquid or ice water particles. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase.

AERday.drynh3.long_name: Daily Dry Deposition Rate of NH3
AERday.drynh3.comment: Daily Dry Deposition Rate of NH3 at surface

AERday.drynh4.long_name: Daily Dry Deposition Rate of NH4
AERday.drynh4.comment: Daily Dry Deposition Rate of NH4

AERday.drynoy.long_name: Daily Dry Deposition Rate of NOy
AERday.drynoy.comment: Daily Dry Deposition Rate of NOy

AERday.maxpblz.comment: maximum boundary layer height during the day (add cell_methods attribute: "time: maximum")

AERday.minpblz.comment: minimum boundary layer height during the day (add cell_methods attribute: "time: minimum")

AERday.mmraerh2o.long_name: Daily mean surface Aerosol water mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer
AERday.mmraerh2o.comment: This is the daily mean Aerosol water mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer

AERday.mmrbc.comment: This is the daily mean elemental carbon mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer

AERday.mmrdust.comment: This is the daily mean for dust aerosol mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer

AERday.mmrnh4.comment: This is the daily mean for NH4 mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer

AERday.mmrno3.comment: This is the daily mean for NO3 aerosol mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer

AERday.mmroa.comment: The is the daily mean otal organic aerosol mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer

AERday.mmrso4.comment: This is the daily mean for sulfate aerosol mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer

AERday.mmrsoa.comment: This is the daily mean secondary organic aerosol mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer

AERday.mmrss.comment: This is the daily mean Sea Salt mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer

AERday.od550aer.comment: AOD from the ambient aerosls (i.e., includes aerosol water).  Does not include AOD from stratospheric aerosols if these are prescribed but includes other possible background aerosol types. Needs a comment attribute "wavelength: 550 nm"

AERday.sfo3max.long_name: Daily Maximum O3 Volume Mixing Ratio in Lowest Model Layer
AERday.sfo3max.comment: maximum near-surface ozone  (add cell_methods attribute "time: maximum")

AERday.sfpm1.comment: This is the daily mean for PM1.0 mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer

AERday.sfpm10.comment: This is the daily mean PM10 mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer

AERday.sfpm25.comment: This is the daily mean PM2.5 mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer

AERday.so2.comment: This is the daily mean for SO2 volume mixing ratio in lowest model layer

AERday.ua10.comment: Zonal wind on the 10 hPa surface

AERday.wetnh3.long_name: Daily Wet Deposition Rate of NH3
AERday.wetnh3.comment: Daily Wet Deposition Rate of NH3

AERday.wetnh4.long_name: Daily Wet Deposition Rate of NH4
AERday.wetnh4.comment: Daily Wet Deposition Rate of NH4

AERday.wetnoy.long_name: Daily Wet Deposition Rate of NOy
AERday.wetnoy.comment: Daily Wet Deposition Rate of NOy

AERday.zg10.comment: Geopotential height on the 10 hPa surface

AERday.zg1000.comment: Geopotential height on the 1000 hPa surface

AERday.zg500.comment: geopotential height on the 500 hPa surface

AERfx.ch4ref.long_name: Reference mole fraction of methane in air
AERfx.ch4ref.comment: This is the methane mole fraction that is used in a diagnostic call to the model's radiation scheme. It is only applicable when a methane double call is active in the model.

AERfx.o3ref.long_name: Fixed Reference Mole Fraction of Ozone in Air
AERfx.o3ref.comment: This is the ozone mole fraction that is used in a diagnostic call to the model's radiation scheme. It is only applicable when an ozone double call is active in the model.

AERfx.o3refClim.long_name: Fixed Reference Climatology of Mole Fraction of Ozone in Air
AERfx.o3refClim.comment: This is the ozone mole fraction that is used in a diagnostic call to the model's radiation scheme. It is only applicable when an ozone double call is active in the model.

AERhr.ps.comment: surface pressure (not mean sea-level pressure), 2-D field to calculate the 3-D pressure field from hybrid coordinates

AERhr.sfno2.long_name: NO2 Volume Mixing Ratio in Lowest Model Layer
AERhr.sfno2.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

AERhr.sfo3.long_name: O3 Volume Mixing Ratio in Lowest Model Layer
AERhr.sfo3.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

AERhr.sfpm1.comment: Hourly PM1.0 Mass Mixing Ratio in Lowest Model Layer

AERhr.sfpm10.comment: Hourly PM10 Mass Mixing Ratio in Lowest Model Layer

AERhr.sfpm25.long_name: PM2.5 Mass Mixing Ratio in Lowest Model Layer
AERhr.sfpm25.comment: Mass fraction of atmospheric particulate compounds with an aerodynamic diameter of less than or equal to 2.5 micrometers. To specify the relative humidity and temperature at which the particle size applies, provide scalar coordinate variables with the standard names of "relative_humidity" and "air_temperature".

AERmon.abs550aer.long_name: Ambient Aerosol Absorption Optical Thickness at 550nm
AERmon.abs550aer.comment: Optical thickness of atmospheric aerosols at wavelength 550 nanometers.

AERmon.abs550bc.comment: This is the black carbon aerosol optical depth at 550nm due to absorption

AERmon.abs550dust.comment: This is the dust aerosol optical depth at 550nm due to absorption

AERmon.abs550no3.comment: This is the nitrate aerosol optical depth at 550nm due to absorption

AERmon.abs550oa.comment: This is the particular organic matter aerosol optical depth at 550nm due to absorption

AERmon.abs550so4.comment: This is the sulphate aerosol optical depth at 550nm due to absorption

AERmon.abs550ss.comment: This is the sea salt aerosol optical depth at 550nm due to absorption

AERmon.airmass.long_name: Vertically Integrated Mass Content of Air in Layer
AERmon.airmass.comment: The mass of air in an atmospheric layer.

AERmon.albs.comment: This is a band average value for the planetary albedo

AERmon.albsrfc.comment: This is a band-average value for the surface albedo

AERmon.aoanh.comment: Fixed surface layer mixing ratio over 30o-50oN (0 ppbv), uniform fixed source (at all levels) everywhere else (source is unspecified but must be constant in space and time and documented). Note that the source could be 1yr/yr, so the tracer concentration provides mean age in years. For method using linearly increasing tracer include a method attribute: "linearly increasing tracer"For method using uniform source (1yr/yr) include a method attribute: "uniform source"

AERmon.c2h4.comment: The is the mole fraction of ethene (C2H4) in air

AERmon.c2h5oh.comment: This is the mole fraction of ethanol (C2H5OH) in air

AERmon.c2h6.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

AERmon.c3h6.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

AERmon.c3h8.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

AERmon.c4h10.comment: This is the mole fraction of butane (C4H10) in air

AERmon.ccn.long_name: Cloud Condensation Nuclei Concentration at Liquid Cloud Top

AERmon.ccn02.comment: This is the concentration of cloud condensation nuclei (CCN) at 0.2% supersaturation, based on aerosol chemical composition and size

AERmon.ccn1.comment: This is the concentration of cloud condensation nuclei (CCN) at 1.0 percent supersaturation, based on aerosol chemical composition and size

AERmon.cdnc.comment: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration in liquid water clouds.

AERmon.cfc114.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

AERmon.ch3coch3.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction "mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox_expressed_as_nitrogen". Acetone is an organic molecule with the chemical formula CH3CH3CO. The IUPAC name for acetone is propan-2-one. Acetone is a member of the group of organic compounds known as ketones. There are standard names for the ketone group as well as for some of the individual species.

AERmon.ch3oh.comment: The is the mole fraction of methanol (CH3OH) in air

AERmon.ch4.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

AERmon.ch4losssoil.long_name: loss of methane from the atmosphere due to biological consumption in the soil
AERmon.ch4losssoil.comment: This is the loss rate of methane from the atmosphere due to soil sink

AERmon.chegph2oo1d.comment: This is the primary production rate of the hydroxy (OH) radical via H2O+O1D

AERmon.chepasoa.long_name: Total Net Production of Anthropogenic Secondary Organic Aerosol

AERmon.chepnh4.long_name: Net chemical production of ammonium aerosol
AERmon.chepnh4.comment: This is the net chemical production rate of ammonium aerosol in the atmosphere.

AERmon.chepno3.long_name: Net chemical production of nitrate aerosol
AERmon.chepno3.comment: This is the net chemical production rate of nitrate aerosol in the atmosphere

AERmon.chepsoa.long_name: Chemical Production of Dry Aerosol Secondary Organic Matter
AERmon.chepsoa.comment: If model lumps SOA emissions with POA, then the sum of POA and SOA emissions is reported as OA emissions. "mass" refers to the mass of primary organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone.

AERmon.co.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

AERmon.co2.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

AERmon.cod.comment: The optical thickness is the integral along the path of radiation of a volume scattering/absorption/attenuation coefficient. The radiative flux is reduced by a factor exp(-optical_thickness) on traversing the path. A coordinate variable of radiation_wavelength or radiation_frequency can be specified to indicate that the optical thickness applies at specific wavelengths or frequencies. The atmosphere optical thickness applies to radiation passing through the entire atmosphere. "Cloud" means the component of extinction owing to the presence of liquid or ice water particles. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase.

AERmon.conccn.comment: This is the number concentration of air particles in air

AERmon.dms.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

AERmon.do3chm.comment: This is the net chemical production of ozone in the atmosphere

AERmon.drybc.long_name: Dry Deposition Rate of Black Carbon Aerosol Mass

AERmon.dryh2.long_name: Total loss rate of molecular hydrogen (H2) from the atmosphere via soil sink
AERmon.dryh2.comment: This is the total loss rate of molecular hydrogen (H2) from the atmosphere via its soil sink due to bacterial consumption.

AERmon.dryhno3.comment: This is the loss of nitric acid (HNO3) from the atmosphere due to dry deposition

AERmon.dryno3.comment: This is the loss rate of nitrate (NO3) aerosol from the atmosphere due to dry deposition

AERmon.dryoa.long_name: Dry Deposition Rate of Dry Aerosol Total Organic Matter

AERmon.dryss.long_name: Dry Deposition Rate of Sea-Salt Aerosol

AERmon.e90inst.comment: This is the mole fraction of an artificial tracer with a 90-day lifetime (e90)

AERmon.emiach4.comment: This is the anthropogenic emission rate of methane (CH4) into the atmosphere

AERmon.emiaco.long_name: Total Emission Rate of Anthropogenic CO

AERmon.emianox.long_name: Total Emission Rate of Anthropogenic NOx
AERmon.emianox.comment: Store flux as Nitrogen. Anthropogenic fraction. NOx=NO+NO2, Includes agricultural waste burning but no other biomass burning. Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

AERmon.emiaoa.long_name: Total Emission Rate of Anthropogenic Organic Aerosol

AERmon.emiavnox.long_name: Emission rate of NOx from aviation
AERmon.emiavnox.comment: The is the emission rate of NOx from aircraft

AERmon.emibbbc.long_name: total emission rate of black carbon aerosol mass from all biomass burning
AERmon.emibbbc.comment: This is the total emission rate of black carbon aerosol into the atmosphere from all biomass burning (natural and anthropogenic)

AERmon.emibbch4.long_name: total emission of CH4 from all biomass burning
AERmon.emibbch4.comment: This is the total emission rate of methane (CH4) into the atmosphere from all biomass burning (natural and anthropogenic)

AERmon.emibbco.long_name: total emission rate of CO from all biomass burning
AERmon.emibbco.comment: This is the total emission rate of carbon monoxide (CO) into the atmosphere from all biomass burning (natural and anthropogenic)

AERmon.emibbdms.long_name: total emission of DMS from all biomass burning
AERmon.emibbdms.comment: This is the total emission rate of dimethyl sulfide (DMS) into the atmosphere from all biomass burning (natural and anthropogenic)

AERmon.emibbnh3.long_name: total emission rate of NH3 from all biomass burning
AERmon.emibbnh3.comment: This is the total emission rate of ammonia (NH3) into the atmosphere from all biomass burning (natural and anthropogenic)

AERmon.emibbnox.long_name: total emission rate of NOx from all biomass burning
AERmon.emibbnox.comment: This is the total emission rate of nitrogen oxides (NOx) from all biomass burning (natural and anthropogenic)

AERmon.emibboa.long_name: total emission of organic aerosol from all biomass burning
AERmon.emibboa.comment: The is the total emission rate of particulate organic matter (organic aerosol) into the atmosphere from all biomass burning (natural and anthropogenic)

AERmon.emibbso2.long_name: total emission rate of SO2 from all biomass burning
AERmon.emibbso2.comment: This is the total emission rate of SO2 into the atmosphere from all biomass burning (natural and anthropogenic).

AERmon.emibbvoc.long_name: total emission rate of NMVOC from all biomass burning
AERmon.emibbvoc.comment: This is the total emission rate of non-methane volatile organic compounds (NMVOCs) from all biomass burning (natural and anthropogenic)

AERmon.emibc.long_name: Total Emission Rate of Black Carbon Aerosol Mass
AERmon.emibc.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

AERmon.emibvoc.long_name: Total Emission Rate of Biogenic NMVOC
AERmon.emibvoc.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field._If_ fixed molecular weight of NMVOC is not available in model, please provide in units of kilomole m-2 s-1 (i.e. kg m-2 s-1 as if model NMVOC had molecular weight of 1) and add a comment to your file.

AERmon.emic2h4.comment: This is the total emission rate of ethene (C2H4) into the atmosphere

AERmon.emic2h5oh.comment: This is the total emission rate of ethanol (C2H5OH) into the atmosphere

AERmon.emic2h6.comment: This is the total emission rate of ethane (C2H6) into the atmosphere

AERmon.emic3h6.comment: This is the total emission rate of propene (C3H6) into the atmosphere

AERmon.emic3h8.comment: This is the total emission rate of propane (C3H8) into the atmosphere

AERmon.emic4h10.comment: This is the total emission rate of butane (C4H10) into the atmosphere

AERmon.emich3oh.comment: This is the total emission rate of methanol (CH3OH) into the atmosphere

AERmon.emich4.comment: This is the total emission rate of methane (CH4) into the atmosphere

AERmon.emico.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

AERmon.emidms.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

AERmon.emidust.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

AERmon.emih2.long_name: Total emission rate of molecular hydrogen (H2)
AERmon.emih2.comment: This is the total emission rate of molecular hydrogen (H2) into the atmosphere (i.e., integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field)

AERmon.emiisop.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field

AERmon.emilkch4.comment: This is the emission rate of methane (CH4) into the atmosphere from freshwater lakes

AERmon.emilnox.comment: Integrate the NOx production for lightning over model layer. proposed name: tendency_of_atmosphere_mass_content_of_nox_from_lightning

AERmon.eminh3.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

AERmon.eminox.comment: Store flux as Nitrogen. NOx=NO+NO2. Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

AERmon.emioa.long_name: Primary Emission and Chemical Production of Dry Aerosol Organic Matter
AERmon.emioa.comment: This is the sum of total emission of POA and total production of SOA (emipoa+chepsoa). "Mass" refers to the mass of organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone. We recommend a scale factor of POM=1.4\*OC, unless your model has more detailed info available.  Integrate 3D chemical production and emission field vertically to 2d field.

AERmon.emiso2.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

AERmon.emiso4.long_name: Total Direct Emission Rate of SO4
AERmon.emiso4.comment: Direct primary emission does not include secondary sulfate production. Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

AERmon.emiss.long_name: Total Emission Rate of Sea-Salt Aerosol
AERmon.emiss.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

AERmon.emivoc.comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field. _If_ fixed molecular weight of NMVOC is not available in model, please provide in units of kilomole m-2 s-1 (i.e. kg m-2 s-1 as if model NMVOC had molecular weight of 1) and add a comment to your file.

AERmon.h2.comment: This is the mole fraction of molecular hydrogen (H2) in air

AERmon.h2loss.comment: This is the loss rate of molecular hydrogen (H2) from the atmosphere due to chemical destruction

AERmon.h2prod.comment: This is the production of molecular hydrogen (H2) in the atmosphere due to chemical production

AERmon.hcfc22.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

AERmon.hcho.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

AERmon.hcl.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  The chemical formula of hydrogen chloride is HCl.

AERmon.hfc125.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

AERmon.hfc134a.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

AERmon.hno3.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

AERmon.isop.comment: Mole fraction of isoprene in air.

AERmon.lossco.long_name: Monthly Loss of Atmospheric Carbon Monoxide

AERmon.lossn2o.long_name: Monthly Loss of Atmospheric Nitrous Oxide

AERmon.lwp.comment: The total mass of liquid water in cloud per unit area.

AERmon.meanage.comment: The mean age of air is defined as the mean time that a stratospheric air mass has been out of contact with the well-mixed troposphere.

AERmon.mmraerh2o.comment: Mass fraction is used in the construction mass_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y. It means the ratio of the mass of X to the mass of Y (including X). "Aerosol" means the system of suspended liquid or solid particles in air (except cloud droplets) and their carrier gas, the air itself. "Ambient_aerosol" means that the aerosol is measured or modelled at the ambient state of pressure, temperature and relative humidity that exists in its immediate environment. "Ambient aerosol particles" are aerosol particles that have taken up ambient water through hygroscopic growth. The extent of hygroscopic growth depends on the relative humidity and the composition of the particles.

AERmon.mmrbc.comment: Dry mass fraction of black carbon aerosol particles in air.

AERmon.mmrdust.comment: Dry mass fraction of dust aerosol particles in air.

AERmon.mmrnh4.comment: Dry mass fraction of ammonium aerosol particles in air.

AERmon.mmrno3.comment: Dry mass fraction of nitrate aerosol particles in air.

AERmon.mmroa.long_name: Total Organic Aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio
AERmon.mmroa.comment: We recommend a scale factor of POM=1.4\*OC, unless your model has more detailed info available.

AERmon.mmrpm1.comment: Mass fraction atmospheric particulate compounds with an aerodynamic diameter of less than or equal to 1 micrometers

AERmon.mmrpm10.comment: Mass fraction atmospheric particulate compounds with an aerodynamic diameter of less than or equal to 10 micrometers

AERmon.mmrpm2p5.comment: Mass fraction atmospheric particulate compounds with an aerodynamic diameter of less than or equal to 2.5 micrometers

AERmon.mmrso4.comment: Dry mass of sulfate (SO4) in aerosol particles as a fraction of air mass.

AERmon.mmrsoa.long_name: Secondary Organic Aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio
AERmon.mmrsoa.comment: Mass fraction in the atmosphere of secondary organic aerosols (particulate organic matter formed within the atmosphere from gaseous precursors; dry mass).

AERmon.mmrss.comment: Mass fraction in the atmosphere of sea salt aerosol (dry mass).

AERmon.n2o.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.   The chemical formula of  nitrous oxide is N2O.

AERmon.nh50.comment: Fixed surface layer mixing ratio over 30o-50oN (100ppbv), uniform fixed 50-day exponential decay.

AERmon.no.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

AERmon.no2.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

AERmon.o3.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

AERmon.o3inst.comment: This is the mole fraction of ozone in air, sampled on the first day of the month as an instantaneous field.

AERmon.o3loss.comment: ONLY provide the sum of the following reactions: (i) O(1D)+H2O; (ii) O3+HO2; (iii) O3+OH; (iv) O3+alkenes (isoprene, ethene,...)

AERmon.o3prod.comment: ONLY provide the sum of all the HO2/RO2 + NO reactions (as k\*[HO2]\*[NO])

AERmon.o3ste.long_name: Stratospheric Ozone Tracer Volume Mixing Ratio
AERmon.o3ste.comment: Ozone tracer intended to map out strat-trop exchange (STE) of ozone.

AERmon.od440aer.comment: AOD from the ambient aerosls (i.e., includes aerosol water).  Does not include AOD from stratospheric aerosols if these are prescribed but includes other possible background aerosol types. Needs a comment attribute "wavelength: 440 nm"

AERmon.od550aer.comment: AOD from ambient aerosols (i.e., includes aerosol water).  Does not include AOD from stratospheric aerosols if these are prescribed but includes other possible background aerosol types. Needs a comment attribute "wavelength: 550 nm"

AERmon.od550bb.long_name: Aerosol Optical Depth at 550nm Due to Biomass Burning
AERmon.od550bb.comment: total organic aerosol AOD due to biomass burning (excluding so4, nitrate BB components)

AERmon.od550bc.comment: Total aerosol AOD due to black carbon aerosol at a wavelength of 550 nanometres.

AERmon.od550csaer.comment: AOD from the ambient aerosols in clear skies if od550aer is for all-sky (i.e., includes aerosol water).  Does not include AOD from stratospheric aerosols if these are prescribed but includes other possible background aerosol types. Needs a comment attribute "wavelength: 550 nm"

AERmon.od550dust.comment: Total aerosol AOD due to dust aerosol at a wavelength of 550 nanometres.

AERmon.od550lt1aer.long_name: Ambient Fine Aerosol Optical Depth at 550nm
AERmon.od550lt1aer.comment: od550 due to particles with wet diameter less than 1 um  ("ambient" means "wetted"). When models do not include explicit size information, it can be assumed that all anthropogenic aerosols and natural secondary aerosols have diameter less than 1 um.

AERmon.od550no3.comment: Total aerosol AOD due to nitrate aerosol at a wavelength of 550 nanometres.

AERmon.od550oa.long_name: Total Organic Aerosol Optical Depth at 550nm
AERmon.od550oa.comment: total organic aerosol AOD, comprises all organic aerosols, primary + secondary ; natural + anthropogenic including biomasss burning organic aerosol

AERmon.od550so4.comment: Total aerosol AOD due to sulfate aerosol at a wavelength of 550 nanometres.

AERmon.od550soa.long_name: Particulate Organic Aerosol Optical Depth at 550nm
AERmon.od550soa.comment: total organic aerosol AOD due to secondary aerosol formation

AERmon.od550ss.comment: Total aerosol AOD due to sea salt aerosol at a wavelength of 550 nanometres.

AERmon.od870aer.comment: AOD from the ambient aerosls (i.e., includes aerosol water).  Does not include AOD from stratospheric aerosols if these are prescribed but includes other possible background aerosol types. Needs a comment attribute "wavelength: 870 nm"

AERmon.oh.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

AERmon.pan.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

AERmon.pfull.comment: The atmospheric pressure at the model layer midpoints for all times and levels in the associated output variables

AERmon.phalf.comment: The atmospheric pressure at the model layer interfaces for all times and levels in the associated output variables

AERmon.photo1d.long_name: Photolysis Rate of Ozone (O3) to Excited Atomic Oxygen (the Singlet D State, O1D)

AERmon.pod0.comment: Accumulated stomatal ozone flux over the threshold of 0 mol m-2 s-1; Computation: Time Integral of (hourly above canopy ozone concentration \* stomatal conductance \* Rc/(Rb+Rc) )

AERmon.ps.comment: Surface Pressure .. needed for vertical coordinates

AERmon.ptp.comment: 2D monthly mean thermal tropopause calculated using WMO tropopause definition on 3d temperature

AERmon.reffclwtop.comment: Droplets are liquid only.  This is the effective radius "as seen from space" over liquid cloudy portion of grid cell. This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, or for some models it is the sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere.TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean. Reported values are weighted by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.

AERmon.rluscsaf.long_name: Surface Upwelling Clear-Sky, Aerosol-Free Longwave Radiation
AERmon.rluscsaf.comment: Flux corresponding to rluscs resulting fom aerosol-free call to radiation

AERmon.rlutaf.comment: Flux corresponding to rlut resulting fom aerosol-free call to radiation

AERmon.rlutch4ref.long_name: TOA outgoing longwave flux assuming reference methane field
AERmon.rlutch4ref.comment: This is the outgoing longwave flux at the top-of-atmosphere for all-sky conditions from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme using a reference methane field

AERmon.rlutcsaf.long_name: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky, Aerosol-Free Longwave Radiation
AERmon.rlutcsaf.comment: Flux corresponding to rlutcs resulting fom aerosol-free call to radiation

AERmon.rlutcsch4ref.long_name: TOA outgoing longwave flux assuming clear sky and reference methane field
AERmon.rlutcsch4ref.comment: This is the outgoing longwave flux at the top-of-atmosphere for clear-sky conditions from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme with a reference methane field

AERmon.rlutcso3ref.long_name: TOA outgoing longwave flux assuming clear sky and reference ozone field
AERmon.rlutcso3ref.comment: This is the outgoing longwave flux at the top-of-atmosphere for clear-sky conditions from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme using a reference ozone field

AERmon.rluto3ref.comment: This is outgoing longwave flux at the top-of-atmosphere for all-sky conditions from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme using a reference ozone field

AERmon.rsutaf.comment: Flux corresponding to rsut resulting fom aerosol-free call to radiation

AERmon.rsutch4ref.long_name: TOA outgoing shortwave flux assuming reference methane
AERmon.rsutch4ref.comment: This is the outgoing shortwave flux at the top-of-atmosphere for all-sky conditions from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme with a reference methane field

AERmon.rsutcsaf.long_name: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky, Aerosol-Free Shortwave Radiation
AERmon.rsutcsaf.comment: Flux corresponding to rsutcs resulting fom aerosol-free call to radiation

AERmon.rsutcsch4ref.long_name: TOA outgoing shortwave flux assuming clear-sky and reference methane field
AERmon.rsutcsch4ref.comment: This is the outgoing shortwave flux at the top-of-atmosphere for clear-sky conditions from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme with a reference methane field

AERmon.rsutcso3ref.long_name: TOA shortwave flux assuming clear sky and reference ozone
AERmon.rsutcso3ref.comment: This represents the top-of-atmosphere outgoing shortwave radiative flux assuming clear-sky conditions when a reference ozone field is used in a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme

AERmon.rsuto3ref.long_name: TOA shortwave flux assuming reference ozone field
AERmon.rsuto3ref.comment: This is top-of-atmosphere shortwave flux for all-sky conditions from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme, using a reference ozone field

AERmon.so2.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

AERmon.stratch4loss.long_name: Loss of Stratospheric Methane by all chemical destruction
AERmon.stratch4loss.comment: This is the loss rate of stratospheric methane by all chemical destruction. The distinction between the stratosphere and troposphere should be consistent with the tropopause as used in the calculation of the tropopause pressure (ptp).

AERmon.tatp.comment: 2D monthly mean thermal tropopause calculated using WMO tropopause definition on 3d temperature

AERmon.tntrl.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Longwave Radiative Heating

AERmon.tntrs.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Shortwave Radiative Heating

AERmon.tropch4loss.long_name: Loss of Tropospheric Methane by all chemical destruction
AERmon.tropch4loss.comment: This is the loss rate of tropospheric methane by all chemical destruction. The distinction between stratosphere and troposphere should be consistent with the tropopause used in the calculation of the tropopause pressure (ptp).

AERmon.tropch4lossoh.long_name: Tropospheric loss of methane by OH
AERmon.tropch4lossoh.comment: This is the loss rate of tropospheric methane due to reaction with the hydroxy (OH) radical. The distinction between stratosphere and troposphere should be consistent with the tropopause used to calculate the pressure of the tropopause (ptp).

AERmon.tropdo3chm.long_name: Net Chemistry Tendency of O3 in troposphere
AERmon.tropdo3chm.comment: This is the net chemical tendency of ozone in the troposphere. The distinction between the stratosphere and troposphere should be consistent with the definition of the tropopause used in the calculation of the tropopause pressure (ptp).

AERmon.tropo3ste.long_name: Tropospheric ozone volume mixing ratio due to stratosphere-troposphere exchange (STE)
AERmon.tropo3ste.comment: Ozone tracer intended to map out strat-trop exchange (STE) of ozone in the troposphere. It represents the ozone volume mixing ratio in the troposphere that is considered to be stratospheric in origin. It should be consistent with definition of tropopause used to calculate the pressure of the tropopause (ptp). It should have zero values in the stratosphere and non-zero positive values in the troposphere.

AERmon.tropoz.comment: Tropospheric ozone column, should be consistent with definition of tropopause used to calculate the pressure of the tropopause (ptp).

AERmon.ttop.comment: cloud_top refers to the top of the highest cloud. Air temperature is the bulk temperature of the air, not the surface (skin) temperature.

AERmon.ua.comment: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).

AERmon.va.comment: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).

AERmon.wa.comment: A velocity is a vector quantity. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). Upward air velocity is the vertical component of the 3D air velocity vector. The standard name downward_air_velocity may be used for a vector component with the opposite sign convention.

AERmon.wetbc.long_name: Wet Deposition Rate of Black Carbon Aerosol Mass
AERmon.wetbc.comment: Surface deposition rate of black carbon (dry mass) due to wet processes

AERmon.wetdust.comment: Surface deposition rate of dust (dry mass) due to wet processes

AERmon.wethno3.comment: This is the loss rate of nitric acid (HNO3) from the atmosphere due to wet deposition

AERmon.wetnh3.comment: Surface deposition rate of ammonia (NH3) due to wet processes

AERmon.wetnh4.comment: Surface deposition rate of ammonium (NH4) due to wet processes

AERmon.wetno3.comment: This is the loss rate of nitrate aerosol from the atmosphere due to wet deposition

AERmon.wetnoy.long_name: Wet Deposition Rate of NOy Including Aerosol Nitrate
AERmon.wetnoy.comment: NOy is the sum of all simulated oxidized nitrogen species, out of NO, NO2, HNO3, HNO4, NO3aerosol, NO3(radical), N2O5, PAN, other organic nitrates.

AERmon.wetoa.long_name: Wet Deposition Rate of Dry Aerosol Total Organic Matter
AERmon.wetoa.comment: Deposition rate of organic matter in aerosols (measured by the dry mass) due to wet processes

AERmon.wetso2.comment: Deposition rate of sulfur dioxide due to wet processes

AERmon.wetss.long_name: Wet Deposition Rate of Sea-Salt Aerosol
AERmon.wetss.comment: Deposition rate of sea salt aerosols (measured by the dry mass) due to wet processes

AERmon.zg.comment: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.

AERmon.ztp.comment: 2D monthly mean thermal tropopause calculated using WMO tropopause definition on 3d temperature

AERmonZ.bry.long_name: Total Inorganic Bromine Volume Mixing Ratio
AERmonZ.bry.comment: Total family (the sum of all appropriate species in the model) ; list the species in the netCDF header, e.g. Bry = Br + BrO + HOBr + HBr + BrONO2 + BrCl Definition: Total inorganic bromine (e.g., HBr and inorganic bromine oxides and radicals (e.g., BrO, atomic bromine (Br), bromine nitrate (BrONO2)) resulting from degradation of bromine-containing organicsource gases (halons, methyl bromide, VSLS), and natural inorganic bromine sources (e.g., volcanoes, sea salt, and other aerosols) add comment attribute with detailed description about how the model calculates these fields

AERmonZ.ch4.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

AERmonZ.cly.long_name: Total Inorganic Chlorine Volume Mixing Ratio
AERmonZ.cly.comment: Total family (the sum of all appropriate species in the model) ; list the species in the netCDF header, e.g. Cly = HCl + ClONO2 + HOCl + ClO + Cl + 2\*Cl2O2 +2Cl2 + OClO + BrCl Definition: Total inorganic stratospheric chlorine (e.g., HCl, ClO) resulting from degradation of chlorine-containing source gases (CFCs, HCFCs, VSLS), and natural inorganic chlorine sources (e.g., sea salt and other aerosols) add comment attribute with detailed description about how the model calculates these fields

AERmonZ.hcl.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  The chemical formula of hydrogen chloride is HCl.

AERmonZ.hno3.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

AERmonZ.ho2.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  The chemical formula of hydroperoxyl radical is HO2.

AERmonZ.meanage.comment: The mean age of air is defined as the mean time that a stratospheric air mass has been out of contact with the well-mixed troposphere.

AERmonZ.n2o.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.   The chemical formula of  nitrous oxide is N2O.

AERmonZ.noy.long_name: Total Reactive Nitrogen Volume Mixing Ratio
AERmonZ.noy.comment: Total family (the sum of all appropriate species in the model); list the species in the netCDF header, e.g. NOy = N + NO + NO2 + NO3 + HNO3 + 2N2O5 + HNO4 + ClONO2 + BrONO2 Definition: Total reactive nitrogen; usually includes atomic nitrogen (N), nitric oxide (NO), NO2, nitrogen trioxide (NO3), dinitrogen radical (N2O5), nitric acid (HNO3), peroxynitric acid (HNO4), BrONO2, ClONO2 add comment attribute with detailed description about how the model calculates these fields

AERmonZ.o3.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

AERmonZ.oh.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

AERmonZ.ua.comment: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).

AERmonZ.va.comment: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).

AERmonZ.vt100.comment: Zonally averaged eddy temperature flux at 100hPa as monthly means derived from daily (or higher frequency) fields.

AERmonZ.zg.comment: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.

Amon.aod550volso4.long_name: Monthly Aerosol Optical Depth at 550nm Due to Stratospheric Volcanic Aerosols
Amon.aod550volso4.comment: monthly averaged aerosol optical thickness at 550 nm due to stratospheric volcanic aerosols

Amon.ccb.cell_methods: area: time: mean where convective_cloud (weighted by total convective cloud area)
Amon.ccb.long_name: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Base
Amon.ccb.comment: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud base altitude should be that of the bottom of the lowest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.

Amon.cct.cell_methods: area: time: mean where convective_cloud (weighted by total convective cloud area)
Amon.cct.long_name: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Top
Amon.cct.comment: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud top altitude should be that of the top of the highest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.

Amon.cfc113global.cell_methods: height: sum (through atmospheric column) area: sum time: mean
Amon.cfc113global.long_name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CFC113
Amon.cfc113global.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  The chemical formula of CFC113 is CCl2FCClF2.  The IUPAC name for CFC113 is 1,1,2-trichloro-1,2,2-trifluoro-ethane.

Amon.cfc11global.cell_methods: height: sum (through atmospheric column) area: sum time: mean
Amon.cfc11global.long_name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CFC11
Amon.cfc11global.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  The chemical formula of CFC11 is CFCl3.  The IUPAC name for CFC11 is trichloro-fluoro-methane.

Amon.cfc12global.cell_methods: height: sum (through atmospheric column) area: sum time: mean
Amon.cfc12global.long_name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CFC12
Amon.cfc12global.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  The chemical formula of CFC12 is CF2Cl2.  The IUPAC name for CFC12 is dichloro-difluoro-methane.

Amon.ch4.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Amon.ch4Clim.cell_methods: area: mean where air time: mean within years time: mean over years
Amon.ch4Clim.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Amon.ch4global.cell_methods: height: sum (through atmospheric column) area: sum time: mean
Amon.ch4global.long_name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CH4
Amon.ch4global.comment: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CH4

Amon.ch4globalClim.cell_methods: height: sum (through atmospheric column) area: sum time: mean within years time: mean over years
Amon.ch4globalClim.long_name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CH4
Amon.ch4globalClim.comment: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CH4

Amon.ci.long_name: Fraction of Time Convection Occurs in Cell
Amon.ci.comment: Fraction of time that convection occurs in the grid cell .

Amon.cl.comment: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

Amon.cli.comment: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.  This is calculated as the mass of cloud ice in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell. It includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

Amon.clivi.comment: mass of ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating frozen hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

Amon.clt.comment: for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Include both large-scale and convective cloud.

Amon.clw.long_name: Mass Fraction of Cloud Liquid Water
Amon.clw.comment: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.  Calculate as the mass of cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cells. Precipitating hydrometeors are included ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

Amon.clwvi.comment: mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

Amon.co2.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Amon.co2Clim.cell_methods: area: mean where air time: mean within years time: mean over years
Amon.co2Clim.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Amon.co2mass.cell_methods: height: sum (through atmospheric column) area: sum time: mean
Amon.co2mass.comment: Total atmospheric mass of Carbon Dioxide

Amon.co2massCLim.cell_methods: height: sum (through atmospheric column) area: sum time: mean within years time: mean over years
Amon.co2massCLim.comment: Total atmospheric mass of Carbon Dioxide

Amon.evspsbl.comment: at surface; flux of water into the atmosphere due to conversion of both liquid and solid phases to vapor (from underlying surface and vegetation)

Amon.fco2antt.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to All Anthropogenic Emissions of CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
Amon.fco2antt.comment: This is requested only for the emission-driven coupled carbon climate model runs.  Does not include natural fire sources but, includes all anthropogenic sources, including fossil fuel use, cement production, agricultural burning, and sources associated with anthropogenic land use change excluding forest regrowth.

Amon.fco2fos.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Fossil Fuel Emissions of CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
Amon.fco2fos.comment: This is the prescribed anthropogenic CO2 flux from fossil fuel use, including cement production, and flaring (but not from land-use changes, agricultural burning, forest regrowth, etc.)

Amon.fco2nat.long_name: Surface Carbon Mass Flux into the Atmosphere Due to Natural Sources [kgC m-2 s-1]
Amon.fco2nat.comment: This is what the atmosphere sees (on its own grid).  This field should be equivalent to the combined natural fluxes of carbon (requested in the L_mon and O_mon tables) that account for natural exchanges between the atmosphere and land or ocean reservoirs (i.e., "net ecosystem biospheric productivity", for land, and "air to sea CO2 flux", for ocean.)

Amon.hcfc22global.cell_methods: height: sum (through atmospheric column) area: sum time: mean
Amon.hcfc22global.long_name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of HCFC22
Amon.hcfc22global.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  A chemical species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The chemical formula for HCFC22 is CHClF2.  The IUPAC name for HCFC22 is chloro-difluoro-methane.

Amon.hfss.comment: The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.

Amon.hur.comment: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

Amon.hurs.comment: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

Amon.hus.comment: Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air.

Amon.mc.comment: The net mass flux should represent the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.  The flux is computed as the mass divided by the area of the grid cell.

Amon.n2o.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.   The chemical formula of  nitrous oxide is N2O.

Amon.n2oClim.cell_methods: area: mean where air time: mean within years time: mean over years
Amon.n2oClim.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.   The chemical formula of  nitrous oxide is N2O.

Amon.n2oglobal.cell_methods: height: sum (through atmospheric column) area: sum time: mean
Amon.n2oglobal.long_name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O

Amon.n2oglobalClim.cell_methods: height: sum (through atmospheric column) area: sum time: mean within years time: mean over years
Amon.n2oglobalClim.long_name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O

Amon.o3.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Amon.o3Clim.cell_methods: area: mean where air time: mean within years time: mean over years
Amon.o3Clim.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Amon.pfull.cell_methods: area: mean time: mean within years time: mean over years

Amon.phalf.cell_methods: area: mean time: mean within years time: mean over years

Amon.pr.comment: at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases from all types of clouds (both large-scale and convective)

Amon.prc.comment: at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases.

Amon.prra.comment: rainfall flux at surface; includes precipitation of all forms of water in the liquid phase

Amon.prsn.comment: at surface; includes precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase

Amon.prw.comment: vertically integrated through the atmospheric column

Amon.ps.comment: not, in general, the same as mean sea-level pressure

Amon.psl.comment: not, in general, the same as surface pressure

Amon.rlds.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean "net downward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Amon.rlus.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Amon.rlut.comment: at the top of the atmosphere (to be compared with satellite measurements)

Amon.rlutcs.comment: Upwelling clear-sky longwave radiation at top of atmosphere

Amon.rsds.comment: Surface solar irradiance for UV calculations.

Amon.rsdscs.comment: Surface solar irradiance clear sky for UV calculations

Amon.rsdt.comment: at the top of the atmosphere

Amon.rsus.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "shortwave" means shortwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Amon.rsut.comment: at the top of the atmosphere

Amon.rsutcs.comment: Calculated in the absence of clouds.

Amon.rtmt.long_name: Net Downward Radiative Flux at Top of Model
Amon.rtmt.comment: i.e., at the top of that portion of the atmosphere where dynamics are explicitly treated by the model. This is reported only if it differs from the net downward radiative flux at the top of the atmosphere.

Amon.sbl.long_name: Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux
Amon.sbl.comment: The snow and ice sublimation flux is the loss of snow and ice mass from the surface resulting from their conversion to water vapor that enters the atmosphere.

Amon.sci.long_name: Fraction of Time Shallow Convection Occurs
Amon.sci.comment: Fraction of time that shallow convection occurs in the grid cell.

Amon.sfcWind.comment: This is the mean of the speed, not the speed computed from the mean u and v components of wind

Amon.tasmax.cell_methods: area: mean time: maximum within days time: mean over days
Amon.tasmax.comment: monthly mean of the daily-maximum near-surface air temperature.

Amon.tasmin.cell_methods: area: mean time: minimum within days time: mean over days
Amon.tasmin.comment: monthly mean of the daily-minimum near-surface air temperature.

Amon.tauu.comment: Downward eastward wind stress at the surface

Amon.tauv.comment: Downward northward wind stress at the surface

Amon.thetao.long_name: 17C Depth of Isosurface of Sea Water Potential Temperature
Amon.thetao.comment: The depth of the 17°C isosurface of sea water potential temperature serves as the threshold for the survival of various fish species.

Amon.ua.comment: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).

Amon.uas.comment: Eastward component of the near-surface (usually, 10 meters)  wind

Amon.va.comment: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).

Amon.vas.comment: Northward component of the near surface wind

Amon.wap.comment: commonly referred to as "omega", this represents the vertical component of velocity in pressure coordinates (positive down)

Amon.zg.comment: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.

CF3hr.clic.long_name: Mass Fraction of Convective Cloud Ice
CF3hr.clic.comment: Calculated as the mass of convective cloud ice  in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

CF3hr.clis.long_name: Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice
CF3hr.clis.comment: Calculate as the mass of stratiform cloud ice  in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  Include precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

CF3hr.clivi.comment: mass of ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating frozen hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

CF3hr.clt.comment: for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Include both large-scale and convective cloud.

CF3hr.clwc.long_name: Mass Fraction of Convective Cloud Liquid Water
CF3hr.clwc.comment: Calculated as the mass of convective cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

CF3hr.clws.long_name: Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water
CF3hr.clws.comment: Calculated as the mass of stratiform cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

CF3hr.clwvi.comment: mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

CF3hr.dtauc.comment: This is the in-cloud optical depth obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell

CF3hr.dtaus.comment: This is the in-cloud optical depth obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell.

CF3hr.hurs.comment: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

CF3hr.pr.comment: at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases from all types of clouds (both large-scale and convective)

CF3hr.prw.comment: vertically integrated through the atmospheric column

CF3hr.reffclic.long_name: Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Convective Cloud Ice
CF3hr.reffclic.comment: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).

CF3hr.reffclis.long_name: Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Stratiform Cloud Ice
CF3hr.reffclis.comment: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).

CF3hr.reffclwc.long_name: Convective Cloud Liquid Droplet Effective Radius
CF3hr.reffclwc.comment: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).

CF3hr.reffclws.long_name: Stratiform Cloud Liquid Droplet Effective Radius
CF3hr.reffclws.comment: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).

CF3hr.rlds.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean "net downward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

CF3hr.rlut.comment: at the top of the atmosphere (to be compared with satellite measurements)

CF3hr.rlutcs.comment: Upwelling clear-sky longwave radiation at top of atmosphere

CF3hr.rsds.comment: Surface solar irradiance for UV calculations.

CF3hr.rsdscs.comment: Surface solar irradiance clear sky for UV calculations

CF3hr.rsut.comment: at the top of the atmosphere

CF3hr.rsutcs.comment: Calculated in the absence of clouds.

CFday.albisccp.comment: time-means are weighted by the ISCCP Total Cloud Fraction - see  <http://cfmip.metoffice.com/COSP.html>

CFday.ccb.cell_methods: area: time: mean where convective_cloud (weighted by total convective cloud area)
CFday.ccb.long_name: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Base
CFday.ccb.comment: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud base altitude should be that of the bottom of the lowest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.

CFday.cct.cell_methods: area: time: mean where convective_cloud (weighted by total convective cloud area)
CFday.cct.long_name: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Top
CFday.cct.comment: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud top altitude should be that of the top of the highest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.

CFday.cl.comment: Percentage cloud cover, including both large-scale and convective cloud.

CFday.clcalipso.comment: Percentage cloud cover in CALIPSO standard atmospheric layers.

CFday.clhcalipso.long_name: CALIPSO High Level Cloud Area Percentage
CFday.clhcalipso.comment: Percentage cloud cover in layer centred on 220hPa

CFday.cli.comment: Calculated as the mass of cloud ice  in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

CFday.clisccp.comment: Percentage cloud cover in optical depth categories.

CFday.clivi.comment: calculate mass of ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). This includes precipitating frozen hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

CFday.cllcalipso.long_name: CALIPSO Low Level Cloud Cover Percentage
CFday.cllcalipso.comment: Percentage cloud cover in layer centred on 840hPa

CFday.clmcalipso.long_name: CALIPSO Mid Level Cloud Cover Percentage
CFday.clmcalipso.comment: Percentage cloud cover in layer centred on 560hPa

CFday.cltcalipso.comment: Total cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen by the  Cloud-Aerosol Lidar and Infrared Pathfinder Satellite Observation (CALIPSO) instrument. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

CFday.cltisccp.comment: Total cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen by the International Satellite Cloud Climatology Project (ISCCP) analysis. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.  (MODIS). Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

CFday.clw.long_name: Mass Fraction of Cloud Liquid Water
CFday.clw.comment: Calculated as the mass of  cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

CFday.clwvi.comment: calculate mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

CFday.hur.comment: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

CFday.hus.comment: Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air.

CFday.mc.comment: The net mass flux should represent the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.  This is calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).

CFday.pctisccp.comment: time-means are weighted by the ISCCP Total Cloud Fraction - see  <http://cfmip.metoffice.com/COSP.html>

CFday.ps.comment: surface pressure (not mean sea-level pressure), 2-D field to calculate the 3-D pressure field from hybrid coordinates

CFday.rlutcs.comment: Upwelling clear-sky longwave radiation at top of atmosphere

CFday.rsdscs.comment: Surface solar irradiance clear sky for UV calculations

CFday.rsdt.comment: Shortwave radiation incident at the top of the atmosphere

CFday.rsut.comment: at the top of the atmosphere

CFday.rsutcs.comment: Calculated in the absence of clouds.

CFday.ua.comment: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).

CFday.va.comment: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).

CFday.wap.comment: commonly referred to as "omega", this represents the vertical component of velocity in pressure coordinates (positive down)

CFday.wap500.comment: at 500 hPa level; commonly referred to as "omega", this represents the vertical component of velocity in pressure coordinates (positive down)

CFday.zg.comment: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.

CFmon.albisccp.comment: time-means weighted by the ISCCP Total Cloud Fraction - see <http://cfmip.metoffice.com/COSP.html>

CFmon.clcalipso.comment: Percentage cloud cover in CALIPSO standard atmospheric layers.

CFmon.clhcalipso.long_name: CALIPSO High Level Cloud Area Percentage
CFmon.clhcalipso.comment: Percentage cloud cover in layer centred on 220hPa

CFmon.clic.long_name: Mass Fraction of Convective Cloud Ice
CFmon.clic.comment: Calculated as the mass of convective cloud ice  in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

CFmon.clis.long_name: Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice
CFmon.clis.comment: Calculated as the mass of stratiform cloud ice  in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

CFmon.clisccp.comment: Percentage cloud cover in optical depth categories.

CFmon.clivimodis.comment: Mass of ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column) as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator.

CFmon.cllcalipso.long_name: CALIPSO Low Level Cloud Cover Percentage
CFmon.cllcalipso.comment: Percentage cloud cover in layer centred on 840hPa

CFmon.clmcalipso.long_name: CALIPSO Mid Level Cloud Cover Percentage
CFmon.clmcalipso.comment: Percentage cloud cover in layer centred on 560hPa

CFmon.clmodis.comment: Percentage of total cloud cover in optical depth categories, as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator. Dimensions of tau (optical depth) and cloud-top pressure are the same used by the ISCCP instrument simulator. This is the equivalent MODIS version of the ISCCP _clisccp _variable.

CFmon.clmodisice.long_name: MODIS Ice Topped Cloud Area Fraction
CFmon.clmodisice.comment: Percentage ice-cloud cover in optical depth categories, as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator. Dimensions of tau (optical depth) and cloud-top pressure are the same as used by clisccp output from the ISCCP satellite simulator.

CFmon.clmodisice_dup.long_name: MODIS Ice Topped Cloud Area Fraction
CFmon.clmodisice_dup.comment: Percentage ice-cloud cover as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator. Dimensions of cloud IWP (cloud ice water path) and r_eff (effective droplet size).

CFmon.clmodisliquid.long_name: MODIS Liquid Topped Cloud Area Fraction
CFmon.clmodisliquid.comment: Percentage liquid-cloud cover in optical depth categories, as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator. Dimensions of tau (optical depth) and cloud-top pressure are the same used by clisccp (ISCCP simulator).

CFmon.clmodisliquid_dup.long_name: MODIS Liquid Topped Cloud Area Fraction
CFmon.clmodisliquid_dup.comment: Percentage liquid-cloud cover as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator. Dimensions of LWP (cloud liquid water path) and r_eff (droplet effective radius).

CFmon.cls.comment: Cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column due to stratiform clouds, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

CFmon.cltcalipso.comment: Total cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen by the  Cloud-Aerosol Lidar and Infrared Pathfinder Satellite Observation (CALIPSO) instrument. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

CFmon.cltisccp.comment: Total cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen by the International Satellite Cloud Climatology Project (ISCCP) analysis. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.  (MODIS). Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

CFmon.cltmodis.comment: Percentage of total cloud cover as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator.

CFmon.clwc.long_name: Mass Fraction of Convective Cloud Liquid Water
CFmon.clwc.comment: Calculated as the mass of convective cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

CFmon.clws.long_name: Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water
CFmon.clws.comment: Calculated as the mass of stratiform cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

CFmon.clwvimodis.comment: Mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column) as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator.
