CFmon.dmc.comment: The net mass flux  represents the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.   This is calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).

CFmon.edt.comment: Vertical diffusion coefficient for temperature due to parametrised eddies

CFmon.evu.comment: Vertical diffusion coefficient for momentum due to parametrised eddies

CFmon.hur.comment: The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

CFmon.hus.comment: Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air.

CFmon.mcd.comment: Calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).

CFmon.mcu.comment: Calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).

CFmon.pctisccp.comment: time-means weighted by the ISCCP Total Cloud Fraction - see <http://cfmip.metoffice.com/COSP.html>

CFmon.ps.comment: Surface Pressure .. needed for vertical coordinates

CFmon.rld.comment: Includes also the fluxes at the surface and TOA.

CFmon.rld4co2.comment: Downwelling longwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

CFmon.rldcs.comment: Includes also the fluxes at the surface and TOA.

CFmon.rldcs4co2.comment: Downwelling clear-sky longwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

CFmon.rlu.comment: Includes also the fluxes at the surface and TOA.

CFmon.rlu4co2.comment: Upwelling longwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

CFmon.rlucs.comment: Includes also the fluxes at the surface and TOA.

CFmon.rlucs4co2.comment: Upwelling clear-sky longwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

CFmon.rlut4co2.comment: Top-of-atmosphere outgoing longwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold

CFmon.rlutcs4co2.long_name: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Longwave Radiation 4XCO2 Atmosphere
CFmon.rlutcs4co2.comment: Top-of-atmosphere outgoing clear-sky longwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold

CFmon.rsd.comment: Includes also the fluxes at the surface and TOA.

CFmon.rsd4co2.comment: Downwelling shortwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold

CFmon.rsdcs.comment: Includes also the fluxes at the surface and TOA.

CFmon.rsdcs4co2.comment: Downwelling clear-sky shortwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold

CFmon.rsu.comment: Includes also the fluxes at the surface and TOA.

CFmon.rsu4co2.comment: Upwelling Shortwave Radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold

CFmon.rsucs.comment: Includes also the fluxes at the surface and TOA.

CFmon.rsucs4co2.comment: Upwelling clear-sky shortwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold

CFmon.rsut4co2.long_name: TOA Outgoing Shortwave Radiation in 4XCO2 Atmosphere
CFmon.rsut4co2.comment: TOA Outgoing Shortwave Radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold

CFmon.rsutcs4co2.long_name: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation 4XCO2 Atmosphere
CFmon.rsutcs4co2.comment: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold

CFmon.smc.comment: The net mass flux represents the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.  For models with a distinct shallow convection scheme, this is calculated as convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).

CFmon.tnhusa.long_name: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Advection
CFmon.tnhusa.comment: Tendency of Specific Humidity due to Advection

CFmon.tnhusc.long_name: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Convection

CFmon.tnhusd.long_name: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Numerical Diffusion
CFmon.tnhusd.comment: This includes any horizontal or vertical numerical moisture diffusion not associated with the parametrized moist physics or the resolved dynamics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be excluded, as should any diffusion which is included in the terms from the resolved dynamics.   This term is required to check the closure of the moisture budget.

CFmon.tnhusmp.long_name: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Model Physics
CFmon.tnhusmp.comment: This includes sources and sinks from parametrized moist physics (e.g. convection, boundary layer, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.) and excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics or from horizontal or vertical numerical diffusion not associated with model physicsl.  For example any diffusive mixing by the boundary layer scheme would be included.

CFmon.tnhusscpbl.long_name: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Stratiform Cloud and Precipitation and Boundary Layer Mixing
CFmon.tnhusscpbl.comment: To be specified only in  models which do not separate budget terms for stratiform cloud, precipitation and boundary layer schemes.  Includes all bounday layer terms including and diffusive terms.

CFmon.tnta.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Advection
CFmon.tnta.comment: Tendency of Air Temperature due to Advection

CFmon.tntc.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Convection

CFmon.tntmp.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Model Physics
CFmon.tntmp.comment: This includes sources and sinks from parametrized physics (e.g. radiation, convection, boundary layer, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.). It excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics and numerical diffusion not associated with parametrized physics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be included, while numerical diffusion applied in addition to physics or resolved dynamics should be excluded.  This term is required to check the closure of the heat budget.

CFmon.tntr.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Radiative Heating
CFmon.tntr.comment: Tendency of Air Temperature due to Radiative Heating

CFmon.tntscpbl.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Stratiform Cloud and Precipitation and Boundary Layer Mixing
CFmon.tntscpbl.comment: To be specified only in  models which do not separate cloud, precipitation and boundary layer terms.  Includes all boundary layer terms including diffusive ones.

CFsubhr.ccb.long_name: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Base
CFsubhr.ccb.comment: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud base altitude should be that of the bottom of the lowest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.

CFsubhr.cct.long_name: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Top
CFsubhr.cct.comment: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud top altitude should be that of the top of the highest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.

CFsubhr.ci.long_name: Fraction of Time Convection Occurs in Cell
CFsubhr.ci.comment: Fraction of time that convection occurs in the grid cell .

CFsubhr.cl.comment: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

CFsubhr.cli.comment: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud. This is the mass of  cloud ice  in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

CFsubhr.clivi.comment: mass of ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating frozen hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

CFsubhr.clt.comment: for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Include both large-scale and convective cloud.

CFsubhr.clw.long_name: Mass Fraction of Cloud Liquid Water
CFsubhr.clw.comment: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.  This is the mass of  cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

CFsubhr.clwvi.comment: mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

CFsubhr.edt.comment: Vertical diffusion coefficient for temperature due to parametrised eddies

CFsubhr.evspsbl.comment: at surface; flux of water into the atmosphere due to conversion of both liquid and solid phases to vapor (from underlying surface and vegetation)

CFsubhr.evu.comment: Vertical diffusion coefficient for momentum due to parametrised eddies

CFsubhr.fco2antt.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to All Anthropogenic Emissions of CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
CFsubhr.fco2antt.comment: This is requested only for the emission-driven coupled carbon climate model runs.  Does not include natural fire sources but, includes all anthropogenic sources, including fossil fuel use, cement production, agricultural burning, and sources associated with anthropogenic land use change excluding forest regrowth.

CFsubhr.fco2fos.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Fossil Fuel Emissions of CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
CFsubhr.fco2fos.comment: This is the prescribed anthropogenic CO2 flux from fossil fuel use, including cement production, and flaring (but not from land-use changes, agricultural burning, forest regrowth, etc.)

CFsubhr.fco2nat.long_name: Surface Carbon Mass Flux into the Atmosphere Due to Natural Sources [kgC m-2 s-1]
CFsubhr.fco2nat.comment: This is what the atmosphere sees (on its own grid).  This field should be equivalent to the combined natural fluxes of carbon (requested in the L_mon and O_mon tables) that account for natural exchanges between the atmosphere and land or ocean reservoirs (i.e., "net ecosystem biospheric productivity", for land, and "air to sea CO2 flux", for ocean.)

CFsubhr.hfss.comment: The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.

CFsubhr.hur.comment: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

CFsubhr.hurs.comment: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

CFsubhr.hus.comment: Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air.

CFsubhr.mc.comment: The net mass flux should represent the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.  This is calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the updrafts).

CFsubhr.pr.comment: at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases from all types of clouds (both large-scale and convective)

CFsubhr.prc.comment: at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases.

CFsubhr.prsn.comment: at surface; includes precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase

CFsubhr.prw.comment: vertically integrated through the atmospheric column

CFsubhr.ps.comment: not, in general, the same as mean sea-level pressure

CFsubhr.psl.comment: not, in general, the same as surface pressure

CFsubhr.rld.comment: Downwelling Longwave Radiation (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

CFsubhr.rldcs.comment: Downwelling clear-sky longwave radiation (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

CFsubhr.rlds.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean "net downward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

CFsubhr.rlu.comment: Upwelling longwave radiation (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

CFsubhr.rlucs.comment: Upwelling clear-sky longwave radiation  (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

CFsubhr.rlus.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

CFsubhr.rlut.comment: at the top of the atmosphere (to be compared with satellite measurements)

CFsubhr.rlutcs.comment: Upwelling clear-sky longwave radiation at top of atmosphere

CFsubhr.rsd.comment: Downwelling shortwave radiation (includes the fluxes at the surface and top-of-atmosphere)

CFsubhr.rsdcs.comment: Downwelling clear-sky shortwave radiation (includes the fluxes at the surface and top-of-atmosphere)

CFsubhr.rsds.comment: Surface solar irradiance for UV calculations.

CFsubhr.rsdscs.comment: Surface solar irradiance clear sky for UV calculations

CFsubhr.rsdt.comment: at the top of the atmosphere

CFsubhr.rsu.comment: Upwelling shortwave radiation  (includes also the fluxes at the surface and top of atmosphere)

CFsubhr.rsucs.comment: Upwelling clear-sky shortwave radiation  (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

CFsubhr.rsus.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "shortwave" means shortwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

CFsubhr.rsut.comment: at the top of the atmosphere

CFsubhr.rsutcs.comment: Calculated in the absence of clouds.

CFsubhr.rtmt.long_name: Net Downward Radiative Flux at Top of Model
CFsubhr.rtmt.comment: i.e., at the top of that portion of the atmosphere where dynamics are explicitly treated by the model. This is reported only if it differs from the net downward radiative flux at the top of the atmosphere.

CFsubhr.sbl.long_name: Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux
CFsubhr.sbl.comment: The snow and ice sublimation flux is the loss of snow and ice mass from the surface resulting from their conversion to water vapor that enters the atmosphere.

CFsubhr.sci.long_name: Fraction of Time Shallow Convection Occurs
CFsubhr.sci.comment: Fraction of time that shallow convection occurs in the grid cell.

CFsubhr.sfcWind.comment: This is the mean of the speed, not the speed computed from the mean u and v components of wind

CFsubhr.tauu.comment: Downward eastward wind stress at the surface

CFsubhr.tauv.comment: Downward northward wind stress at the surface

CFsubhr.tnhusa.long_name: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Advection
CFsubhr.tnhusa.comment: Tendency of Specific Humidity due to Advection

CFsubhr.tnhusc.long_name: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Convection

CFsubhr.tnhusd.long_name: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Numerical Diffusion
CFsubhr.tnhusd.comment: This includes any horizontal or vertical numerical moisture diffusion not associated with the parametrized moist physics or the resolved dynamics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be excluded, as should any diffusion which is included in the terms from the resolved dynamics.   This term is required to check the closure of the moisture budget.

CFsubhr.tnhusmp.long_name: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Model Physics
CFsubhr.tnhusmp.comment: This includes sources and sinks from parametrized moist physics (e.g. convection, boundary layer, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.) and excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics or from horizontal or vertical numerical diffusion not associated with model physicsl.  For example any diffusive mixing by the boundary layer scheme would be included.

CFsubhr.tnhusscpbl.long_name: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Stratiform Cloud and Precipitation and Boundary Layer Mixing
CFsubhr.tnhusscpbl.comment: To be specified only in  models which do not separate budget terms for stratiform cloud, precipitation and boundary layer schemes.  Includes all bounday layer terms including and diffusive terms.

CFsubhr.tnta.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Advection
CFsubhr.tnta.comment: Tendency of Air Temperature due to Advection

CFsubhr.tntc.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Convection

CFsubhr.tntmp.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Model Physics
CFsubhr.tntmp.comment: This includes sources and sinks from parametrized physics (e.g. radiation, convection, boundary layer, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.). It excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics and numerical diffusion not associated with parametrized physics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be included, while numerical diffusion applied in addition to physics or resolved dynamics should be excluded.  This term is required to check the closure of the heat budget.

CFsubhr.tntr.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Radiative Heating
CFsubhr.tntr.comment: Tendency of Air Temperature due to Radiative Heating

CFsubhr.tntscpbl.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Stratiform Cloud and Precipitation and Boundary Layer Mixing
CFsubhr.tntscpbl.comment: To be specified only in  models which do not separate cloud, precipitation and boundary layer terms.  Includes all boundary layer terms including diffusive ones.

CFsubhr.ua.comment: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).

CFsubhr.uas.comment: Eastward component of the near-surface (usually, 10 meters)  wind

CFsubhr.va.comment: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).

CFsubhr.vas.comment: Northward component of the near surface wind

CFsubhr.wap.comment: commonly referred to as "omega", this represents the vertical component of velocity in pressure coordinates (positive down)

CFsubhr.zg.comment: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.

day.clt.comment: for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

day.hfls.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface latent heat flux is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air on account of evaporation (including sublimation). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

day.hfss.comment: The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.

day.hur.comment: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

day.hurs.comment: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

day.hursmax.comment: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

day.hursmin.comment: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

day.hus.comment: Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air.

day.mrro.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
day.mrro.comment: computed as the total runoff (including "drainage" through the base of the soil model) leaving the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell.

day.mrso.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
day.mrso.comment: the mass per unit area  (summed over all soil layers) of water in all phases.

day.mrsos.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
day.mrsos.long_name: Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column
day.mrsos.comment: the mass of water in all phases in a thin surface soil layer.

day.pr.comment: at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases from all types of clouds (both large-scale and convective)

day.prc.comment: at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases.

day.prsn.comment: at surface; includes precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase

day.rlds.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean "net downward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

day.rlus.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

day.rlut.comment: at the top of the atmosphere.

day.rsds.comment: Surface solar irradiance for UV calculations.

day.rsdt.comment: As Amon.rsdt, but at daily resolution

day.rsus.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "shortwave" means shortwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

day.rsut.comment: As Amon.rsut, but at daily resolution.

day.sfcWindmax.comment: Daily maximum near-surface (usually, 10 meters) wind speed.

day.snc.comment: Percentage of each grid cell that is occupied by snow that rests on land portion of cell.

day.snw.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
day.snw.comment: the mass of surface snow on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell; reported as missing where the land fraction is 0; excludes snow on vegetation canopy or on sea ice.

day.tasmax.comment: maximum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell_method attribute "time: max")

day.tasmin.comment: minimum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell_method attribute "time: min")

day.tslsi.cell_methods: area: time: mean (comment: over land and sea ice)
day.tslsi.long_name: Surface Temperature Where Land or Sea Ice
day.tslsi.comment: Surface temperature of all surfaces except open ocean.

day.ua.comment: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).

day.uas.comment: Eastward component of the near-surface (usually, 10 meters)  wind

day.va.comment: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).

day.vas.comment: Northward component of the near surface wind

day.wap.comment: commonly referred to as "omega", this represents the vertical component of velocity in pressure coordinates (positive down)

day.zg.comment: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.

E1hr.clt.comment: or the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Include both large-scale and convective cloud. This is a 1-hour mean.

E1hr.hfls.comment: Hourly surface upward latent heat flux

E1hr.hfss.comment: Hourly surface upward sensible heat flux

E1hr.hurs.long_name: Hourly relative humidity at the surface
E1hr.hurs.comment: Hourly relative humidity at 2m above the surface

E1hr.ps.comment: Sampled synoptically to diagnose atmospheric tides, this is better than mean sea level pressure.

E1hr.rsds.long_name: Hourly downward solar radiation flux at the surface
E1hr.rsds.comment: Hourly downward solar radiation flux at the surface

E1hr.sfcWind.comment: Hourly near-surface wind speed at 10m above the ground

E1hr.tas.comment: Hourly Temperature at 2m above the surface

E1hr.uas.comment: **uas:** eastward component of wind at 10 meters above the surface. It measures wind speed in the east-west direction (positive values indicate wind blowing toward the east).

E1hr.va100m.comment: Meridional wind at 100m above the surface.

E1hr.vas.comment: **vas:** Northward component of wind at 10 meters above the surface. It measures wind speed in the north-south direction (positive values indicate wind blowing toward the north).

E1hr.wsgmax100m.long_name: Maximum Wind Speed of Gust at 100m
E1hr.wsgmax100m.comment: Wind speed gust maximum at 100m above surface

E1hr.wsgmax10m.long_name: Maximum Speed of Wind Gust at 10m
E1hr.wsgmax10m.comment: Wind speed gust maximum at 10m above surface

E1hrClimMon.rlut.cell_methods: area: mean time: mean within days time: mean over days
E1hrClimMon.rlut.comment: at the top of the atmosphere (to be compared with satellite measurements)

E1hrClimMon.rlutcs.cell_methods: area: mean time: mean within days time: mean over days
E1hrClimMon.rlutcs.comment: Upwelling clear-sky longwave radiation at top of atmosphere

E1hrClimMon.rsdt.cell_methods: area: mean time: mean within days time: mean over days
E1hrClimMon.rsdt.comment: Shortwave radiation incident at the top of the atmosphere

E1hrClimMon.rsut.cell_methods: area: mean time: mean within days time: mean over days
E1hrClimMon.rsut.comment: at the top of the atmosphere

E1hrClimMon.rsutcs.cell_methods: area: mean time: mean within days time: mean over days
E1hrClimMon.rsutcs.comment: Calculated in the absence of clouds.

E3hrPt.conccn.long_name: Sub-daily Aerosol Number Concentration at CF sites
E3hrPt.conccn.comment: The variable represents the instantaneous Aerosol Number Concentration at CF sites, sampled every 3 hours

E3hrPt.mmraerh2o.long_name: Instantaneous surface aerosol water mass mixing ratio at CF sites
E3hrPt.mmraerh2o.comment: This variable represents the instantaneous surface aerosol water Mass Mixing Ratio at CF sites, sampled every 3 hours

E3hrPt.mmrbc.comment: This variable represents the instantaneous surface elemental carbon Aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio at CF sites, sampled every 3 hours

E3hrPt.mmrdust.long_name: Instantaneous surface Dust Aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio at CF sites
E3hrPt.mmrdust.comment: This variable represents the instantaneous surface Dust Aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio at CF sites, sampled every 3 hours

E3hrPt.mmrnh4.long_name: Instantaneous surface NH4 aerosol mass mixing ratio at CF sites
E3hrPt.mmrnh4.comment: This variable represents the instantaneous surface NH4 Aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio at CF sites, sampled every 3 hours

E3hrPt.mmrno3.long_name: Instantaneous surface NO3 aerosol mass mixing ratio at CF sites
E3hrPt.mmrno3.comment: This variable represents the instantaneous surface NO3 Aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio at CF sites, sampled every 3 hours

E3hrPt.mmroa.long_name: Instantaneous surface total organic aerosol mass mixing ratio at CF sites
E3hrPt.mmroa.comment: This variable represents the instantaneous surface organic aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio at CF sites, sampled every 3 hours.

E3hrPt.mmrso4.long_name: Instantaneous Aerosol Sulfate Mass Mixing Ratio at CF sites
E3hrPt.mmrso4.comment: This variable is for instantaneous surface mass mixing ratio of sulfate aerosol at CF sites, sampled every 3 hours

E3hrPt.mmrss.long_name: Sea salt Aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio at CF sites
E3hrPt.mmrss.comment: This variable represents instantaneous surface sea salt aerosol mass mixing ratio at CF sites, sampled every 3 hours

E3hrPt.so2.long_name: Surface SO2 volume mixing ratio at CF sites
E3hrPt.so2.comment: This variable represents the instantaneous surface so2 volume mixing ration at CF sites, sampled every 3 hours

E3hrPt.ta.cell_methods: area: mean where air time: point

E3hrPt.ua.cell_methods: area: mean where air time: point

E3hrPt.va.cell_methods: area: mean where air time: point

E3hrPt.wap.cell_methods: area: mean where air time: point

Eday.albsrfc.comment: surface albedo at grid cell level (i.e. the albedo averaged over all potential subgrid-scale structures) over all wave-bands; this shall apply to all realms (land, ocean, sea ice, land ice)

Eday.ccldncl.long_name: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Convective Cloud Tops
Eday.ccldncl.comment: Droplets are liquid only.  Report concentration 'as seen from space' over convective liquid cloudy portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, it is better to sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.

Eday.cldnci.long_name: Ice Crystal Number Concentration of Cloud Tops
Eday.cldnci.comment: Concentration 'as seen from space' over ice-cloud portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with ice cloud or, if available, it is the sum over all ice cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total ice cloud top fraction (as seen from TOA) of each time sample when computing monthly mean.

Eday.cldnvi.comment: Droplets are liquid only.  Values are weighted by liquid cloud fraction in each layer when vertically integrating, and for monthly means the samples are weighted by total liquid cloud fraction (as seen from TOA).

Eday.clivic.comment: calculate mass of convective ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). This includes precipitating frozen hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

Eday.clt.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

Eday.clwvic.comment: calculate mass of convective condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

Eday.dcw.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

Eday.dgw.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

Eday.drivw.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

Eday.dslw.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

Eday.dsn.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

Eday.dsw.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

Eday.esn.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

Eday.evspsbl.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Eday.evspsbl.comment: Evaporation at surface (also known as evapotranspiration): flux of water into the atmosphere due to conversion of both liquid and solid phases to vapor (from underlying surface and vegetation)

Eday.evspsblpot.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

Eday.evspsblsoi.long_name: Daily water evaporation flux from soil
Eday.evspsblsoi.comment: Water evaporation flux from soil but for daily averages i.e., the evspsblsoi variable, which is only currently defined for monthly averages

Eday.evspsblveg.long_name: Daily water evaporation flux from canopy
Eday.evspsblveg.comment: The same as the current variable evspsblveg but defined on daily timescales.

Eday.gppVgt.long_name: Gross Primary Production on Vegetation type as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Eday.gppVgt.comment: The rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production. Reported on land-use tiles.

Eday.hfdsn.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Eday.hfdsn.long_name: Downward Heat Flux into Snow Where Land over Land
Eday.hfdsn.comment: Downward heat flux at snow top

Eday.hfdsnb.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Eday.hfdsnb.long_name: Downward Heat Flux at Snow Base
Eday.hfdsnb.comment: Downward heat flux at snow botton

Eday.hursminCrop.cell_methods: area: mean where crops time: minimum within days time: mean over days
Eday.hursminCrop.long_name: Daily Minimum Near-Surface Relative Humidity over Crop Tile
Eday.hursminCrop.comment: The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

Eday.hus.comment: These are standard variables from CMIP5.

Eday.jpdftaureicemodis.long_name: MODIS Joint Distribution of Optical Thickness and Particle Size, Ice
Eday.jpdftaureicemodis.comment: MODIS Optical Thickness-Particle Size joint  distribution, ice

Eday.jpdftaureliqmodis.long_name: MODIS Optical Thickness-Particle Size Joint Distribution, Liquid
Eday.jpdftaureliqmodis.comment: MODIS Optical Thickness-Particle Size joint  distribution, liquid

Eday.lai.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Eday.lai.comment: A ratio obtained by dividing the total upper leaf surface area of vegetation by the (horizontal) surface area of the land on which it grows.

Eday.laiVgt.long_name: Leaf Area Index on Vegetation type
Eday.laiVgt.comment: A ratio obtained by dividing the total upper leaf surface area of vegetation by the (horizontal) surface area of the land on which it grows.

Eday.loadbc.comment: The total dry mass of black carbon aerosol particles per unit area.

Eday.loaddust.comment: The total dry mass of dust aerosol particles per unit area.

Eday.loadnh4.comment: The total dry mass of ammonium aerosol particles per unit area.

Eday.loadno3.comment: The total dry mass of nitrate aerosol particles per unit area.

Eday.loadoa.long_name: Load of Dry Aerosol Organic Matter
Eday.loadoa.comment: atmosphere dry organic content: This is the vertically integrated sum of atmosphere_primary_organic_content and atmosphere_secondary_organic_content (see next two table entries).

Eday.loadpoa.long_name: Load of Dry Aerosol Primary Organic Matter
Eday.loadpoa.comment: The total dry mass of primary particulate organic aerosol particles per unit area.

Eday.loadso4.comment: The total dry mass of sulfate aerosol particles per unit area.

Eday.loadsoa.long_name: Load of Dry Aerosol Secondary Organic Matter
Eday.loadsoa.comment: The total dry mass of secondary particulate organic aerosol particles per unit area.

Eday.loadss.comment: The total dry mass of sea salt aerosol particles per unit area.

Eday.lwsnl.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Eday.lwsnl.long_name: Liquid Water Content of Snow Layer

Eday.mlotst.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Eday.mlotst.long_name: Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T
Eday.mlotst.comment: Sigma T is potential density referenced to ocean surface.

Eday.mrro.comment: This follows Emon.mrro, but at daily resolution where this variable does not yet exist

Eday.mrrob.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

Eday.mrros.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

Eday.mrsfl.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Eday.mrsfl.long_name: Frozen Water Content of Soil Layer
Eday.mrsfl.comment: in each soil layer, the mass of water in ice phase.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea"

Eday.mrsll.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Eday.mrsll.long_name: Liquid Water Content of Soil Layer
Eday.mrsll.comment: in each soil layer, the mass of water in liquid phase.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea"

Eday.mrso10.comment: Soil moisture in the top 10 cm of the soil column

Eday.mrsol.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Eday.mrsol.long_name: Total Water Content of Soil Layer
Eday.mrsol.comment: in each soil layer, the mass of water in all phases, including ice.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea"

Eday.mrsow.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

Eday.mrtws.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

Eday.nppVgt.long_name: Net Primary Production on Vegetation type as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Eday.nppVgt.comment: "Production of carbon" means the production of biomass expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. Net primary production is the excess of gross primary production (rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors) by autotrophs ("producers"), for example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton, over the rate at which the autotrophs themselves respire some of this biomass. "Productivity" means production per unit area. The phrase "expressed_as" is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A.

Eday.parasolRefl.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

Eday.pflw.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Eday.pflw.long_name: Liquid Water Content of Permafrost Layer

Eday.prCrop.cell_methods: area: time: mean where crops (comment: mask=cropFrac)
Eday.prCrop.comment: includes both liquid and solid phases

Eday.prra.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

Eday.prrsn.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

Eday.prsnc.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

Eday.prsnsn.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Eday.prsnsn.long_name: Fraction of Snowfall (Including Hail and Graupel) on Snow

Eday.prw.comment: vertically integrated through the atmospheric column

Eday.qgwr.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

Eday.raVgt.long_name: Autotrophic Respiration on Vegetation type as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Eday.raVgt.comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to autotrophic respiration on land (respiration by producers) [see rh for heterotrophic production]. Calculated on vegetation type.

Eday.reffcclwtop.long_name: Cloud-Top Effective Droplet Radius in Convective Cloud
Eday.reffcclwtop.comment: Droplets are liquid only.  This is the effective radius "as seen from space" over convective liquid cloudy portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, or for some models it is the sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Reported values are weighted by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.daily data, separated to large-scale clouds, convective clouds. If any of the cloud is from more than one process (i.e. shallow convection), please provide them separately.

Eday.reffsclwtop.long_name: Cloud-Top Effective Droplet Radius in Stratiform Cloud
Eday.reffsclwtop.comment: Droplets are liquid only.  This is the effective radius "as seen from space" over liquid stratiform cloudy portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, or for some models it is the sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Reported values are weighted by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.daily data, separated to large-scale clouds, convective clouds. If any of the cloud is from more than one process (i.e. shallow convection), please provide them separately.

Eday.rhVgt.long_name: Heterotrophic Respiration on Vegetation type as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Eday.rhVgt.comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to heterotrophic respiration on land (respiration by consumers), calculated on vegetation type.

Eday.rivi.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

Eday.rivo.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

Eday.rsdscsdiff.long_name: Surface Diffuse Downwelling Clear Sky Shortwave Radiation
Eday.rsdscsdiff.comment: Surface downwelling solar irradiance from diffuse radiation for UV calculations in clear sky conditions

Eday.rsdsdiff.comment: Surface downwelling solar irradiance from diffuse radiation for UV calculations.

Eday.rzwc.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

Eday.sbl.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Eday.sbl.long_name: Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux

Eday.scldncl.long_name: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Stratiform Cloud Tops
Eday.scldncl.comment: Droplets are liquid only.  Report concentration "as seen from space" over stratiform liquid cloudy portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, it is better to sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.

Eday.snd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Eday.snd.comment: where land over land, this is computed as the mean thickness of snow in the land portion of the grid cell (averaging over the entire land portion, including the snow-free fraction).  Reported as 0.0 where the land fraction is 0.

Eday.snm.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

Eday.snmsl.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

Eday.snrefr.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Eday.snrefr.long_name: Refreezing of Water in the Snow

Eday.snwc.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Eday.snwc.long_name: Snow Water Equivalent Intercepted by the Vegetation

Eday.sw.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Eday.sw.comment: Total liquid water storage, other than soil, snow or interception storage (i.e. lakes, river channel or depression storage).

Eday.t20d.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Eday.t20d.comment: This quantity, sometimes called the "isotherm depth", is the depth (if it exists) at which the sea water potential temperature equals some specified value. This value should be specified in a scalar coordinate variable. Depth is the vertical distance below the surface. Potential temperature is the temperature a parcel of air or sea water would have if moved adiabatically to sea level pressure.

Eday.ta.comment: The difference is to request greater vertical

Eday.tasmaxCrop.cell_methods: area: mean where crops time: maximum
Eday.tasmaxCrop.long_name: Daily Maximum Near-Surface Air Temperature over Crop Tile
Eday.tasmaxCrop.comment: maximum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell_method attribute "time: max")

Eday.tasminCrop.cell_methods: area: mean where crops time: minimum within days time: mean over days
Eday.tasminCrop.long_name: Daily Minimum Near-Surface Air Temperature over Crop Tile
Eday.tasminCrop.comment: minimum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell_method attribute "time: min")

Eday.tauu.comment: Downward eastward wind stress at the surface

Eday.tauupbl.long_name: Eastward Surface Stress from Planetary Boundary Layer Scheme

Eday.tauvpbl.long_name: Northward Surface Stress from Planetary Boundary Layer Scheme

Eday.tdps.comment: Dew point temperature is the temperature at which a parcel of air reaches saturation upon being cooled at constant pressure and specific humidity.

Eday.tpf.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

Eday.tsl.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Eday.tsl.comment: Temperature of each soil layer.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea".

Eday.tsn.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean (weighted by snow mass on land)
Eday.tsn.comment: This temperature is averaged over all the snow in the grid cell that rests on land or land ice.  When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the mass of snow on the land portion of the grid cell, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.   Reported as "missing in regions free of snow on land.

Eday.tsns.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

Eday.ua.comment: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).

Eday.utendnogw.long_name: Tendency of eastward wind due to non-orographic gravity waves
Eday.utendnogw.comment: Tendency of eastward wind induced by the parameterized non-orographic gravity wave drag

Eday.utendogw.long_name: Tendency of eastward wind due to orographic gravity waves
Eday.utendogw.comment: Tendency of eastward wind induced by the parameterized orographic gravity wave drag

Eday.va.comment: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).

Eday.vtendnogw.long_name: Tendency of northward wind due to non-orographic gravity waves
Eday.vtendnogw.comment: Tendency of northward wind induced by the parameterized non-orographic gravity wave drag

Eday.vtendogw.long_name: Tendency of northward wind due to orographic gravity waves
Eday.vtendogw.comment: Tendency of northward wind induced by the parameterized orographic gravity wave drag

Eday.wap.comment: wap is a lower priority request (level 2, not level 1)

Eday.wtd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

Eday.zg.comment: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.

EdayZ.epfy.long_name: Northward Component of the Eliassen-Palm Flux

EdayZ.epfz.long_name: Upward Component of the Eliassen-Palm Flux

EdayZ.ta.comment: Zonal mean temperature of air with the extended number of vertical levels.

EdayZ.tauunoegw.long_name: Zonal mean eastward Reynolds stress from non-orographic eastward gravity wave parameterization
EdayZ.tauunoegw.comment: Zonal mean vertical wave flux of zonal momentum within the non-orographic GW parameterization associated with the eastward propagating modes.

EdayZ.tauunowgw.comment: Zonal mean vertical wave flux of zonal momentum within the non-orographic GW parameterization associated with the westward propagating modes.

EdayZ.tauvnogw.long_name: Zonal mean northward Reynolds stress from non-orographic gravity wave parameterization
EdayZ.tauvnogw.comment: Zonal mean vertical wave flux of meridional momentum within the non-orographic GW parameterization

EdayZ.tauvogw.long_name: Zonal mean northward Reynolds stress from orographic gravity wave parameterization
EdayZ.tauvogw.comment: Zonal mean vertical flux of meridional momentum within the orographic GW parameterization

EdayZ.tntrl.long_name: Zonal mean tendency of air temperature due to longwave heating, all sky

EdayZ.tntrs.long_name: Zonal mean tendency of air temperature due to shortwave heating, all sky

EdayZ.utendepfd.comment: Called "acceldivf" in CCMI table; we suggest new name. zonal mean; hence YZT

EdayZ.utendogw.long_name: Eastward Acceleration Due to Orographic Gravity Wave Drag

EdayZ.utendvtem.long_name: Tendency of Eastward Wind Due to TEM Northward Advection and Coriolis Term

EdayZ.utendwtem.long_name: Tendency of Eastward Wind Due to TEM Upward Advection

Efx.sftflf.comment: This is needed to distinguish between grounded glaciated ice (grounded = ice sheet and glacier) and ice shelves (floating over sea water), since land_ice is by definition ice sheet, glacier and ice shelves

Efx.sftgrf.comment: This is needed to distinguish between grounded glaciated ice (grounded = ice sheet and glacier) and ice shelves (floating over sea water), since land_ice is by definition ice sheet, glacier and ice shelves

Emon.albic.comment: This describes the albedo of any surface covered by ice, land and ocean

Emon.albl.long_name: Surface Albedo of Land without Snow
Emon.albl.comment: albedo of the portion of land that is not covered by ice, potentially considering sub-gridscale inhomogeneity of ice cover

Emon.albo.cell_methods: area: mean where ice_free_sea over sea time: mean
Emon.albo.long_name: surface albedo of ocean without ice
Emon.albo.comment: similar to the proposal of surface albedo of land without ice, but for ocean that is not covered by ice

Emon.albsn.cell_methods: area: time: mean where snow (comment: mask=snc)
Emon.albsn.cell_measures: area: areacella area: areacello volume: volcello
Emon.albsn.comment: Albedo of snow - this is similar to Eday.albsn, but providing monthly averages

Emon.albsrfc.comment: surface albedo at grid cell level (i.e. the albedo averaged over all potential subgrid-scale structures) over all wave-bands; this shall apply to all realms (land, ocean, sea ice, land ice)

Emon.c13Land.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
