Emon.c13Land.comment: Carbon-13 mass content per unit area in vegetation (any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass), litter (dead plant material in or above the soil), soil, and forestry and agricultural products (e.g. paper, cardboard, furniture, timber for construction, biofuels and food for both humans and livestock).

Emon.c13Litter.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.c13Litter.comment: Carbon-13 mass content per unit area litter (dead plant material in or above the soil).

Emon.c13Soil.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.c13Soil.comment: Carbon-13 mass content per unit area in soil.

Emon.c13Veg.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.c13Veg.comment: Carbon-13 mass content per unit area in vegetation (any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass).

Emon.c14Land.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.c14Land.long_name: Mass of 14C in All Terrestrial Carbon Pools
Emon.c14Land.comment: Carbon-14 mass content per unit area in vegetation (any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass), litter (dead plant material in or above the soil), soil, and forestry and agricultural products (e.g. paper, cardboard, furniture, timber for construction, biofuels and food for both humans and livestock).

Emon.c14Litter.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.c14Litter.comment: Carbon-14 mass content per unit area litter (dead plant material in or above the soil).

Emon.c14Soil.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.c14Soil.comment: Carbon-14 mass content per unit area in soil.

Emon.c14Veg.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

Emon.ccldncl.long_name: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Convective Cloud Tops
Emon.ccldncl.comment: This variable represents monthly mean Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Convective Cloud Tops

Emon.cLand.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.cLand.long_name: Total Carbon in All Terrestrial Carbon Pools
Emon.cLand.comment: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

Emon.cldnci.long_name: Ice Crystal Number Concentration of Cloud Tops
Emon.cldnci.comment: Concentration 'as seen from space' over ice-cloud portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with ice cloud or, if available, it is the sum over all ice cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total ice cloud top fraction (as seen from TOA) of each time sample when computing monthly mean.

Emon.cldncl.long_name: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Cloud Tops
Emon.cldncl.comment: Droplets are liquid only.  Report concentration 'as seen from space' over liquid cloudy portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, it is better to sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.

Emon.cldnvi.comment: Droplets are liquid only.  Values are weighted by liquid cloud fraction in each layer when vertically integrating, and for monthly means the samples are weighted by total liquid cloud fraction (as seen from TOA).

Emon.cLitterCwd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.cLitterCwd.long_name: Carbon Mass in Coarse Woody Debris
Emon.cLitterCwd.comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Wood debris" means dead organic matter composed of coarse wood. It is distinct from fine litter. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent.

Emon.cLitterSubSurf.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.cLitterSubSurf.comment: subsurface litter pool fed by root inputs.

Emon.cLitterSurf.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.cLitterSurf.comment: Surface or near-surface litter pool fed by leaf and above-ground litterfall

Emon.clmisr.long_name: Percentage Cloud Cover as Calculated by the MISR Simulator (Including Error Flag)

Emon.co2s.comment: As co2, but only at the surface

Emon.cOther.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.cOther.long_name: Carbon Mass in Vegetation Components Other than Leaves, Stems and Roots

Emon.cropFracC3.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
Emon.cropFracC3.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C3 crops

Emon.cropFracC4.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
Emon.cropFracC4.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C4 crops

Emon.cSoil.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.cSoil.long_name: Carbon Mass in Model Soil Pool
Emon.cSoil.comment: Carbon mass in the full depth of the soil model.

Emon.cSoilAbove1m.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.cSoilAbove1m.long_name: Carbon Mass in Soil Pool Above 1m Depth
Emon.cSoilAbove1m.comment: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

Emon.cSoilLevels.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.cSoilLevels.long_name: Carbon Mass in Each Model Soil Level (Summed over All Soil Carbon Pools in That Level)
Emon.cSoilLevels.comment: for models with vertically discretised soil carbon, report total soil carbon for each level

Emon.cSoilPools.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.cSoilPools.long_name: Carbon Mass in Each Model Soil Pool (Summed over Vertical Levels)
Emon.cSoilPools.comment: For models with multiple soil carbon pools, report each pool here. If models also have vertical discretisation these should be aggregated

Emon.cStem.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

Emon.cVegGrass.cell_methods: area: time: mean where natural_grasses (comment: mask=grassFrac)
Emon.cVegGrass.long_name: Carbon Mass in Vegetation on Grass Tiles
Emon.cVegGrass.comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Vegetation" means any plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. Plants are autotrophs i.e. "producers" of biomass using carbon obtained from carbon dioxide.

Emon.cVegShrub.cell_methods: area: time: mean where shrubs (comment: mask=shrubFrac)
Emon.cVegShrub.long_name: Carbon Mass in Vegetation on Shrub Tiles
Emon.cVegShrub.comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Vegetation" means any plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. Plants are autotrophs i.e. "producers" of biomass using carbon obtained from carbon dioxide.

Emon.cVegTree.cell_methods: area: time: mean where trees (comment: mask=treeFrac)
Emon.cVegTree.long_name: Carbon Mass in Vegetation on Tree Tiles
Emon.cVegTree.comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Vegetation" means any plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. Plants are autotrophs i.e. "producers" of biomass using carbon obtained from carbon dioxide.

Emon.cWood.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

Emon.depdust.comment: Fdry mass deposition rate of dust

Emon.dissi14c.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

Emon.ec550aer.cell_methods: area: mean where crops time: maximum within days time: mean over days

Emon.evspsblpot.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.evspsblpot.comment: at surface; potential flux of water into the atmosphere due to conversion of both liquid and solid phases to vapor (from underlying surface and vegetation)

Emon.expcalc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

Emon.fAnthDisturb.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.fAnthDisturb.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation, Litter or Soil Pools into the Atmosphere Due to any Human Activity [kgC m-2 s-1]
Emon.fAnthDisturb.comment: Anthropogenic flux of carbon as carbon dioxide into the atmosphere. That is, emissions influenced, caused, or created by human activity. Anthropogenic emission of carbon dioxide includes fossil fuel use, cement production, agricultural burning and sources associated with anthropogenic land use change, except forest regrowth.

Emon.fBNF.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.fBNF.comment: The fixation (uptake of nitrogen gas directly from the atmosphere) of nitrogen due to biological processes.

Emon.fCLandToOcean.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.fCLandToOcean.long_name: Lateral Transfer of Carbon out of Grid Cell That Eventually Goes into Ocean
Emon.fCLandToOcean.comment: leached carbon etc that goes into run off or river routing and finds its way into ocean should be reported here.

Emon.fDeforestToAtmos.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.fDeforestToAtmos.long_name: Deforested Biomass That Goes into Atmosphere as a Result of Anthropogenic Land-Use Change [kgC m-2 s-1]
Emon.fDeforestToAtmos.comment: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. The treatment of deforested biomass differs significantly across models, but it should be straight-forward to compare deforested biomass across models.

Emon.fDeforestToProduct.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.fDeforestToProduct.long_name: Deforested Biomass That Goes into Product Pool as a Result of Anthropogenic Land-Use Change
Emon.fDeforestToProduct.comment: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. The treatment of deforested biomass differs significantly across models, but it should be straight-forward to compare deforested biomass across models.

Emon.fFireAll.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.fFireAll.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from Fire Including All Sources [kgC m-2 s-1]
Emon.fFireAll.comment: From all sources,  Including natural, anthropogenic and Land-use change. Only total fire emissions can be compared to observations.

Emon.fFireNat.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.fFireNat.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from Natural Fire [kgC m-2 s-1]

Emon.fg14co2.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Emon.fg14co2.long_name: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon-14 as 14CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
Emon.fg14co2.comment: Gas exchange flux of carbon-14 as CO2 (positive into ocean)

Emon.fHarvestToAtmos.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.fHarvestToAtmos.long_name: Harvested Biomass That Goes Straight into Atmosphere as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Emon.fHarvestToAtmos.comment: any harvested carbon that is assumed to decompose immediately into the atmosphere is reported here

Emon.fHarvestToProduct.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.fHarvestToProduct.long_name: Harvested Biomass That Goes into Product Pool
Emon.fHarvestToProduct.comment: be it food or wood harvest, any carbon that is subsequently stored is reported here

Emon.flandice.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Emon.flandice.long_name: Water Flux into Sea Water from Land Ice
Emon.flandice.comment: Computed as the water flux into the ocean due to land ice (runoff water from surface and base of land ice or melt from base of ice shelf or vertical ice front) into the ocean divided by the area ocean portion of the grid cell

Emon.fLitterFire.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.fLitterFire.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux from Litter, CWD or any non-Living Pool into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from All Fire [kgC m-2 s-1]
Emon.fLitterFire.comment: Required for unambiguous separation of vegetation and soil + litter turnover times, since total fire flux draws from both sources

Emon.fLuc.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.fLuc.long_name: Net Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Land-Use Change [kgC m-2 s-1]
Emon.fLuc.comment: Net Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Land Use Change

Emon.fLulccAtmLut.long_name: Carbon Transferred Directly to Atmosphere Due to any Land-Use or Land-Cover Change Activities [kgC m-2 s-1]
Emon.fLulccAtmLut.comment: This annual mean flux refers to the transfer of carbon directly to the atmosphere due to any land-use or land-cover change activities.  Include carbon transferred due to deforestation or agricultural directly into atmosphere, and  emissions form anthropogenic pools into atmosphere

Emon.fN2O.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.fN2O.comment: Surface upward flux of nitrous oxide (N2O) from vegetation (any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass), litter (dead plant material in or above the soil), soil.

Emon.fNAnthDisturb.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.fNAnthDisturb.long_name: Nitrogen Mass Flux out of Land Due to any Human Activity
Emon.fNAnthDisturb.comment: will require some careful definition to make sure we capture everything - any human activity that releases nitrogen from land  instead of into product pool goes here. E.g. Deforestation fire, harvest assumed to decompose straight away, grazing...

Emon.fNdep.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.fNdep.long_name: Dry and Wet Deposition of Reactive Nitrogen onto Land

Emon.fNfert.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.fNfert.long_name: Total Nitrogen Added for Cropland Fertilisation (Artificial and Manure)
Emon.fNfert.comment: Total Nitrogen added for cropland fertilisation (artificial and manure). Relative to total land area of a grid cell, not relative to agricultural area

Emon.fNgas.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.fNgas.long_name: Total Nitrogen Lost to the Atmosphere (Sum of NHx, NOx, N2O, N2)
Emon.fNgas.comment: Total flux of Nitrogen from the land into the atmosphere.

Emon.fNgasFire.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.fNgasFire.long_name: Total Nitrogen Lost to the Atmosphere (Including NHx, NOx, N2O, N2) from Fire
Emon.fNgasFire.comment: Flux of Nitrogen from the land into the atmosphere due to fire

Emon.fNgasNonFire.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.fNgasNonFire.long_name: Total Nitrogen Lost to the Atmosphere (Including NHx, NOx, N2O, N2) from All Processes Except Fire
Emon.fNgasNonFire.comment: Flux of Nitrogen from the land into the atmosphere due to all processes other than fire

Emon.fNLandToOcean.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.fNLandToOcean.long_name: Lateral Transfer of Nitrogen out of Grid Cell That Eventually Goes into Ocean
Emon.fNLandToOcean.comment: leached nitrogen etc that goes into run off or river routing and finds its way into ocean should be reported here.

Emon.fNleach.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.fNleach.long_name: Total Nitrogen Loss to Leaching or Runoff (Sum of Ammonium, Nitrite and Nitrate)
Emon.fNleach.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. The specification of a physical process by the phrase "due_to_" process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. "Leaching" means the loss of water soluble chemical species from soil. Runoff is the liquid water which drains from land. If not specified, "runoff" refers to the sum of surface runoff and subsurface drainage.

Emon.fNLitterSoil.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.fNLitterSoil.long_name: Total Nitrogen Mass Flux from Litter to Soil
Emon.fNLitterSoil.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil.

Emon.fNloss.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.fNloss.long_name: Total Nitrogen Lost (Including NHx, NOx, N2O, N2 and Leaching)
Emon.fNloss.comment: Not all models split losses into gaseous and leaching

Emon.fNnetmin.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.fNnetmin.long_name: Net Nitrogen Release from Soil and Litter as the Outcome of Nitrogen Immobilisation and Gross Mineralisation
Emon.fNnetmin.comment: Loss of soil nitrogen through remineralization and immobilisation. Remineralization is the degradation of organic matter into inorganic forms of carbon, nitrogen, phosphorus and other micronutrients, which consumes oxygen and releases energy. Immobilisation of nitrogen refers to retention of nitrogen by micro-organisms under certain conditions, making it unavailable for plants.

Emon.fNOx.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.fNOx.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. The phrase "expressed_as" is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. "Nox" means a combination of two radical species containing nitrogen and oxygen NO+NO2. "Vegetation" means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil.

Emon.fNProduct.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.fNProduct.long_name: Deforested or Harvested Biomass as a Result of Anthropogenic Land-Use or Change
Emon.fNProduct.comment: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. The treatment of deforested biomass differs significantly across models, but it should be straight-forward to compare deforested biomass across models.

Emon.fNup.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.fNup.long_name: Total Plant Nitrogen Uptake (Sum of Ammonium and Nitrate) Irrespective of the Source of Nitrogen
Emon.fNup.comment: The uptake of nitrogen by fixation: nitrogen fixation means the uptake of nitrogen gas directly from the atmosphere.

Emon.fNVegLitter.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.fNVegLitter.long_name: Total Nitrogen Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter
Emon.fNVegLitter.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. "Vegetation" means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass.

Emon.fNVegSoil.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.fNVegSoil.long_name: Total Nitrogen Mass Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil
Emon.fNVegSoil.comment: In some models part of nitrogen (e.g., root exudate) can go directly into the soil pool without entering litter.

Emon.fProductDecomp.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.fProductDecomp.long_name: Decomposition out of Product Pools to CO2 in Atmosphere as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Emon.fProductDecomp.comment: Flux of CO2 from product pools into the atmosphere. Examples of "forestry and agricultural products" are paper, cardboard, furniture, timber for construction, biofuels and food for both humans and livestock. Models that simulate land use changes have one or more pools of carbon that represent these products in order to conserve carbon and allow its eventual release into the atmosphere, for example, when the products decompose in landfill sites.

Emon.fracLut.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
Emon.fracLut.long_name: Percentage of Grid Cell for Each Land-Use Tile
Emon.fracLut.comment: End of year values (not annual mean); note that percentage should be reported as percentage of land grid cell (example: frac_lnd = 0.5, frac_ocn = 0.5, frac_crop_lnd = 0.2 (of land portion of grid cell), then frac_lut(crop) = 0.5\*0.2 = 0.1)

Emon.fVegFire.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.fVegFire.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from All Fire [kgC m-2 s-1]
Emon.fVegFire.comment: Required for unambiguous separation of vegetation and soil + litter turnover times, since total fire flux draws from both sources

Emon.fVegLitterMortality.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.fVegLitterMortality.long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter as a Result of Mortality
Emon.fVegLitterMortality.comment: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality

Emon.fVegLitterSenescence.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.fVegLitterSenescence.long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter as a Result of Leaf, Branch, and Root Senescence
Emon.fVegLitterSenescence.comment: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality

Emon.fVegSoilMortality.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.fVegSoilMortality.long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Soil as a Result of Mortality
Emon.fVegSoilMortality.comment: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality

Emon.fVegSoilSenescence.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.fVegSoilSenescence.long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Soil as a Result of Leaf, Branch, and Root Senescence
Emon.fVegSoilSenescence.comment: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality

Emon.gppc13.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.gppc13.long_name: Carbon-13 Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Gross Primary Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Emon.gppc13.comment: The rate of synthesis of carbon-13 in biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production.

Emon.gppc14.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.gppc14.long_name: Carbon-14 Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Gross Primary Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Emon.gppc14.comment: The rate of synthesis of carbon-14 in biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production.

Emon.gppGrass.cell_methods: area: time: mean where natural_grasses (comment: mask=grassFrac)
Emon.gppGrass.long_name: Gross Primary Production on Grass Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Emon.gppGrass.comment: Total GPP of grass in the grid cell

Emon.gppLut.long_name: Gross Primary Production on Land-Use Tile as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Emon.gppLut.comment: The rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production. Reported on land-use tiles.

Emon.gppShrub.cell_methods: area: time: mean where shrubs (comment: mask=shrubFrac)
Emon.gppShrub.long_name: Gross Primary Production on Shrub Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Emon.gppShrub.comment: Total GPP of shrubs in the grid cell

Emon.gppTree.cell_methods: area: time: mean where trees (comment: mask=treeFrac)
Emon.gppTree.long_name: Gross Primary Production on Tree Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Emon.gppTree.comment: Total GPP of trees in the grid cell

Emon.grassFracC3.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
Emon.grassFracC3.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C3 natural grass.

Emon.grassFracC4.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
Emon.grassFracC4.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C4 natural grass.

Emon.hflsLut.long_name: Latent Heat Flux on Land-Use Tile
Emon.hflsLut.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface latent heat flux is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air on account of evaporation (including sublimation). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Emon.hfssLut.long_name: Sensible Heat Flux on Land-Use Tile
Emon.hfssLut.comment: Upward sensible heat flux on land use tiles. The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.

Emon.irrLut.long_name: Irrigation Flux Including any Irrigation for Crops, Trees, Pasture, or Urban Lawns
Emon.irrLut.comment: Mass flux of water due to irrigation.

Emon.jpdftaureicemodis.long_name: MODIS Joint Distribution of Optical Thickness and Particle Size, Ice
Emon.jpdftaureicemodis.comment: MODIS Optical Thickness-Particle Size joint distribution, ice

Emon.jpdftaureliqmodis.long_name: MODIS Optical Thickness-Particle Size Joint Distribution, Liquid
Emon.jpdftaureliqmodis.comment: MODIS Optical Thickness-Particle Size joint distribution, liquid

Emon.laiLut.long_name: Leaf Area Index on Land-Use Tile
Emon.laiLut.comment: A ratio obtained by dividing the total upper leaf surface area of vegetation by the (horizontal) surface area of the land on which it grows.

Emon.loadso4.comment: The total dry mass of sulfate aerosol particles per unit area.

Emon.mrsfl.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.mrsfl.long_name: Frozen Water Content of Soil Layer
Emon.mrsfl.comment: in each soil layer, the mass of water in ice phase.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea"

Emon.mrsll.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.mrsll.long_name: Liquid Water Content of Soil Layer
Emon.mrsll.comment: in each soil layer, the mass of water in liquid phase.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea"

Emon.mrsol.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.mrsol.long_name: Total Water Content of Soil Layer
Emon.mrsol.comment: in each soil layer, the mass of water in all phases, including ice.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea"

Emon.mrsosLut.long_name: Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column of Land-Use Tile
Emon.mrsosLut.comment: the mass of water in all phases in a thin surface layer; integrate over uppermost 10cm

Emon.mrtws.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.mrtws.comment: requested for C4MIP, OCMIP/OMIP, LUMIP, ScenarioMIP, DECK, DAMIP, GeoMIP, LS3MIP, ??

Emon.necbLut.long_name: Net Carbon Mass Flux into Land-Use Tile [kgC m-2 s-1]
Emon.necbLut.comment: Computed as npp minus heterotrophic respiration minus fire minus C leaching minus harvesting/clearing. Positive rate is into the land, negative rate is from the land.  Do not include fluxes from anthropogenic product pools to atmosphere

Emon.nep.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.nep.long_name: Net Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Net Ecosystem Productivity on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]

Emon.netAtmosLandC13Flux.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.netAtmosLandC13Flux.long_name: Net Mass Flux of 13C Between Atmosphere and Land (Positive into Land) as a Result of All Processes [kgC m-2 s-1]
Emon.netAtmosLandC13Flux.comment: Flux of carbon 31as carbon dioxide into the land. This flux should be reproducible by differencing the sum of all carbon pools (cVeg, cLitter, cSoil, and cProducts or equivalently cLand) from one time step to the next, except in the case of lateral transfer of carbon due to harvest, riverine transport of dissolved organic and/or inorganic carbon, or any other process (in which case the lateral_carbon_transfer_over_land term, see below, will be zero data).-

Emon.netAtmosLandC14Flux.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.netAtmosLandC14Flux.long_name: Net Mass Flux of 14C Between Atmosphere and Land (Positive into Land) as a Result of All Processes [kgC m-2 s-1]
Emon.netAtmosLandC14Flux.comment: Flux of carbon-14 as carbon dioxide into the land. This flux should be reproducible by differencing the sum of all carbon pools (cVeg, cLitter, cSoil, and cProducts or equivalently cLand) from one time step to the next, except in the case of lateral transfer of carbon due to harvest, riverine transport of dissolved organic and/or inorganic carbon, or any other process (in which case the lateral_carbon_transfer_over_land term, see below, will be zero data).

Emon.netAtmosLandCO2Flux.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.netAtmosLandCO2Flux.long_name: Net Flux of CO2 Between Atmosphere and Land (Positive into Land) as a Result of All Processes [kgC m-2 s-1]
Emon.netAtmosLandCO2Flux.comment: Flux of carbon as carbon dioxide into the land. This flux should be reproducible by differencing the sum of all carbon pools (cVeg, cLitter, cSoil, and cProducts or equivalently cLand) from one time step to the next, except in the case of lateral transfer of carbon due to harvest, riverine transport of dissolved organic and/or inorganic carbon, or any other process (in which case the lateral_carbon_transfer_over_land term, see below, will be zero data).

Emon.nLand.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.nLand.long_name: Total Nitrogen in All Terrestrial Nitrogen Pools
Emon.nLand.comment: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

Emon.nLeaf.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.nLeaf.comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area.

Emon.nLitter.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.nLitter.comment: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

Emon.nLitterCwd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.nLitterCwd.long_name: Nitrogen Mass in Coarse Woody Debris
Emon.nLitterCwd.comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Wood debris" means dead organic matter composed of coarse wood. It is distinct from fine litter. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. The sum of the quantities with standard names wood_debris_mass_content_of_nitrogen, surface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen is the total nitrogen mass content of dead plant material.

Emon.nLitterSubSurf.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.nLitterSubSurf.long_name: Nitrogen Mass in Below-Ground Litter (non CWD)
Emon.nLitterSubSurf.comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Subsurface litter" means the part of the litter mixed within the soil below the surface. The sum of the quantities with standard names wood_debris_mass_content_of_nitrogen, surface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen is the total nitrogen mass content of dead plant material.

Emon.nLitterSurf.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.nLitterSurf.long_name: Nitrogen Mass in Above-Ground Litter (non CWD)
Emon.nLitterSurf.comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Surface litter" means the part of the litter resting above the soil surface. The sum of the quantities with standard names wood_debris_mass_content_of_nitrogen, surface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen is the total nitrogen mass content of dead plant material.

Emon.nMineral.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.nMineral.comment: SUM of ammonium, nitrite, nitrate, etc over all soil layers

Emon.nMineralNH4.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.nMineralNH4.comment: SUM of ammonium over all soil layers

Emon.nMineralNO3.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.nMineralNO3.comment: SUM of nitrate over all soil layers

Emon.nOther.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.nOther.long_name: Nitrogen Mass in Vegetation Components Other than Leaves, Stem and Root

Emon.nppGrass.cell_methods: area: time: mean where natural_grasses (comment: mask=grassFrac)
Emon.nppGrass.long_name: Net Primary Production on Grass Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Emon.nppGrass.comment: Total NPP of grass in the grid cell

Emon.nppLut.long_name: Net Primary Production on Land-Use Tile as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Emon.nppLut.comment: "Production of carbon" means the production of biomass expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. Net primary production is the excess of gross primary production (rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors) by autotrophs ("producers"), for example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton, over the rate at which the autotrophs themselves respire some of this biomass. "Productivity" means production per unit area. The phrase "expressed_as" is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A.

Emon.nppOther.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.nppOther.long_name: Net Primary Production Allocated to Other Pools (not Leaves Stem or Roots) as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

Emon.nppShrub.cell_methods: area: time: mean where shrubs (comment: mask=shrubFrac)
Emon.nppShrub.long_name: Net Primary Production on Shrub Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Emon.nppShrub.comment: Total NPP of shrubs in the grid cell

Emon.nppStem.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.nppStem.long_name: Net Primary Production Allocated to Stem as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

Emon.nppTree.cell_methods: area: time: mean where trees (comment: mask=treeFrac)
Emon.nppTree.long_name: Net Primary Production on Tree Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Emon.nppTree.comment: Total NPP of trees in the grid cell

Emon.nProduct.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.nProduct.long_name: Nitrogen Mass in Products of Land-Use Change
Emon.nProduct.comment: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

Emon.nRoot.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

Emon.nSoil.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.nSoil.comment: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

Emon.nStem.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

Emon.nVeg.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.nVeg.comment: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

Emon.osaltpsmadvect.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Emon.osaltpsmadvect.long_name: Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection
Emon.osaltpsmadvect.comment: Tendency of salt content for a grid cell from parameterized submesoscale eddy advection.

Emon.parasolRefl.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

Emon.pastureFracC3.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
Emon.pastureFracC3.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C3 pasture

Emon.pastureFracC4.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
Emon.pastureFracC4.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C4 pasture

Emon.pr17O.long_name: Precipitation Flux of Water Containing Oxygen-17 (H2 17O)
Emon.pr17O.comment: Precipitation mass flux of water molecules that contain the oxygen-17 isotope (H2 17O), including solid and liquid phases.

Emon.pr18O.long_name: Precipitation Flux of Water Containing Oxygen-18 (H2 18O)
Emon.pr18O.comment: Precipitation mass flux of water molecules that contain the oxygen-18 isotope (H2 18O), including solid and liquid phases.

Emon.pr2h.long_name: Precipitation Flux of Water Containing Deuterium (1H 2H O)
Emon.pr2h.comment: Precipitation mass flux of water molecules that contain one atom of the hydrogen-2 isotope (1H 2H O), including solid and liquid phases.

Emon.prhmax.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Emon.prsn18O.long_name: Precipitation Flux of Snow and Ice Containing Oxygen-18 (H2 18O)
Emon.prsn18O.comment: Precipitation mass flux of water molecules that contain the oxygen-18 isotope (H2 18O), including solid phase only.

Emon.prsn2h.long_name: Precipitation Flux of Snow and Ice Containing Deuterium (1H 2H O)
Emon.prsn2h.comment: Precipitation mass flux of water molecules that contain one atom of the hydrogen-2 isotope (1H 2H O), including solid phase only.

Emon.rac13.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.rac13.long_name: Carbon-13 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Emon.rac13.comment: Flux of carbon-13 into the atmosphere due to plant respiration. Plant respiration is the sum of respiration by parts of plants both above and below the soil. It is assumed that all the respired carbon dioxide is emitted to the atmosphere.

Emon.rac14.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.rac14.long_name: Carbon-14 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Emon.rac14.comment: Flux of carbon-14 into the atmosphere due to plant respiration. Plant respiration is the sum of respiration by parts of plants both above and below the soil. It is assumed that all the respired carbon dioxide is emitted to the atmosphere.

Emon.raGrass.cell_methods: area: time: mean where natural_grasses (comment: mask=grassFrac)
Emon.raGrass.long_name: Autotrophic Respiration on Grass Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Emon.raGrass.comment: Total RA of grass in the grid cell

Emon.raLeaf.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.raLeaf.long_name: Total Respiration from Leaves as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

Emon.raLut.long_name: Autotrophic Respiration on Land-Use Tile as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Emon.raLut.comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to autotrophic respiration on land (respiration by producers) [see rh for heterotrophic production]. Calculated on land-use tiles.

Emon.raOther.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.raOther.long_name: Total Respiration from Other Pools (not Leaves Stem or Roots) as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

Emon.raRoot.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.raRoot.long_name: Total Respiration from Roots as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Emon.raRoot.comment: Total autotrophic respiration from all belowground plant parts.  This has benchmarking value because the sum of Rh and root respiration can be compared to observations of total soil respiration.

Emon.raShrub.cell_methods: area: time: mean where shrubs (comment: mask=shrubFrac)
Emon.raShrub.long_name: Autotrophic Respiration on Shrub Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Emon.raShrub.comment: Total RA of shrubs in the grid cell

Emon.raStem.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.raStem.long_name: Total Respiration from Stem as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

Emon.raTree.cell_methods: area: time: mean where trees (comment: mask=treeFrac)
Emon.raTree.long_name: Autotrophic Respiration on Tree Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Emon.raTree.comment: Total RA of trees in the grid cell

Emon.reffcclwtop.long_name: Cloud-Top Effective Droplet Radius in Convective Cloud
Emon.reffcclwtop.comment: This variable represents a monthly mean for Cloud-Top Effective Droplet Radius in Convective Cloud

Emon.reffccwctop.long_name: Cloud-Top Effective Radius of Liquid or Ice Cloud at Liquid or Ice Cloud Top
Emon.reffccwctop.comment: This variable represents the monthly mean Cloud-Top Effective Radius of Liquid or Ice Cloud at Liquid or Ice Cloud Top

Emon.reffclic.long_name: Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Convective Cloud Ice
Emon.reffclic.comment: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).

Emon.reffclis.long_name: Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Stratiform Cloud Ice
Emon.reffclis.comment: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).

Emon.reffclwc.long_name: Convective Cloud Liquid Droplet Effective Radius
Emon.reffclwc.comment: Droplets are liquid.  The effective radius is defined as the ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution and the time-mean should be calculated, weighting the individual samples by the cloudy fraction of the grid cell.

Emon.reffclws.long_name: Stratiform Cloud Liquid Droplet Effective Radius
Emon.reffclws.comment: Droplets are liquid.  The effective radius is defined as the ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution and the time-mean should be calculated, weighting the individual samples by the cloudy fraction of the grid cell.

Emon.reffsclwtop.long_name: Cloud-Top Effective Droplet Radius in Stratiform Cloud
Emon.reffsclwtop.comment: This variable represents the monthly mean Cloud-Top Effective Droplet Radius in Stratiform Cloud

Emon.rhc13.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.rhc13.long_name: Carbon-13 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Emon.rhc13.comment: Heterotrophic respiration is respiration by heterotrophs ("consumers"), which are organisms (including animals and decomposers) that consume other organisms or dead organic material, rather than synthesising organic material from inorganic precursors using energy from the environment (especially sunlight) as autotrophs ("producers") do. Heterotrophic respiration goes on within both the soil and litter pools.

Emon.rhc14.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.rhc14.long_name: Carbon-14 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Emon.rhc14.comment: Heterotrophic respiration is respiration by heterotrophs ("consumers"), which are organisms (including animals and decomposers) that consume other organisms or dead organic material, rather than synthesising organic material from inorganic precursors using energy from the environment (especially sunlight) as autotrophs ("producers") do. Heterotrophic respiration goes on within both the soil and litter pools.

Emon.rhGrass.cell_methods: area: time: mean where natural_grasses (comment: mask=grassFrac)
Emon.rhGrass.long_name: Heterotrophic Respiration on Grass Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Emon.rhGrass.comment: Total RH of grass in the grid cell

Emon.rhLitter.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.rhLitter.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Heterotrophic Respiration from Litter on Land
Emon.rhLitter.comment: Needed to calculate litter bulk turnover time. Includes respiration from CWD as well.

Emon.rhLut.long_name: Heterotrophic Respiration on Land-Use Tile as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Emon.rhLut.comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to heterotrophic respiration on land (respiration by consumers), calculated on land-use tiles.

Emon.rhShrub.cell_methods: area: time: mean where shrubs (comment: mask=shrubFrac)
Emon.rhShrub.long_name: Heterotrophic Respiration on Shrub Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Emon.rhShrub.comment: Total RH of shrubs in the grid cell

Emon.rhSoil.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.rhSoil.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Heterotrophic Respiration from Soil on Land
Emon.rhSoil.comment: Needed to calculate soil bulk turnover time

Emon.rhTree.cell_methods: area: time: mean where trees (comment: mask=treeFrac)
Emon.rhTree.long_name: Heterotrophic Respiration on Tree Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Emon.rhTree.comment: Total RH of trees in the grid cell

Emon.rsdsis.long_name: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over land ice
Emon.rsdsis.comment: surface downwelling shortwave radiation over land ice, computed as the average albedo of the land ice covered part of a grid cell (mask: fx.sftgif for models with fixed ice sheets, LImon.sftgif for models with dynamic ice sheets)

Emon.rsdslni.long_name: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over land without ice cover
Emon.rsdslni.comment: surface downwelling shortwave radiation over land, computed as the average albedo of the ice-free part of a grid cell

Emon.rsdsoni.long_name: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over ocean without sea ice
Emon.rsdsoni.comment: surface downwelling shortwave radiation over ocean without sea ice, computed as the average albedo of the ice-free part of a grid cell

Emon.rsdss.cell_methods: area: time: mean where snow (comment: mask=snc)
Emon.rsdss.long_name: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over snow-covered surfaces
Emon.rsdss.comment: surface downwelling shortwave radiation over snow covered surfaces, computed as the average albedo of the snow-covered part of a grid cell

Emon.rsdssi.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
Emon.rsdssi.long_name: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over sea ice
Emon.rsdssi.comment: surface downwelling shortwave radiation over sea ice, computed as the average albedo of the sea ice covered part of a grid cell (mask: sea ice mask)

Emon.rss.comment: Net downward shortwave radiation at the surface

Emon.rsusis.long_name: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over land ice
Emon.rsusis.comment: surface upwelling shortwave radiation over land ice, computed as the average albedo of the land ice covered part of a grid cell (mask: fx.sftgif for models with fixed ice sheets, LImon.sftgif for models with dynamic ice sheets)

Emon.rsuslni.long_name: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over land without ice cover
Emon.rsuslni.comment: surface upwelling shortwave radiation over land, computed as the average albedo of the ice-free part of a grid cell

Emon.rsusoni.long_name: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over ocean without sea ice
Emon.rsusoni.comment: surface upwelling shortwave radiation over ocean without sea ice, computed as the average albedo of the ice-free part of a grid cell

Emon.rsuss.cell_methods: area: time: mean where snow (comment: mask=snc)
Emon.rsuss.long_name: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over snow-covered surfaces
Emon.rsuss.comment: surface upwelling shortwave radiation over snow covered surfaces, computed as the average albedo of the snow-covered part of a grid cell

Emon.rsussi.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
Emon.rsussi.long_name: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over sea ice
Emon.rsussi.comment: surface upwelling shortwave radiation over sea ice, computed as the average albedo of the sea ice covered part of a grid cell (mask: sea ice mask)

Emon.scldncl.long_name: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Stratiform Cloud Tops
Emon.scldncl.comment: This variable represents the monthly mean Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Stratiform Cloud Tops

Emon.sfcWindmax.cell_methods: area: mean time: maximum within days time: mean over days
Emon.sfcWindmax.comment: Daily maximum near-surface (usually, 10 meters) wind speed.

Emon.sw17O.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Emon.sw17O.long_name: Isotopic Ratio of Oxygen-17 in Sea Water
Emon.sw17O.comment: Ratio of abundance of oxygen-17 (17O) atoms to oxygen-16 (16O) atoms in sea water

Emon.sw18O.long_name: Isotopic Ratio of Oxygen-18 in Sea Water
Emon.sw18O.comment: Ratio of abundance of oxygen-18 (18O) atoms to oxygen-16 (16O) atoms in sea water

Emon.sw2H.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Emon.sw2H.long_name: Isotopic Ratio of Deuterium in Sea Water
Emon.sw2H.comment: Ratio of abundance of hydrogen-2 (2H) atoms to hydrogen-1 (1H) atoms in sea water

Emon.sweLut.long_name: Snow Water Equivalent on Land-Use Tile
Emon.sweLut.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "lwe" means liquid water equivalent. "Amount" means mass per unit area. The construction lwe_thickness_of_X_amount or _content means the vertical extent of a layer of liquid water having the same mass per unit area. Surface amount refers to the amount on the ground, excluding that on the plant or vegetation canopy.

Emon.t20d.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

Emon.tasLut.long_name: Near-Surface Air Temperature on Land Use Tile
Emon.tasLut.comment: Air temperature is the bulk temperature of the air, not the surface (skin) temperature.

Emon.tauunoegw.long_name: Eastward Reynolds stress from non-orographic eastward gravity wave parameterization
Emon.tauunoegw.comment: Vertical flux of zonal momentum within the non-orographic GW parameterization associated with the eastward propagating modes.

Emon.tauunowgw.long_name: Eastward Reynolds stress from non-orographic westward gravity wave parameterization
Emon.tauunowgw.comment: Vertical flux of zonal momentum within the non-orographic GW parameterization associated with the westward propagating modes.

Emon.tauuogw.long_name: Eastward Reynolds stress from orographic gravity wave parameterization
Emon.tauuogw.comment: The vertical flux of zonal momentum within the orographic GW parameterization.

Emon.tauvnogw.long_name: Northward Reynolds stress from non-orographic gravity wave parameterization
Emon.tauvnogw.comment: Vertical flux of meridional momentum within the non-orographic GW parameterization.

Emon.tauvogw.long_name: Northward Reynolds stress from orographic gravity wave parameterization
Emon.tauvogw.comment: Vertical flux of meridional momentum within the orographic GW parameterization

Emon.tdps.comment: Dew point temperature is the temperature at which a parcel of air reaches saturation upon being cooled at constant pressure and specific humidity.

Emon.thetaot.long_name: Vertically Averaged Sea Water Potential Temperature

Emon.thetaot2000.long_name: Depth Average Potential Temperature of Upper 2000m

Emon.thetaot300.long_name: Depth Average Potential Temperature of Upper 300m

Emon.thetaot700.long_name: Depth Average Potential Temperature of Upper 700m

Emon.tnhuspbl.long_name: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Boundary Layer Mixing
Emon.tnhuspbl.comment: Includes all boundary layer terms including diffusive terms.

Emon.tnhusscp.long_name: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Stratiform Clouds and Precipitation
Emon.tnhusscp.comment: The phrase "tendency_of_X" means derivative of X with respect to time. "Specific" means per unit mass. Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air. The specification of a physical process by the phrase "due_to_" process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. A variable with the standard name of tendency_of_specific_humidity_due_to_stratiform_cloud_and_precipitation should contain the effects of all processes which convert stratiform clouds and precipitation to or from water vapor. In an atmosphere model, stratiform cloud is that produced by large-scale convergence (not the convection schemes).

Emon.tntd.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Numerical Diffusion
Emon.tntd.comment: This includes any horizontal or vertical numerical temperature diffusion not associated with the parametrized moist physics or the resolved dynamics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be excluded, as should any diffusion which is included in the terms from the resolved dynamics.   This term is required to check the closure of the temperature budget.

Emon.tntmp.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Model Physics
Emon.tntmp.comment: Heating rate due to diabatic processes

Emon.tntpbl.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Boundary Layer Mixing
Emon.tntpbl.comment: Includes all boundary layer terms including diffusive terms.

Emon.tntrlcs.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Clear Sky Longwave Radiative Heating
Emon.tntrlcs.comment: Tendency of Air Temperature due to Clear Sky Longwave Radiative Heating

Emon.tntrscs.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Clear Sky Shortwave Radiative Heating
Emon.tntrscs.comment: Tendency of Air Temperature due to Clear Sky Shortwave Radiative Heating

Emon.tntscp.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Stratiform Clouds and Precipitation
Emon.tntscp.comment: The phrase "tendency_of_X" means derivative of X with respect to time. Air temperature is the bulk temperature of the air, not the surface (skin) temperature. The specification of a physical process by the phrase "due_to_" process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. A variable with the standard name tendency_of_air_temperature_due_to_stratiform_cloud_and_precipitation should contain net latent heating effects of all processes which convert stratiform clouds and precipitation between water vapour, liquid or ice phases. In an atmosphere model, stratiform cloud is that produced by large-scale convergence (not the convection schemes).

Emon.treeFracBdlDcd.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
Emon.treeFracBdlDcd.comment: This is the percentage of the entire grid cell that is covered by broadleaf deciduous trees.

Emon.treeFracBdlEvg.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
Emon.treeFracBdlEvg.comment: This is the percentage of the entire grid cell that is covered by broadleaf evergreen trees.

Emon.treeFracNdlDcd.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
Emon.treeFracNdlDcd.comment: This is the percentage of the entire grid cell that is covered by needleleaf deciduous trees.

Emon.treeFracNdlEvg.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
Emon.treeFracNdlEvg.comment: This is the percentage of the entire grid cell that is covered by needleleaf evergreen trees.

Emon.tslsiLut.comment: Surface temperature (i.e. temperature at which long-wave radiation emitted)

Emon.ua.comment: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).

Emon.utendnogw.long_name: Eastward Acceleration Due to Non-Orographic Gravity Wave Drag
Emon.utendnogw.comment: Tendency of the eastward wind by parameterized nonorographic gravity waves.

Emon.utendogw.long_name: Eastward Acceleration Due to Orographic Gravity Wave Drag
Emon.utendogw.comment: Tendency of the eastward wind by parameterized orographic gravity waves.

Emon.va.comment: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).

Emon.vegFrac.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
Emon.vegFrac.comment: Percentage of grid cell that is covered by vegetation.This SHOULD be the sum of tree, grass (natural and pasture), crop and shrub fractions.

Emon.vegHeight.cell_methods: area: time: mean where vegetation (comment: mask=vegFrac)
Emon.vegHeight.comment: Vegetation height averaged over all vegetation types and over the vegetated fraction of a grid cell.

Emon.vegHeightCrop.cell_methods: area: time: mean where crops (comment: mask=cropFrac)
Emon.vegHeightCrop.comment: Vegetation height averaged over the crop fraction of a grid cell.

Emon.vegHeightGrass.cell_methods: area: time: mean where natural_grasses (comment: mask=grassFrac)
Emon.vegHeightGrass.comment: Vegetation height averaged over the grass fraction of a grid cell.

Emon.vegHeightPasture.cell_methods: area: time: mean where pastures (comment: mask=pastureFrac)
Emon.vegHeightPasture.comment: Vegetation height averaged over the pasture fraction of a grid cell.

Emon.vegHeightShrub.cell_methods: area: time: mean where shrubs (comment: mask=shrubFrac)
Emon.vegHeightShrub.comment: Vegetation height averaged over the shrub fraction of a grid cell.

Emon.vegHeightTree.cell_methods: area: time: mean where trees (comment: mask=treeFrac)
Emon.vegHeightTree.comment: Vegetation height averaged over the tree fraction of a grid cell.

Emon.vtendnogw.long_name: Northward Acceleration Due to Non-Orographic Gravity Wave Drag
Emon.vtendnogw.comment: Tendency of the northward wind by parameterized nonorographic gravity waves.  (Note that CF name tables only have a general northward tendency for all gravity waves, and we need it separated by type.)

Emon.vtendogw.long_name: Northward Acceleration Due to Orographic Gravity Wave Drag
Emon.vtendogw.comment: Tendency of the northward wind by parameterized orographic gravity waves.  (Note that CF name tables only have a general northward tendency for all gravity waves, and we need it separated by type.)

Emon.wetlandCH4.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.wetlandCH4.long_name: Grid Averaged Methane Emissions from Wetlands
Emon.wetlandCH4.comment: Net upward flux of methane (NH4) from wetlands (areas where water covers the soil, or is present either at or near the surface of the soil all year or for varying periods of time during the year, including during the growing season).

Emon.wetlandCH4cons.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.wetlandCH4cons.long_name: Grid Averaged Methane Consumption (Methanotrophy) from Wetlands
Emon.wetlandCH4cons.comment: Biological consumption (methanotrophy) of methane (NH4) by wetlands (areas where water covers the soil, or is present either at or near the surface of the soil all year or for varying periods of time during the year, including during the growing season).

Emon.wetlandCH4prod.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Emon.wetlandCH4prod.long_name: Grid Averaged Methane Production (Methanogenesis) from Wetlands
Emon.wetlandCH4prod.comment: Biological emissions (methanogenesis) of methane (NH4) from wetlands (areas where water covers the soil, or is present either at or near the surface of the soil all year or for varying periods of time during the year, including during the growing season).

Emon.wetlandFrac.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
Emon.wetlandFrac.comment: Percentage of grid cell covered by wetland. Report only one year if  fixed percentage is used, or time series if values are determined dynamically.

Emon.wsgmax100m.long_name: Maximum Wind Speed of Gust at 100m
Emon.wsgmax100m.comment: Maximum Wind Speed of Gust at 100m, monthly

Emon.wsgmax10m.long_name: Maximum Wind Speed of Gust at 10m
Emon.wsgmax10m.comment: Maximum Wind Speed of Gust at 100m, monthly

EmonZ.epfy.long_name: Northward Component of the Eliassen-Palm Flux
EmonZ.epfy.comment: Transformed Eulerian Mean Diagnostics Meridional component Fy of Eliassen-Palm (EP) flux (Fy, Fz) derived from 6hr or higher frequency fields (use daily fields or 12 hr fields if the 6 hr are not available). Please use the definitions given by equation 3.5.3a of Andrews, Holton and Leovy text book, but scaled by density to have units m3 s-2.

EmonZ.epfz.long_name: Upward Component of the Eliassen-Palm Flux

EmonZ.tntc.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Convection

EmonZ.tntmp.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Model Physics

EmonZ.tntnogw.long_name: Temperature Tendency Due to Non-Orographic Gravity Wave Dissipation

EmonZ.tntogw.long_name: Temperature Tendency Due to Orographic Gravity Wave Dissipation

EmonZ.tntrl.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Longwave Radiative Heating

EmonZ.tntrlcs.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Clear Sky Longwave Radiative Heating

EmonZ.tntrs.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Shortwave Radiative Heating

EmonZ.tntrscs.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Clear Sky Shortwave Radiative Heating

EmonZ.tntscp.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Stratiform Clouds and Precipitation

EmonZ.utendepfd.long_name: Tendency of Eastward Wind Due to Eliassen-Palm Flux Divergence
EmonZ.utendepfd.comment: Tendency of the zonal mean zonal wind due to the divergence of the Eliassen-Palm flux.

EmonZ.utendnogw.long_name: Eastward Acceleration Due to Non-Orographic Gravity Wave Drag
EmonZ.utendnogw.comment: Tendency of the eastward wind by parameterized nonorographic gravity waves.

EmonZ.utendogw.long_name: Eastward Acceleration Due to Orographic Gravity Wave Drag

EmonZ.vtem.comment: Transformed Eulerian Mean Diagnostics v\*, meridional component of the residual meridional circulation (v\*, w\*) derived from 6 hr or higher frequency data fields (use instantaneous daily fields or 12 hr fields if the 6 hr data are not available).

EmonZ.wtem.comment: Transformed Eulerian Mean Diagnostics w\*, upward component of the residual meridional circulation (v\*, w\*) derived from 6 hr or higher frequency data fields (use instantaneous daily fields or 12 hr fields if the 6 hr data are not available). Scale height: 6950 m

Esubhr.reffclic.long_name: Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Convective Cloud Ice

Esubhr.reffclis.long_name: Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Stratiform Cloud Ice

Esubhr.reffclwc.long_name: Convective Cloud Liquid Droplet Effective Radius

Esubhr.reffclws.long_name: Stratiform Cloud Liquid Droplet Effective Radius

Esubhr.tnhuspbl.long_name: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Boundary Layer Mixing

Esubhr.tnhusscp.long_name: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Stratiform Clouds and Precipitation

Esubhr.tntd.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Numerical Diffusion

Esubhr.tntpbl.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Boundary Layer Mixing

Esubhr.tntrl.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Longwave Radiative Heating

Esubhr.tntrlcs.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Clear Sky Longwave Radiative Heating

Esubhr.tntrs.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Shortwave Radiative Heating

Esubhr.tntrscs.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Clear Sky Shortwave Radiative Heating

Esubhr.tntscp.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Stratiform Clouds and Precipitation

Eyr.baresoilFrac.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
Eyr.baresoilFrac.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by bare soil.

Eyr.cLitterLut.cell_methods: area: mean where sector time: point
Eyr.cLitterLut.long_name: Carbon  in Above and Below-Ground Litter Pools on Land-Use Tiles
Eyr.cLitterLut.comment: end of year values (not annual mean)

Eyr.cProductLut.cell_methods: area: mean where sector time: point
Eyr.cProductLut.long_name: Wood and Agricultural Product Pool Carbon Associated with Land-Use Tiles
Eyr.cProductLut.comment: Anthropogenic pools associated with land use tiles into which harvests and cleared carbon are deposited before release into atmosphere PLUS any remaining anthropogenic pools that may be associated with lands which were converted into land use tiles during reported period. Examples of products include paper, cardboard, timber for construction, and crop harvest for food or fuel. Does NOT include residue which is deposited into soil or litter; end of year values (not annual mean).

Eyr.cropFrac.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
Eyr.cropFrac.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by crop.

Eyr.cSoilLut.cell_methods: area: mean where sector time: point
Eyr.cSoilLut.long_name: Carbon in Soil Pool on Land-Use Tiles
Eyr.cSoilLut.comment: end of year values (not annual mean)

Eyr.cVegLut.cell_methods: area: mean where sector time: point
Eyr.cVegLut.long_name: Carbon in Vegetation on Land-Use Tiles
Eyr.cVegLut.comment: end of year values (not annual mean)

Eyr.fracInLut.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: sum
Eyr.fracInLut.long_name: Annual Gross Percentage That Was Transferred into This Tile from Other Land-Use Tiles
Eyr.fracInLut.comment: Cumulative percentage transitions over the year; note that percentage should be reported as a percentage of atmospheric grid cell

Eyr.fracLut.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: point
Eyr.fracLut.long_name: Percentage of Grid Cell for Each Land-Use Tile
Eyr.fracLut.comment: End of year values (not annual mean); note that percentage should be reported as percentage of land grid cell (example: frac_lnd = 0.5, frac_ocn = 0.5, frac_crop_lnd = 0.2 (of land portion of grid cell), then frac_lut(crop) = 0.5\*0.2 = 0.1)

Eyr.fracOutLut.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: sum
Eyr.fracOutLut.long_name: Annual Gross Percentage of Land-Use Tile That Was Transferred into Other Land-Use Tiles
Eyr.fracOutLut.comment: Cumulative percentage transitions over the year; note that percentage should be reported as percentage of atmospheric grid cell

Eyr.grassFrac.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
Eyr.grassFrac.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell that is covered by natural grass.

Eyr.residualFrac.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
Eyr.residualFrac.long_name: Percentage of Grid Cell That Is Land but neither Vegetation Covered nor Bare Soil
Eyr.residualFrac.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is land and is covered by  neither vegetation nor bare-soil (e.g., urban, ice, lakes, etc.)

Eyr.shrubFrac.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
Eyr.shrubFrac.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by shrub.

Eyr.treeFrac.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
Eyr.treeFrac.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by trees.

Eyr.vegFrac.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
Eyr.vegFrac.comment: Percentage of grid cell that is covered by vegetation.This SHOULD be the sum of tree, grass (natural and pasture), crop and shrub fractions.

Eyr.zfullo.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Eyr.zfullo.long_name: Depth Below Geoid of Ocean Layer

fx.areacella.long_name: Grid-Cell Area for Atmospheric Grid Variables
fx.areacella.comment: Cell areas for any grid used to report atmospheric variables and any other variable using that grid (e.g., soil moisture content). These cell areas should be defined to enable exact calculation of global integrals (e.g., of vertical fluxes of energy at the surface and top of the atmosphere).

fx.areacellr.long_name: Grid-Cell Area for River Model Variables
fx.areacellr.comment: Cell areas for any grid used to report river model variables (may be the same as for atmospheric variables). These cell areas should be defined to enable exact calculation of area integrals (e.g., of vertical fluxes of energy at the surface and top of the atmosphere).

fx.depthl.comment: depth of a lake; this relates to variable fx.sftlkf and shall provide additional information of the vertical extent of a lake which will influence the heat capacity among other things. This variable shall identify differences in details of the treatment of lakes in climate models.

fx.depthsl.comment: This shall provide the total depth of soil, summed up over all soil layers, that may differ between  models; the idea is to be able to identify differences in treatment of soils across climate models.

fx.lat.comment: Latitude is positive northward; its units of degree_north (or equivalent) indicate this explicitly. In a latitude-longitude system defined with respect to a rotated North Pole, the standard name of grid_latitude should be used instead of latitude. Grid latitude is positive in the grid-northward direction, but its units should be plain degree.

fx.lithk.comment: This variable (named fx.ice?) shall identify the thickness of a prescribed ice sheet. This information is relevant to better understand how different models treat ice. For models where an ice sheet is just orography + an ice sheet mask, I believe the value should be set to zero. For models that explicitly resolve an ice sheet thickness, the thickness of the ice sheet should be provided.

fx.lon.comment: Longitude is positive eastward; its units of degree_east (or equivalent) indicate this explicitly. In a latitude-longitude system defined with respect to a rotated North Pole, the standard name of grid_longitude should be used instead of longitude. Grid longitude is positive in the grid-eastward direction, but its units should be plain degree.

fx.mrsofc.long_name: Capacity of Soil to Store Water (Field Capacity)
fx.mrsofc.comment: reported "where land": divide the total water holding capacity of all the soil in the grid cell by the land area in the grid cell;  reported as "missing" where the land fraction is 0.

fx.orog.comment: height above the geoid; as defined here, "the geoid" is a surface of constant geopotential that, if the ocean were at rest, would coincide with mean sea level. Under this definition, the geoid changes as the mean volume of the ocean changes (e.g., due to glacial melt, or global warming of the ocean).  Reported here is the height above the present-day geoid (0.0 over ocean).

fx.rootd.comment: report the maximum soil depth reachable by plant roots (if defined in model), i.e., the maximum soil depth from which they can extract moisture; report as "missing" where the land fraction is 0.

fx.sftgif.comment: fraction of grid cell occupied by "permanent" ice (i.e., glaciers).

fx.sftlf.long_name: Percentage of the Grid Cell Occupied by Land (Including Lakes)
fx.sftlf.comment: Percentage of horizontal area occupied by land.

fx.sftlkf.comment: This variable describes the fraction of a land surface grid cell that is characterized as lake. It shall complement variable fx.sftlf that defines the fraction of land for a grid cell, while information of the lake fraction could only be indirectly derived (e.g. via LMon.LandCoverFrac). For grid cells fully covered by lake the value should be 1, for grid cells without lake coverage the value should be zero.

fx.zfull.comment: Provide only if altitude of full model levels is fixed

IfxAnt.areacellg.long_name: Grid-Cell Area for Ice Sheet Variables
IfxAnt.areacellg.comment: Cell areas any grid used to report ice sheet variables. These cell areas should be defined to enable exact calculation of area integrals (e.g., of vertical fluxes of energy at the surface and top of the atmosphere)

IfxAnt.hfgeoubed.long_name: Geothermal Heat Flux Beneath Land Ice

IfxAnt.lithk.comment: The thickness of the ice sheet

IfxAnt.topg.comment: The bedrock topography beneath the land ice

IfxGre.areacellg.long_name: Grid-Cell Area for Ice Sheet Variables
IfxGre.areacellg.comment: Cell areas any grid used to report ice sheet variables. These cell areas should be defined to enable exact calculation of area integrals (e.g., of vertical fluxes of energy at the surface and top of the atmosphere)

IfxGre.hfgeoubed.long_name: Geothermal Heat Flux Beneath Land Ice

IfxGre.lithk.comment: The thickness of the ice sheet

IfxGre.topg.comment: The bedrock topography beneath the land ice

ImonAnt.acabf.comment: quantity averaged over ice sheet (grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only. Needed to analyse the impact of downscaling methods, and as forcing for ISM

ImonAnt.hfls.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface latent heat flux is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air on account of evaporation (including sublimation). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

ImonAnt.hfss.comment: The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.

ImonAnt.icem.comment: Loss of ice mass resulting from surface melting. Computed as the total surface melt water on the land ice portion of the grid cell divided by land ice area in the grid cell.

ImonAnt.libmassbffl.cell_methods: area: time: mean where floating_ice_shelf (comment: mask=sftflf)
ImonAnt.libmassbffl.long_name: Basal Specific Mass Balance Flux of Floating Ice Shelf
ImonAnt.libmassbffl.comment: quantity averaged over floating ice shelf

ImonAnt.libmassbfgr.cell_methods: area: time: mean where grounded_ice_sheet (comment: mask=sfgrlf)
ImonAnt.libmassbfgr.long_name: Basal Specific Mass Balance Flux of Grounded Ice Sheet
ImonAnt.libmassbfgr.comment: quantity averaged over grounded ice sheet

ImonAnt.licalvf.comment: Loss of ice mass resulting from iceberg calving. Computed as the rate of mass loss by the ice shelf (in kg s-1) divided by the horizontal area of the ice sheet (m2) in the grid box.

ImonAnt.lifmassbf.long_name: Land Ice Vertical Front Mass Balance Flux
ImonAnt.lifmassbf.comment: Total mass balance at the ice front (or vertical margin). It includes both iceberg calving and melt on vertical ice front

ImonAnt.litempbotfl.cell_methods: area: time: mean where floating_ice_shelf (comment: mask=sftflf)
ImonAnt.litempbotfl.long_name: Basal Temperature of Floating Ice Shelf
ImonAnt.litempbotfl.comment: quantity averaged over floating ice shelf

ImonAnt.litempbotgr.cell_methods: area: time: mean where grounded_ice_sheet (comment: mask=sfgrlf)
ImonAnt.litempbotgr.long_name: Basal Temperature of Grounded Ice Sheet
ImonAnt.litempbotgr.comment: quantity averaged over grounded ice sheet

ImonAnt.litemptop.long_name: Temperature at Top of Ice Sheet Model
ImonAnt.litemptop.comment: quantity averaged over ice sheet (grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only. Needed to analyse the impact of downscaling methods

ImonAnt.mrroLi.comment: Runoff flux over land ice is the difference between any available liquid water in the snowpack less any refreezing. Computed as the sum of rainfall and melt of snow or ice less any refreezing or water retained in the snowpack

ImonAnt.orog.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. Altitude is the (geometric) height above the geoid, which is the reference geopotential surface. The geoid is similar to mean sea level.

ImonAnt.prra.comment: over Land Ice//quantity averaged over ice sheet (grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only. Needed to analyse the impact of downscaling methods

ImonAnt.prsn.comment: quantity averaged over ice sheet (grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only. Needed to analyse the impact of downscaling methods

ImonAnt.rlds.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean "net downward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

ImonAnt.rlus.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

ImonAnt.rsds.comment: Surface solar irradiance for UV calculations.

ImonAnt.rsus.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "shortwave" means shortwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

ImonAnt.sbl.long_name: Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux
ImonAnt.sbl.comment: The snow and ice sublimation flux is the loss of snow and ice mass per unit area from the surface resulting from their direct conversion to water vapor that enters the atmosphere.

ImonAnt.snc.comment: quantity averaged over ice sheet (grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

ImonAnt.snicefreez.long_name: Surface Snow and Ice Refreeze Flux
ImonAnt.snicefreez.comment: Mass flux of surface meltwater which refreezes within the snowpack. Computed as the total refreezing on the land ice portion of the grid cell divided by land ice area in the grid cell.

ImonAnt.snicem.long_name: Surface Snow and Ice Melt Flux
ImonAnt.snicem.comment: Loss of snow and ice mass resulting from surface melting. Computed as the total surface melt on the land ice portion of the grid cell divided by land ice area in the grid cell.

ImonAnt.snm.comment: The total surface snow melt rate on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell; report as zero for snow-free land regions and missing where there is no land.

ImonAnt.tas.comment: quantity averaged over ice sheet (grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only. Needed to analyse the impact of downscaling methods

ImonAnt.ts.comment: quantity averaged over ice sheet (grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only. Needed to analyse the impact of downscaling methods

ImonAnt.tsn.comment: quantity averaged over ice sheet (grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only. Needed to analyse the impact of downscaling methods

ImonGre.acabf.comment: quantity averaged over ice sheet (grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only. Needed to analyse the impact of downscaling methods, and as forcing for ISM

IyrAnt.modelCellAreai.long_name: The Cell Area of the Ice Sheet Model
IyrAnt.modelCellAreai.comment: When interpolated to a regular grid, it should be interpolated (not summed) with a conservative scheme to preserve total area

IyrAnt.orog.comment: This is needed in case the ice sheet elevation changes in time

IyrAnt.sftflf.comment: This is needed in case the floating ice sheet area changes in time (NO grounded ice sheet)

IyrAnt.sftgif.comment: This is needed in case the ice sheet area changes in time
