IyrAnt.xvelbase.long_name: X-Component of Land Ice Basal Velocity
IyrAnt.xvelbase.comment: A velocity is a vector quantity. "x" indicates a vector component along the grid x-axis, positive with increasing x. "Land ice" means glaciers, ice-caps and ice-sheets resting on bedrock and also includes ice-shelves. "basal" means the lower boundary of the land ice.

IyrAnt.xvelmean.long_name: X-Component of Land Ice Vertical Mean Velocity
IyrAnt.xvelmean.comment: The vertical mean land ice velocity is the average from the bedrock to the surface of the ice

IyrAnt.xvelsurf.long_name: X-Component of Land Ice Surface Velocity
IyrAnt.xvelsurf.comment: A velocity is a vector quantity. "x" indicates a vector component along the grid x-axis, positive with increasing x. "Land ice" means glaciers, ice-caps and ice-sheets resting on bedrock and also includes ice-shelves. The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere.

IyrAnt.yvelbase.long_name: Y-Component of Land Ice Basal Velocity
IyrAnt.yvelbase.comment: A velocity is a vector quantity. "y" indicates a vector component along the grid y-axis, positive with increasing y. "Land ice" means glaciers, ice-caps and ice-sheets resting on bedrock and also includes ice-shelves. "basal" means the lower boundary of the land ice.

IyrAnt.yvelmean.long_name: Y-Component of Land Ice Vertical Mean Velocity

IyrAnt.yvelsurf.long_name: Y-Component of Land Ice Surface Velocity
IyrAnt.yvelsurf.comment: A velocity is a vector quantity. "y" indicates a vector component along the grid y-axis, positive with increasing y. "Land ice" means glaciers, ice-caps and ice-sheets resting on bedrock and also includes ice-shelves. The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere.'

IyrAnt.zvelbase.long_name: Upward Component of Land-Ice Basal Velocity
IyrAnt.zvelbase.comment: A velocity is a vector quantity. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). "basal" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere

IyrAnt.zvelsurf.long_name: Upward Component of Land-Ice Surface Velocity

LImon.acabfIs.long_name: Ice Sheet Surface Mass Balance Flux
LImon.acabfIs.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

LImon.agesno.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean (weighted by snow mass on land)
LImon.agesno.comment: When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the mass of snow on the land portion of the grid cell, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.  Reported as "missing in regions free of snow on land.

LImon.hfdsn.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
LImon.hfdsn.long_name: Downward Heat Flux into Snow Where Land over Land
LImon.hfdsn.comment: the net downward heat flux from the atmosphere into the snow that lies on land divided by the land area in the grid cell; reported as missing for snow-free land regions or where the land fraction is 0.

LImon.hflsIs.long_name: Ice Sheet Surface Upward Latent Heat Flux
LImon.hflsIs.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

LImon.hfssIs.long_name: Ice Sheet Surface Upward Sensible Heat Flux
LImon.hfssIs.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

LImon.icemIs.long_name: Ice Sheet Surface Ice Melt Flux
LImon.icemIs.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

LImon.litemptopIs.long_name: Ice Sheet Temperature at Top of Ice Sheet Model
LImon.litemptopIs.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

LImon.lwsnl.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
LImon.lwsnl.long_name: Liquid Water Content of Snow Layer
LImon.lwsnl.comment: where land over land: this is computed as the total mass of liquid water contained interstitially within the snow layer of the land portion of a grid cell divided by the area of the land portion of the cell.

LImon.mrroIs.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

LImon.orogIs.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

LImon.pflw.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
LImon.pflw.long_name: Liquid Water Content of Permafrost Layer
LImon.pflw.comment: "where land over land", i.e., this is the total mass of liquid water contained within the permafrost layer within the land portion of a grid cell divided by the area of the land portion of the cell.

LImon.prraIs.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

LImon.prsnIs.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

LImon.rldsIs.long_name: Ice Sheet Surface Downwelling Longwave Radiation
LImon.rldsIs.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

LImon.rlusIs.long_name: Ice Sheet Surface Upwelling Longwave Radiation
LImon.rlusIs.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

LImon.rsdsIs.long_name: Ice Sheet Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation
LImon.rsdsIs.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

LImon.rsusIs.long_name: Ice Sheet Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation
LImon.rsusIs.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

LImon.sbl.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
LImon.sbl.long_name: Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux
LImon.sbl.comment: The snow and ice sublimation flux is the loss of snow and ice mass resulting from their conversion to water vapor.  Computed as the total sublimation on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell; reported as missing for snow-free land regions; reported as missing where the land fraction is 0.

LImon.sblIs.long_name: Ice Sheet Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux
LImon.sblIs.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

LImon.sftflf.comment: Percentage of grid cell covered by floating ice shelf, the component of the ice sheet that is flowing over sea water

LImon.sftgif.comment: Percentage of grid cell covered by land ice (ice sheet, ice shelf, ice cap, glacier)

LImon.sftgrf.comment: Percentage of grid cell covered by grounded ice sheet

LImon.snc.comment: Fraction of each grid cell that is occupied by snow that rests on land portion of cell.

LImon.sncIs.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

LImon.snd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
LImon.snd.comment: where land over land, this is computed as the mean thickness of snow in the land portion of the grid cell (averaging over the entire land portion, including the snow-free fraction).  Reported as missing where the land fraction is 0.

LImon.snicefreezIs.long_name: Ice Sheet Surface Snow and Ice Refreeze Flux
LImon.snicefreezIs.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

LImon.snicemIs.long_name: Ice Sheet Surface Snow and Ice Melt Flux
LImon.snicemIs.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

LImon.snm.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
LImon.snm.comment: Computed as the total surface melt water on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell; report as 0.0 for snow-free land regions; report as missing where the land fraction is 0.

LImon.snmIs.comment: Loss of snow mass resulting from surface melting. Computed as the surface melt water from snow on the ice sheet portion of the grid cell divided by the ice_sheet area in the grid cell; report as 0.0 for snow-free land_ice regions; report as missing where the land fraction is 0.

LImon.snw.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
LImon.snw.comment: Computed as the mass of surface snow on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell; reported as missing where the land fraction is 0; excluded is snow on vegetation canopy or on sea ice.

LImon.sootsn.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
LImon.sootsn.comment: the entire land portion of the grid cell is considered, with snow soot content set to 0.0 in regions free of snow.

LImon.tasIs.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

LImon.tpf.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
LImon.tpf.comment: where land over land: This is the mean thickness of the permafrost layer in the land portion of the grid cell.  Reported as missing in permafrost-free regions.

LImon.tsIs.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

LImon.tsn.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean (weighted by snow mass on land)
LImon.tsn.comment: This temperature is averaged over all the snow in the grid cell that rests on land or land ice.  When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the mass of snow on the land portion of the grid cell, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.   Reported as "missing in regions free of snow on land.

LImon.tsnIs.comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

Lmon.baresoilFrac.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
Lmon.baresoilFrac.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by bare soil.

Lmon.burntFractionAll.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
Lmon.burntFractionAll.long_name: Percentage of Entire Grid Cell That Is Covered by Burnt Vegetation (All Classes)
Lmon.burntFractionAll.comment: Percentage of grid cell burned due to all fires including natural and anthropogenic fires and those associated with anthropogenic land use change

Lmon.c3PftFrac.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
Lmon.c3PftFrac.long_name: Percentage Cover by C3 Plant Functional Type
Lmon.c3PftFrac.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by C3 PFTs (including grass, crops, and trees).

Lmon.c4PftFrac.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
Lmon.c4PftFrac.long_name: Percentage Cover by C4 Plant Functional Type
Lmon.c4PftFrac.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by C4 PFTs (including grass and crops).

Lmon.cLeaf.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Lmon.cLeaf.comment: Carbon mass per unit area in leaves.

Lmon.cLitter.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Lmon.cLitter.comment: "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The sum of the quantities with standard names surface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon has the standard name litter_mass_content_of_carbon.

Lmon.cProduct.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Lmon.cProduct.long_name: Carbon Mass in Products of Land-Use Change
Lmon.cProduct.comment: Carbon mass per unit area in that has been removed from the environment through  land use change.

Lmon.cRoot.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

Lmon.cropFrac.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
Lmon.cropFrac.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by crop.

Lmon.cVeg.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Lmon.cVeg.comment: Carbon mass per unit area in vegetation.

Lmon.evspsblsoi.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

Lmon.evspsblveg.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Lmon.evspsblveg.comment: the canopy evaporation+sublimation (if present in model).

Lmon.fFire.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Lmon.fFire.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from Fire Excluding Land-Use Change [kgC m-2 s-1]
Lmon.fFire.comment: CO2 emissions (expressed as a carbon mass flux) from natural fires + human ignition fires as calculated by the fire module of the DGVM, but excluding any CO2 flux from fire included in fLuc, defined below (CO2 Flux to Atmosphere from Land Use Change).

Lmon.fLitterSoil.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Lmon.fLitterSoil.long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Litter to Soil
Lmon.fLitterSoil.comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area into soil from litter (dead plant material in or above the soil).

Lmon.fVegLitter.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Lmon.fVegLitter.long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter
Lmon.fVegLitter.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. "Vegetation" means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. The sum of the quantities with standard names mass_flux_of_carbon_into_litter_from_vegetation_due_to_mortality and mass_flux_of_carbon_into_litter_from_vegetation_due_to_senescence is mass_flux_of_carbon_into_litter_from_vegetation.

Lmon.fVegSoil.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Lmon.fVegSoil.long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil
Lmon.fVegSoil.comment: In some models part of carbon (e.g., root exudate) can go directly into the soil pool without entering litter.

Lmon.gpp.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Lmon.gpp.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Gross Primary Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Lmon.gpp.comment: The rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production.

Lmon.grassFrac.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
Lmon.grassFrac.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell that is covered by natural grass.

Lmon.lai.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Lmon.lai.comment: A ratio obtained by dividing the total upper leaf surface area of vegetation by the (horizontal) surface area of the land on which it grows.

Lmon.landCoverFrac.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
Lmon.landCoverFrac.long_name: Percentage of Area by Vegetation or Land-Cover Category
Lmon.landCoverFrac.comment: The categories may differ from model to model, depending on their  PFT definitions.   This may include natural PFTs, anthropogenic PFTs, bare soil, lakes, urban areas, etc.   Sum of all should equal the fraction of the grid-cell that is land.

Lmon.mrfso.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Lmon.mrfso.comment: the mass (summed over all all layers) of frozen water.

Lmon.mrro.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Lmon.mrro.comment: the total runoff (including "drainage" through the base of the soil model) leaving the land portion of the grid cell.

Lmon.mrros.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Lmon.mrros.comment: the total surface runoff leaving the land portion of the grid cell.

Lmon.mrso.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Lmon.mrso.comment: the mass per unit area  (summed over all soil layers) of water in all phases.

Lmon.mrsos.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Lmon.mrsos.long_name: Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column
Lmon.mrsos.comment: the mass of water in all phases in a thin surface soil layer.

Lmon.nbp.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Lmon.nbp.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Net Biospheric Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Lmon.nbp.comment: This is the net mass flux of carbon between land and atmosphere calculated as photosynthesis MINUS the sum of  plant and soil respiration, carbonfluxes  from fire, harvest, grazing  and land use change. Positive flux  is into the land.

Lmon.npp.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Lmon.npp.long_name: Net Primary Production on Land as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Lmon.npp.comment: "Production of carbon" means the production of biomass expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. Net primary production is the excess of gross primary production (rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors) by autotrophs ("producers"), for example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton, over the rate at which the autotrophs themselves respire some of this biomass. "Productivity" means production per unit area. The phrase "expressed_as" is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A.

Lmon.nppLeaf.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Lmon.nppLeaf.long_name: Net Primary Production Allocated to Leaves as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Lmon.nppLeaf.comment: This is the rate of carbon uptake by leaves due to NPP

Lmon.nppRoot.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Lmon.nppRoot.long_name: Net Primary Production Allocated to Roots as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Lmon.nppRoot.comment: This is the rate of carbon uptake by roots due to NPP

Lmon.pastureFrac.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
Lmon.pastureFrac.long_name: Percentage of Land Which Is Anthropogenic Pasture
Lmon.pastureFrac.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by anthropogenic pasture.

Lmon.prveg.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Lmon.prveg.comment: the precipitation flux that is intercepted by the vegetation canopy (if present in model) before reaching the ground.

Lmon.ra.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Lmon.ra.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Lmon.ra.comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to autotrophic respiration on land (respiration by producers) [see rh for heterotrophic production]

Lmon.residualFrac.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
Lmon.residualFrac.long_name: Percentage of Grid Cell That Is Land but neither Vegetation Covered nor Bare Soil
Lmon.residualFrac.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is land and is covered by "non-vegetation" and "non-bare-soil" (e.g., urban, ice, lakes, etc.)

Lmon.rh.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Lmon.rh.long_name: Total Heterotrophic Respiration on Land as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Lmon.rh.comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to heterotrophic respiration on land (respiration by consumers)

Lmon.shrubFrac.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
Lmon.shrubFrac.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by shrub.

Lmon.snw.comment: As snw but defined as Lmon (Not sure about this though - it seems already available as LImon but I'm guessing that's only over land ice?)

Lmon.tran.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Lmon.tran.comment: Transpiration (may include dew formation as a negative flux).

Lmon.treeFrac.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
Lmon.treeFrac.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by trees.

Lmon.tsl.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Lmon.tsl.comment: Temperature of each soil layer.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea".

Oday.bigthetao.comment: Diagnostic should be contributed even for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.

Oday.chl.long_name: Mass Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Oday.chl.comment: Sum of chlorophyll from all phytoplankton group concentrations. In most models this is equal to chldiat+chlmisc, that is the sum of Diatom Chlorophyll Mass Concentration and Other Phytoplankton Chlorophyll Mass Concentration

Oday.chlos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oday.chlos.long_name: Surface Mass Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Oday.chlos.comment: sum of chlorophyll from all phytoplankton group concentrations at the sea surface.  In most models this is equal to chldiat+chlmisc, that is the sum of "Diatom Chlorophyll Mass Concentration" plus "Other Phytoplankton Chlorophyll Mass Concentration"

Oday.co3.comment: Mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3).

Oday.co3os.comment: Near surface mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3).

Oday.co3satarag.long_name: Mole Concentration of Carbonate Ion in Equilibrium with Pure Aragonite in Sea Water
Oday.co3satarag.comment: Mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3) for sea water in equilibrium with pure Aragonite. Aragonite (CaCO3) is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate.

Oday.co3sataragos.long_name: Surface Mole Concentration of Carbonate Ion in Equilibrium with Pure Aragonite in Sea Water
Oday.co3sataragos.comment: Near surface mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3) for sea water in equilibrium with pure Aragonite. Aragonite (CaCO3) is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate.

Oday.detoc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oday.detoc.comment: sum of detrital organic carbon component concentrations

Oday.dissoc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oday.dissoc.comment: Sum of dissolved carbon component concentrations explicitly represented (i.e. not ~40 uM refractory unless explicit)

Oday.expcob.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oday.expcob.long_name: Sinking Flux of Particulate Organic Carbon Reaching the Ocean Bottom
Oday.expcob.comment: Downward sinking flux of particulate organic carbon at seafloor

Oday.hfds.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oday.hfds.long_name: Downward Heat Flux at Sea Water Surface
Oday.hfds.comment: This is the net flux of heat entering the liquid water column through its upper surface (excluding any "flux adjustment") .

Oday.hfx.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oday.hfx.comment: Contains all contributions to "x-ward" heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes.  Use Celsius for temperature scale.

Oday.hfy.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oday.hfy.comment: Contains all contributions to "y-ward" heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Use Celsius for temperature scale.

Oday.intpoc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean

Oday.intpp.long_name: Primary Organic Carbon Production by All Types of Phytoplankton
Oday.intpp.comment: Vertically integrated total primary (organic carbon) production by phytoplankton. This should equal the sum of intpdiat+intpphymisc, but those individual components may be unavailable in some models.

Oday.mlotst.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oday.mlotst.long_name: Ocean Mixed Layer thickness Defined by Sigma T
Oday.mlotst.comment: Thickness of the layer bounded by the depth at which potential density Sigma0 exceeds density at 10m by 0.03 kg.m-3

Oday.o2.comment: 'Mole concentration' means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'.

Oday.o2min.cell_methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean
Oday.o2min.comment: mole concentration of oxygen at the local minimum in the concentration profile that occurs closest to the sea surface.

Oday.o2os.comment: 'Mole concentration' means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'.

Oday.ph.comment: negative log10 of hydrogen ion concentration with the concentration expressed as mol H kg-1.

Oday.phos.comment: negative log10 of hydrogen ion concentration with the concentration expressed as mol H kg-1.

Oday.phyc.comment: sum of phytoplankton carbon component concentrations. In most (all?) cases this is the sum of phycdiat and phycmisc (i.e., "Diatom Carbon Concentration" and "Non-Diatom Phytoplankton Carbon Concentration"

Oday.phycalc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oday.phycalc.long_name: Mole Concentration of Calcareous Phytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Oday.phycalc.comment: carbon concentration from calcareous (calcite-producing) phytoplankton component alone

Oday.phycos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oday.phycos.comment: sum of phytoplankton organic carbon component concentrations at the sea surface

Oday.rsdo.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oday.rsdo.long_name: Downwelling Shortwave Radiation in Sea Water
Oday.rsdo.comment: Downwelling Shortwave Radiation in Sea Water

Oday.so.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oday.so.comment: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation.

Oday.sos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oday.sos.comment: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

Oday.sossq.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oday.sossq.comment: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

Oday.thetao.comment: Diagnostic should be contributed even for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.

Oday.tos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oday.tos.comment: This may differ from "surface temperature" in regions of sea ice or floating ice shelves. For models using conservative temperature as the prognostic field, they should report the top ocean layer as surface potential temperature, which is the same as surface in situ temperature.

Oday.tossq.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oday.tossq.comment: Square of temperature of liquid ocean, averaged over the day.

Oday.uos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oday.uos.comment: This is just uo at high frequency so as to compute KE and vorticity.

Oday.vos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oday.vos.comment: This is just vo for comparison of high-res vs. coarse models and for compound extremes.

Oday.wo.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oday.wo.comment: Prognostic z-ward velocity component resolved by the model.

Oday.zmeso.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oday.zmeso.long_name: Mole Concentration of Mesozooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Oday.zmeso.comment: carbon concentration from mesozooplankton (20-200 um) component alone

Oday.zmicro.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oday.zmicro.long_name: Mole Concentration of microzooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Oday.zmicro.comment: carbon  concentration from the microzooplankton (<20 um) component alone

Oday.zooc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oday.zooc.comment: sum of zooplankton carbon component concentrations

Oday.zos.comment: This is the dynamic sea level, so should have zero global area mean. zos is the effective sea level as if sea ice (and snow) at a grid cell were converted to liquid seawater (Campin et al., 2008). For OMIP, do _not _record inverse barometer responses from sea-ice (and snow) loading in zos. See (Griffies et al, 2016, https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-9-3231-2016).

Oday.zostoga.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oday.zostoga.comment: Global Average Thermosteric Sea Level Change

Odec.bigthetao.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Odec.bigthetao.comment: Diagnostic should be contributed only for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.

Odec.hfbasin.cell_methods: longitude: sum (comment: basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
Odec.hfbasin.comment: Contains contributions from all physical processes affecting the northward heat transport, including resolved advection, parameterized advection, lateral diffusion, etc. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.   Use Celsius for temperature scale.

Odec.hfds.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Odec.hfds.long_name: Downward Heat Flux at Sea Water Surface
Odec.hfds.comment: This is the net flux of heat entering the liquid water column through its upper surface (excluding any "flux adjustment") .

Odec.masscello.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Odec.masscello.comment: For Boussinesq models, report this diagnostic as Boussinesq reference density times grid celll volume.

Odec.masso.cell_methods: area: sum where sea time: mean
Odec.masso.comment: Total mass of liquid sea water. For Boussinesq models, report this diagnostic as Boussinesq reference density times total volume.

Odec.msftmrho.cell_methods: longitude: sum (comment: basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
Odec.msftmrho.comment: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.

Odec.msftmz.cell_methods: longitude: sum (comment: basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
Odec.msftmz.comment: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.

Odec.msftyrho.comment: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.

Odec.msftyz.comment: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.

Odec.sfdsi.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Odec.sfdsi.long_name: Downward Sea Ice Basal Salt Flux
Odec.sfdsi.comment: This field is physical, and it arises since sea ice has a nonzero salt content, so it exchanges salt with the liquid ocean upon melting and freezing.

Odec.sfriver.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Odec.sfriver.long_name: Salt Flux into Sea Water from Rivers
Odec.sfriver.comment: This field is physical, and it arises when rivers carry a nonzero salt content.  Often this is zero, with rivers assumed to be fresh.

Odec.so.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Odec.so.comment: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

Odec.tauuo.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Odec.tauuo.long_name: Sea Water Surface Downward X Stress
Odec.tauuo.comment: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.

Odec.tauvo.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Odec.tauvo.long_name: Sea Water Surface Downward Y Stress
Odec.tauvo.comment: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.

Odec.thetao.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Odec.thetao.comment: Diagnostic should be contributed even for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.

Odec.thkcello.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Odec.thkcello.comment: "Thickness" means the vertical extent of a layer. "Cell" refers to a model grid-cell.

Odec.uo.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Odec.uo.comment: Prognostic x-ward velocity component resolved by the model.

Odec.vo.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Odec.vo.comment: Prognostic y-ward velocity component resolved by the model.

Odec.volcello.cell_methods: area: sum where sea time: mean
Odec.volcello.comment: For oceans with more than 1 mesh (e.g. staggered grids), report areas that apply to surface vertical fluxes of energy. If this field is time-dependent then save it instead as one of your Omon and Odec fields

Odec.volo.cell_methods: area: sum where sea time: mean
Odec.volo.comment: Total volume of liquid sea water.

Odec.wfo.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Odec.wfo.comment: Computed as the water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell. This is the sum \*wfonocorr\* and \*wfcorr\*.

Odec.wo.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Odec.wo.comment: Prognostic z-ward velocity component resolved by the model.

Ofx.areacello.comment: Cell areas for any grid used to report ocean variables and variables which are requested as used on the model ocean grid (e.g. hfsso, which is a downward heat flux from the atmosphere interpolated onto the ocean grid). These cell areas should be defined to enable exact calculation of global integrals (e.g., of vertical fluxes of energy at the surface and top of the atmosphere).

Ofx.basin.comment: A variable with the standard name of region contains strings which indicate geographical regions. These strings must be chosen from the standard region list.

Ofx.deptho.comment: Ocean bathymetry. Reported here is the sea floor depth for present day relative to z=0 geoid. Reported as missing for land grid cells.

Ofx.dxto.comment: The width of the ocean model gridbox in at the t-point (dx)

Ofx.dxuo.long_name: Eastward gridbox length at u points
Ofx.dxuo.comment: The width of the ocean model gridbox in at the u-point (dx)

Ofx.dxvo.long_name: Eastward gridbox length at v points
Ofx.dxvo.comment: The width of the ocean model gridbox in at the v-point (dx)

Ofx.dyto.long_name: Northward gridbox length at t points
Ofx.dyto.comment: The width of the ocean model gridbox in at the t-point (dy)

Ofx.dyuo.long_name: Northward gridbox length at u points
Ofx.dyuo.comment: The width of the ocean model gridbox in at the u-point (dy)

Ofx.dyvo.long_name: Northward gridbox length at v points
Ofx.dyvo.comment: The width of the ocean model gridbox in at the v-point (dy)

Ofx.hfgeou.long_name: Upward Geothermal Heat Flux at Sea Floor
Ofx.hfgeou.comment: Upward geothermal heat flux per unit area on the sea floor

Ofx.masscello.comment: Tracer grid-cell mass per unit area used for computing tracer budgets. For Boussinesq models with static ocean grid cell thickness, masscello = rhozero\*thickcello, where thickcello is static cell thickness and rhozero is constant Boussinesq reference density. More generally, masscello is time dependent and reported as part of Omon.

Ofx.sftof.comment: This is the area fraction at the ocean surface.

Ofx.thkcello.comment: "Thickness" means the vertical extent of a layer. "Cell" refers to a model grid-cell.

Ofx.volcello.comment: For oceans with more than 1 mesh (e.g. staggered grids), report areas that apply to surface vertical fluxes of energy. If this field is time-dependent then save it instead as one of your Omon and Odec fields

Omon.agessc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.agessc.long_name: Sea Water Age Since Surface Contact
Omon.agessc.comment: Time elapsed since water was last in surface layer of the ocean.

Omon.arag.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.arag.comment: sum of particulate aragonite components (e.g. Phytoplankton, Detrital, etc.)

Omon.aragos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.aragos.comment: sum of particulate aragonite components (e.g. Phytoplankton, Detrital, etc.)

Omon.areacello.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.areacello.long_name: Downward Dissolved Oxygen Flux at Ocean Bottom

Omon.baccos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.baccos.comment: sum of bacterial carbon component concentrations

Omon.bigthetao.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.bigthetao.comment: Diagnostic should be contributed only for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.

Omon.bigthetaoga.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.bigthetaoga.long_name: Global Average Sea Water Conservative Temperature
Omon.bigthetaoga.comment: Diagnostic should be contributed only for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.

Omon.calc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.calc.comment: sum of particulate calcite component concentrations (e.g. Phytoplankton, Detrital, etc.)

Omon.calcos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.calcos.comment: sum of particulate calcite component concentrations (e.g. Phytoplankton, Detrital, etc.)

Omon.chl.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.chl.long_name: Mass Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Omon.chl.comment: sum of chlorophyll from all phytoplankton group concentrations.  In most models this is equal to chldiat+chlmisc, that is the sum of "Diatom Chlorophyll Mass Concentration" plus "Other Phytoplankton Chlorophyll Mass Concentration"

Omon.chlcalc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.chlcalc.long_name: Mass Concentration of Calcareous Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Omon.chlcalc.comment: chlorophyll concentration from the calcite-producing phytoplankton component alone

Omon.chlcalcos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.chlcalcos.long_name: Surface Mass Concentration of Calcareous Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Omon.chlcalcos.comment: chlorophyll concentration from the calcite-producing phytoplankton component alone

Omon.chldiat.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.chldiat.long_name: Mass Concentration of Diatoms Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Omon.chldiat.comment: chlorophyll from diatom phytoplankton component concentration alone

Omon.chldiatos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.chldiatos.long_name: Surface Mass Concentration of Diatoms Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Omon.chldiatos.comment: chlorophyll from diatom phytoplankton component concentration alone

Omon.chldiaz.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.chldiaz.long_name: Mass Concentration of Diazotrophs Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Omon.chldiaz.comment: chlorophyll concentration from the diazotrophic phytoplankton component alone

Omon.chldiazos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.chldiazos.long_name: Surface Mass Concentration of Diazotrophs Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Omon.chldiazos.comment: chlorophyll concentration from the diazotrophic phytoplankton component alone

Omon.chlmisc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.chlmisc.long_name: Mass Concentration of Other Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Omon.chlmisc.comment: chlorophyll from additional phytoplankton component concentrations alone

Omon.chlmiscos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.chlmiscos.long_name: Surface Mass Concentration of Other Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Omon.chlmiscos.comment: chlorophyll from additional phytoplankton component concentrations alone

Omon.chlos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.chlos.long_name: Surface Mass Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Omon.chlos.comment: sum of chlorophyll from all phytoplankton group concentrations.  In most models this is equal to chldiat+chlmisc, that is the sum of "Diatom Chlorophyll Mass Concentration" plus "Other Phytoplankton Chlorophyll Mass Concentration"

Omon.chlpico.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.chlpico.long_name: Mass Concentration of Picophytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Omon.chlpico.comment: chlorophyll concentration from the picophytoplankton (<2 um) component alone

Omon.chlpicoos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.chlpicoos.long_name: Surface Mass Concentration of Picophytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Omon.chlpicoos.comment: chlorophyll concentration from the picophytoplankton (<2 um) component alone

Omon.detoc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.detoc.comment: sum of detrital organic carbon component concentrations

Omon.dfe.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.dfe.comment: dissolved iron in sea water is meant to include both Fe2+ and Fe3+ ions (but not, e.g., particulate detrital iron)

Omon.dfeos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.dfeos.comment: dissolved iron in sea water is meant to include both Fe2+ and Fe3+ ions (but not, e.g., particulate detrital iron)

Omon.dissi13c.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

Omon.dissi13cos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

Omon.dissi14cabio.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

Omon.dissi14cabioos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.dissi14cabioos.long_name: Surface Abiotic Dissolved Inorganic Carbon-14 Concentration

Omon.dissic.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

Omon.dissicos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

Omon.dissoc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.dissoc.comment: Sum of dissolved carbon component concentrations explicitly represented (i.e. not ~40 uM refractory unless explicit)

Omon.dmso.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.dmso.long_name: Mole Concentration of Dimethyl Sulphide in Sea Water
Omon.dmso.comment: Mole concentration of dimethyl sulphide in water

Omon.dmsos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.dmsos.long_name: Surface Mole Concentration of Dimethyl Sulphide in Sea Water
Omon.dmsos.comment: Mole concentration of dimethyl sulphide in water in the near surface layer

Omon.dpco2.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.dpco2.comment: Difference in partial pressure of carbon dioxide between sea water and air.  The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium.

Omon.dpo2.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.dpo2.comment: The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium.  The partial pressure of a gaseous constituent of air is the pressure which it alone would exert with unchanged temperature and number of moles per unit volume.  The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere.

Omon.epc100.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.epc100.long_name: Downward Flux of Particulate Organic Carbon
Omon.epc100.comment: The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.

Omon.epc1000.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.epc1000.long_name: Downward Flux of Particulate Organic Carbon at 1000m
Omon.epc1000.comment: The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.

Omon.epcalc100.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.epcalc100.comment: The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid. Calcite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of calcite is CaCO3. Standard names also exist for aragonite, another polymorph of calcium carbonate.

Omon.epcalc1000.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.epcalc1000.comment: The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid. Calcite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of calcite is CaCO3. Standard names also exist for aragonite, another polymorph of calcium carbonate.

Omon.epn100.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.epn100.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.

Omon.epp100.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.epp100.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.

Omon.epsi100.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.epsi100.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.

Omon.evs.cell_methods: area: mean where ice_free_sea over sea time: mean
Omon.evs.long_name: Water Evaporation Flux Where Ice Free Ocean over Sea
Omon.evs.comment: computed as the total mass of water vapor evaporating from the ice-free portion of the ocean  divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

Omon.exparagob.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.exparagob.long_name: Sinking Flux of Aragonite Reaching the Ocean Bottom
Omon.exparagob.comment: Downward sinking flux of aragonite at seafloor

Omon.expc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.expc.long_name: Downward Flux of Particulate Organic Carbon
Omon.expc.comment: Downward flux of particulate organic carbon

Omon.expcalcob.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.expcalcob.long_name: Sinking Flux of Calcite Reaching the Ocean Bottom
Omon.expcalcob.comment: Downward sinking flux of calcite at seafloor

Omon.expcob.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.expcob.long_name: Sinking Flux of Particulate Organic Carbon Reaching the Ocean Bottom
Omon.expcob.comment: Downward sinking flux of particulate organic carbon at seafloor

Omon.expfeob.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.expfeob.long_name: Sinking Flux of Particulate Iron Reaching the Ocean Bottom
Omon.expfeob.comment: Downward sinking flux of particulate iron at seafloor

Omon.expnob.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.expnob.long_name: Sinking Flux of Particulate Organic Nitrogen Reaching the Ocean Bottom
Omon.expnob.comment: Downward sinking flux of particulate organic nitrogen at seafloor

Omon.exppob.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.exppob.long_name: Sinking Flux of Particulate Organic Phosphorus Reaching the Ocean Bottom
Omon.exppob.comment: Downward sinking flux of particulate organic phosphorus at seafloor

Omon.expsiob.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.expsiob.long_name: Sinking Flux of Particulate Silicon Reaching the Ocean Bottom
Omon.expsiob.comment: Downward sinking flux of particulate silicon at seafloor

Omon.fg13co2.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.fg13co2.long_name: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon-13 as 13CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
Omon.fg13co2.comment: Gas exchange flux of abiotic 13CO2 (positive into ocean)

Omon.fg14co2abio.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.fg14co2abio.long_name: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon-14 as Abiotic 14CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
Omon.fg14co2abio.comment: Gas exchange flux of abiotic 14CO2 (positive into ocean)

Omon.fgco2.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.fgco2.long_name: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon as CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
Omon.fgco2.comment: Gas exchange flux of CO2 (positive into ocean)

Omon.fgdms.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.fgdms.comment: Gas exchange flux of DMS (positive into atmosphere)

Omon.ficeberg.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.ficeberg.long_name: Water Flux into Sea Water from Icebergs
Omon.ficeberg.comment: computed as the iceberg melt water  flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

Omon.ficeberg2d.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.ficeberg2d.long_name: Water Flux into Sea Water from Icebergs
Omon.ficeberg2d.comment: computed as the iceberg melt water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

Omon.frfe.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.frfe.comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  "tendency_of_X" means derivative of X with respect to time.

Omon.fric.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.fric.long_name: Downward Inorganic Carbon Flux at Ocean Bottom

Omon.friver.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.friver.long_name: Water Flux into Sea Water from Rivers
Omon.friver.comment: computed as the river flux of water into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

Omon.frn.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.frn.long_name: Nitrogen Loss to Sediments and Through Denitrification
Omon.frn.comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase. 'Denitrification' is the conversion of nitrate into gaseous compounds such as nitric oxide, nitrous oxide and molecular nitrogen which are then emitted to the atmosphere.  'Sedimentation' is the sinking of particulate matter to the floor of a body of water. "tendency_of_X" means derivative of X with respect to time.

Omon.froc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.froc.long_name: Downward Organic Carbon Flux at Ocean Bottom

Omon.fsitherm.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.fsitherm.long_name: Water Flux into Sea Water Due to Sea Ice Thermodynamics
Omon.fsitherm.comment: computed as the sea ice thermodynamic water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

Omon.graz.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.graz.long_name: Total Grazing of Phytoplankton by Zooplankton
Omon.graz.comment: Total grazing of phytoplankton by zooplankton defined as tendency of moles of carbon per cubic metre.

Omon.hfbasin.cell_methods: longitude: sum (comment: basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
Omon.hfbasin.comment: Contains contributions from all physical processes affecting the northward heat transport, including resolved advection, parameterized advection, lateral diffusion, etc. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.   Use Celsius for temperature scale.

Omon.hfbasinpadv.cell_methods: longitude: sum (comment: basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
Omon.hfbasinpadv.long_name: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection
Omon.hfbasinpadv.comment: Contributions to heat transport from parameterized eddy-induced advective transport due to any subgrid advective process. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.  Use Celsius for temperature scale.

Omon.hfbasinpmadv.cell_methods: longitude: sum (comment: basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
Omon.hfbasinpmadv.long_name: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection
Omon.hfbasinpmadv.comment: Contributions to heat transport from parameterized mesoscale eddy-induced advective transport. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.  Use Celsius for temperature scale.

Omon.hfbasinpmdiff.cell_methods: longitude: sum (comment: basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
Omon.hfbasinpmdiff.long_name: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Diffusion
Omon.hfbasinpmdiff.comment: Contributions to heat transport from parameterized mesoscale eddy-induced diffusive transport (i.e., neutral diffusion). Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.

Omon.hfbasinpsmadv.cell_methods: longitude: sum (comment: basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
Omon.hfbasinpsmadv.long_name: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection
Omon.hfbasinpsmadv.comment: Contributions to heat transport from parameterized mesoscale eddy-induced advective transport. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.  Use Celsius for temperature scale.

Omon.hfds.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.hfds.long_name: Downward Heat Flux at Sea Water Surface
Omon.hfds.comment: This is the net flux of heat entering the liquid water column through its upper surface (excluding any "flux adjustment") .

Omon.hfevapds.cell_methods: area: mean where ice_free_sea over sea time: mean
Omon.hfevapds.long_name: Temperature Flux Due to Evaporation Expressed as Heat Flux out of Sea Water
Omon.hfevapds.comment: This is defined as "where ice_free_sea over sea"

Omon.hfgeou.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.hfgeou.long_name: Upward Geothermal Heat Flux at Sea Floor
Omon.hfgeou.comment: Upward geothermal heat flux per unit area on the sea floor

Omon.hfibthermds.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.hfibthermds.long_name: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Iceberg Thermodynamics

Omon.hfibthermds2d.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.hfibthermds2d.long_name: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Iceberg Thermodynamics

Omon.hfrainds.cell_methods: area: mean where ice_free_sea over sea time: mean
Omon.hfrainds.long_name: Temperature Flux Due to Rainfall Expressed as Heat Flux into Sea Water
Omon.hfrainds.comment: This is defined as "where ice_free_sea over sea"; i.e., the total flux (considered here) entering the ice-free portion of the grid cell divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.  All such heat fluxes are computed based on Celsius scale.

Omon.hfrunoffds.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.hfrunoffds.long_name: Temperature Flux Due to Runoff Expressed as Heat Flux into Sea Water
Omon.hfrunoffds.comment: Heat flux associated with liquid water which drains from land. It is calculated relative to the heat that would be transported by runoff water entering the sea at zero degrees Celsius.

Omon.hfrunoffds2d.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.hfrunoffds2d.long_name: Temperature Flux Due to Runoff Expressed as Heat Flux into Sea Water
Omon.hfrunoffds2d.comment: Heat flux associated with liquid water which drains from land. It is calculated relative to the heat that would be transported by runoff water entering the sea at zero degrees Celsius.

Omon.hfsnthermds.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.hfsnthermds.long_name: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Snow Thermodynamics
Omon.hfsnthermds.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  "Snow thermodynamics" refers to the addition or subtraction of mass due to surface and basal fluxes, i.e., due to melting, sublimation and fusion.

Omon.hfsnthermds2d.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.hfsnthermds2d.long_name: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Snow Thermodynamics
Omon.hfsnthermds2d.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  "Snow thermodynamics" refers to the addition or subtraction of mass due to surface and basal fluxes, i.e., due to melting, sublimation and fusion.

Omon.hfx.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.hfx.comment: Contains all contributions to "x-ward" heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes.  Use Celsius for temperature scale.

Omon.hfy.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.hfy.comment: Contains all contributions to "y-ward" heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Use Celsius for temperature scale.

Omon.htovgyre.cell_methods: longitude: sum (comment: basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
Omon.htovgyre.long_name: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Gyre
Omon.htovgyre.comment: From all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.

Omon.htovovrt.cell_methods: longitude: sum (comment: basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
Omon.htovovrt.long_name: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Overturning
Omon.htovovrt.comment: From all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.

Omon.icfriver.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
