Omon.limfecalc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.limfecalc.comment: "Calcareous phytoplankton" are phytoplankton that produce calcite. Calcite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of calcite is CaCO3. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

Omon.limfediat.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.limfediat.comment: Diatoms are phytoplankton with an external skeleton made of silica. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

Omon.limfediaz.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.limfediaz.comment: In ocean modelling, diazotrophs are phytoplankton of the phylum cyanobacteria distinct from other phytoplankton groups in their ability to fix nitrogen gas in addition to nitrate and ammonium. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

Omon.limfemisc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.limfemisc.comment: Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Miscellaneous phytoplankton" are all those phytoplankton that are not diatoms, diazotrophs, calcareous phytoplankton, picophytoplankton or other separately named components of the phytoplankton population. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

Omon.limfepico.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.limfepico.comment: Picophytoplankton are phytoplankton of less than 2 micrometers in size. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

Omon.limirrcalc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.limirrcalc.comment: Growth limitation of calcareous phytoplankton due to solar irradiance. "Growth limitation due to solar irradiance" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

Omon.limirrdiat.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.limirrdiat.comment: Growth limitation of diatoms due to solar irradiance. "Growth limitation due to solar irradiance" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

Omon.limirrdiaz.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.limirrdiaz.comment: Growth limitation of diazotrophs due to solar irradiance. "Growth limitation due to solar irradiance" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

Omon.limirrmisc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.limirrmisc.comment: Growth limitation of miscellaneous phytoplankton due to solar irradiance. "Growth limitation due to solar irradiance" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

Omon.limirrpico.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.limirrpico.comment: Growth limitation of picophytoplankton due to solar irradiance. "Growth limitation due to solar irradiance" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

Omon.limncalc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.limncalc.comment: "Calcareous phytoplankton" are phytoplankton that produce calcite. Calcite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of calcite is CaCO3. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Nitrogen growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

Omon.limndiat.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.limndiat.comment: Diatoms are phytoplankton with an external skeleton made of silica. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Nitrogen growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

Omon.limndiaz.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.limndiaz.comment: In ocean modelling, diazotrophs are phytoplankton of the phylum cyanobacteria distinct from other phytoplankton groups in their ability to fix nitrogen gas in addition to nitrate and ammonium. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Nitrogen growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

Omon.limnmisc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.limnmisc.comment: Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Miscellaneous phytoplankton" are all those phytoplankton that are not diatoms, diazotrophs, calcareous phytoplankton, picophytoplankton or other separately named components of the phytoplankton population. "Nitrogen growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

Omon.limnpico.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.limnpico.comment: Picophytoplankton are phytoplankton of less than 2 micrometers in size. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Nitrogen growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

Omon.masscello.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.masscello.comment: For Boussinesq models, report this diagnostic as Boussinesq reference density times grid celll volume.

Omon.masso.cell_methods: area: sum where sea time: mean
Omon.masso.comment: Total mass of liquid sea water. For Boussinesq models, report this diagnostic as Boussinesq reference density times total volume.

Omon.mfo.comment: Transport across_line means that which crosses a particular line on the Earth's surface; formally this means the integral along the line of the normal component of the transport. The transport should be evaluated for the full depth of the ocean, except for the Pacific Equatorial Undercurrent, which is averaged from the surface to 350m.

Omon.mlotst.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.mlotst.long_name: Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T
Omon.mlotst.comment: Sigma T is potential density referenced to ocean surface.

Omon.mlotstmax.long_name: Maximum Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T
Omon.mlotstmax.comment: Sigma T is potential density referenced to ocean surface.

Omon.mlotstmin.long_name: Minimum Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T
Omon.mlotstmin.comment: Sigma T is potential density referenced to ocean surface.

Omon.mlotstsq.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.mlotstsq.long_name: Square of Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T
Omon.mlotstsq.comment: The phrase "square_of_X" means X\*X. The ocean mixed layer is the upper part of the ocean, regarded as being well-mixed. The base of the mixed layer defined by "temperature", "sigma", "sigma_theta", "sigma_t" or vertical diffusivity is the level at which the quantity indicated differs from its surface value by a certain amount. A coordinate variable or scalar coordinate variable with standard name sea_water_sigma_t_difference can be used to specify the sigma_t criterion that determines the layer thickness. Sigma-t of sea water is the density of water at atmospheric pressure (i.e. the surface) having the same temperature and salinity, minus 1000 kg m-3. "Thickness" means the vertical extent of a layer.

Omon.msftbarot.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.msftbarot.comment: Streamfunction or its approximation for free surface models. See OMDP document for details.

Omon.msftmrho.cell_methods: longitude: sum (comment: basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
Omon.msftmrho.comment: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.

Omon.msftmrhompa.cell_methods: longitude: sum (comment: basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
Omon.msftmrhompa.long_name: Ocean Meridional Overturning Mass Streamfunction Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection
Omon.msftmrhompa.comment: CMIP5 called this "due to Bolus Advection".  Name change respects the more general physics of the mesoscale parameterizations.

Omon.msftmz.cell_methods: longitude: sum (comment: basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
Omon.msftmz.comment: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.

Omon.msftmzmpa.cell_methods: longitude: sum (comment: basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
Omon.msftmzmpa.long_name: Ocean Meridional Overturning Mass Streamfunction Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection
Omon.msftmzmpa.comment: CMIP5 called this "due to Bolus Advection".  Name change respects the more general physics of the mesoscale parameterizations.

Omon.msftmzsmpa.cell_methods: longitude: sum (comment: basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
Omon.msftmzsmpa.long_name: Ocean Meridional Overturning Mass Streamfunction Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection
Omon.msftmzsmpa.comment: Report only if there is a submesoscale eddy parameterization.

Omon.msftyrho.comment: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.

Omon.msftyrhompa.long_name: Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection
Omon.msftyrhompa.comment: CMIP5 called this "due to Bolus Advection".  Name change respects the more general physics of the mesoscale parameterizations.

Omon.msftyz.comment: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.

Omon.msftyzmpa.long_name: Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection
Omon.msftyzmpa.comment: CMIP5 called this "due to Bolus Advection".  Name change respects the more general physics of the mesoscale parameterizations.

Omon.nh4.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.nh4.comment: Mole concentration means moles (amount of substance) per unit volume and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Omon.nh4os.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.nh4os.comment: Mole concentration means moles (amount of substance) per unit volume and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Omon.no3.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.no3.comment: Mole concentration means moles (amount of substance) per unit volume and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Omon.no3os.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.no3os.comment: Mole concentration means moles (amount of substance) per unit volume and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Omon.o2.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.o2.comment: 'Mole concentration' means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'.

Omon.o2os.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.o2os.comment: 'Mole concentration' means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'.

Omon.o2sat.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.o2sat.comment: "Mole concentration at saturation" means the mole concentration in a saturated solution. Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox_expressed_as_nitrogen".

Omon.obvfsq.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.obvfsq.long_name: Square of Brunt Vaisala Frequency in Sea Water
Omon.obvfsq.comment: The phrase "square_of_X" means X\*X. Frequency is the number of oscillations of a wave per unit time. Brunt-Vaisala frequency is also sometimes called "buoyancy frequency" and is a measure of the vertical stratification of the medium.

Omon.pbo.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.pbo.long_name: Sea Water Pressure at Sea Floor
Omon.pbo.comment: "Sea water pressure" is the pressure that exists in the medium of sea water.  It includes the pressure due to overlying sea water, sea ice, air and any other medium that may be present.

Omon.ph.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.ph.comment: negative log10 of hydrogen ion concentration with the concentration expressed as mol H kg-1.

Omon.phos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.phos.comment: negative log10 of hydrogen ion concentration with the concentration expressed as mol H kg-1.

Omon.phyc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.phyc.comment: sum of phytoplankton carbon component concentrations.  In most (all?) cases this is the sum of phycdiat and phycmisc (i.e., "Diatom Carbon Concentration" and "Non-Diatom Phytoplankton Carbon Concentration"

Omon.phycalc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.phycalc.long_name: Mole Concentration of Calcareous Phytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Omon.phycalc.comment: carbon concentration from calcareous (calcite-producing) phytoplankton component alone

Omon.phycalcos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.phycalcos.long_name: Surface Mole Concentration of Calcareous Phytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Omon.phycalcos.comment: carbon concentration from calcareous (calcite-producing) phytoplankton component alone

Omon.phycos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.phycos.comment: sum of phytoplankton carbon component concentrations.  In most (all?) cases this is the sum of phycdiat and phycmisc (i.e., "Diatom Carbon Concentration" and "Non-Diatom Phytoplankton Carbon Concentration"

Omon.phydiat.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.phydiat.long_name: Mole Concentration of Diatoms Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Omon.phydiat.comment: carbon from the diatom phytoplankton component concentration alone

Omon.phydiatos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.phydiatos.long_name: Surface Mole Concentration of Diatoms Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Omon.phydiatos.comment: carbon from the diatom phytoplankton component concentration alone

Omon.phydiazos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.phydiazos.long_name: Surface Mole Concentration of Diazotrophs Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Omon.phydiazos.comment: carbon concentration from the diazotrophic phytoplankton component alone

Omon.phymisc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.phymisc.long_name: Mole Concentration of Miscellaneous Phytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Omon.phymisc.comment: carbon concentration from additional phytoplankton component alone

Omon.phymiscos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.phymiscos.long_name: Surface Mole Concentration of Miscellaneous Phytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Omon.phymiscos.comment: carbon concentration from additional phytoplankton component alone

Omon.phypico.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.phypico.long_name: Mole Concentration of Picophytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Omon.phypico.comment: carbon concentration from the picophytoplankton (<2 um) component alone

Omon.phypicoos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.phypicoos.long_name: Surface Mole Concentration of Picophytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Omon.phypicoos.comment: carbon concentration from the picophytoplankton (<2 um) component alone

Omon.po4.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.po4.comment: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox_expressed_as_nitrogen". "Dissolved inorganic phosphorus" means the sum of all inorganic phosphorus in solution (including phosphate, hydrogen phosphate, dihydrogen phosphate, and phosphoric acid).

Omon.pp.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.pp.comment: total primary (organic carbon) production by phytoplankton

Omon.ppos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.ppos.comment: total primary (organic carbon) production by phytoplankton

Omon.pso.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.pso.long_name: Sea Water Pressure at Sea Water Surface
Omon.pso.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere.  "Sea water pressure" is the pressure that exists in the medium of sea water.  It includes the pressure due to overlying sea water, sea ice, air and any other medium that may be present.

Omon.sf6.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.sf6.long_name: Mole Concentration of SF6 in Sea Water
Omon.sf6.comment: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox_expressed_as_nitrogen". The chemical formula of sulfur hexafluoride is SF6.

Omon.sfdsi.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.sfdsi.long_name: Downward Sea Ice Basal Salt Flux
Omon.sfdsi.comment: This field is physical, and it arises since sea ice has a nonzero salt content, so it exchanges salt with the liquid ocean upon melting and freezing.

Omon.sfriver.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.sfriver.long_name: Salt Flux into Sea Water from Rivers
Omon.sfriver.comment: This field is physical, and it arises when rivers carry a nonzero salt content.  Often this is zero, with rivers assumed to be fresh.

Omon.sfx.comment: Contains all contributions to "x-ward" heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes.

Omon.sfy.comment: Contains all contributions to 'y-ward' salt transport from resolved and parameterized processes.

Omon.si.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.si.comment: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox_expressed_as_nitrogen". "Dissolved inorganic silicon" means the sum of all inorganic silicon in solution (including silicic acid and its first dissociated anion SiO(OH)3-).

Omon.sios.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.sios.long_name: Surface Total Dissolved Inorganic Silicon Concentration
Omon.sios.comment: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox_expressed_as_nitrogen". "Dissolved inorganic silicon" means the sum of all inorganic silicon in solution (including silicic acid and its first dissociated anion SiO(OH)3-).

Omon.sltbasin.cell_methods: longitude: sum (comment: basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
Omon.sltbasin.comment: This refers to the already available definitions of Omon.sltovgyre and Omon.sltovovrt, but should provide the total northward salt transport including all contributions (similar to heat transport, were a measure of the total transport exists via hfbasin); I believe that no cell measure apply and selected --Mod only since I was forced to select one of the options.

Omon.sltovgyre.cell_methods: longitude: sum (comment: basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
Omon.sltovgyre.long_name: Northward Ocean Salt Transport Due to Gyre
Omon.sltovgyre.comment: From all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.

Omon.sltovovrt.cell_methods: longitude: sum (comment: basin sum [along zig-zag grid path]) depth: sum time: mean
Omon.sltovovrt.long_name: Northward Ocean Salt Transport Due to Overturning
Omon.sltovovrt.comment: From all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.

Omon.so.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.so.comment: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

Omon.sob.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.sob.long_name: Sea Water Salinity at Sea Floor
Omon.sob.comment: Model prognostic salinity at bottom-most model grid cell

Omon.soga.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.soga.comment: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

Omon.sos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.sos.comment: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

Omon.sosga.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.sosga.comment: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

Omon.sossq.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.sossq.comment: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

Omon.spco2.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.spco2.long_name: Surface Aqueous Partial Pressure of CO2
Omon.spco2.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium. The partial pressure of a gaseous constituent of air is the pressure which it alone would exert with unchanged temperature and number of moles per unit volume. The chemical formula for carbon dioxide is CO2.

Omon.talk.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.talk.comment: total alkalinity equivalent concentration (including carbonate, borate, phosphorus, silicon, and nitrogen components)

Omon.tauuo.long_name: Sea Water Surface Downward X Stress
Omon.tauuo.comment: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.

Omon.tauvo.long_name: Sea Water Surface Downward Y Stress
Omon.tauvo.comment: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.

Omon.thetao.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.thetao.comment: Diagnostic should be contributed even for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.

Omon.thetaoga.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.thetaoga.long_name: Global Average Sea Water Potential Temperature
Omon.thetaoga.comment: Diagnostic should be contributed even for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field

Omon.thkcello.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.thkcello.comment: "Thickness" means the vertical extent of a layer. "Cell" refers to a model grid-cell.

Omon.thkcelloPt.long_name: Time Varying Gridbox thickness at t-points
Omon.thkcelloPt.comment: The time varying thickness of the gridboxes computed on the t-points

Omon.thkcelluo.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.thkcelluo.long_name: Time Varying Gridbox thickness at u-points
Omon.thkcelluo.comment: The time varying thickness of the gridboxes computed on the u-points

Omon.thkcellvo.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.thkcellvo.long_name: Time Varying Gridbox thickness at v-points
Omon.thkcellvo.comment: The time varying thickness of the gridboxes computed on the v-points

Omon.tob.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.tob.long_name: Sea Water Potential Temperature at Sea Floor
Omon.tob.comment: Potential temperature at the ocean bottom-most grid cell.

Omon.tos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.tos.comment: This may differ from "surface temperature" in regions of sea ice or floating ice shelves. For models using conservative temperature as the prognostic field, they should report the top ocean layer as surface potential temperature, which is the same as surface in situ temperature.

Omon.tosga.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.tosga.comment: This may differ from "surface temperature" in regions of sea ice or floating ice shelves. For models using conservative temperature as the prognostic field, they should report the top ocean layer as surface potential temperature, which is the same as surface in situ temperature.

Omon.tossq.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.tossq.comment: Square of temperature of liquid ocean, averaged over the day.

Omon.umo.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.umo.comment: X-ward mass transport from residual mean (resolved plus parameterized) advective transport.

Omon.uo.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.uo.comment: Prognostic x-ward velocity component resolved by the model.

Omon.vmo.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.vmo.comment: Y-ward mass transport from residual mean (resolved plus parameterized) advective transport.

Omon.vo.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.vo.comment: Prognostic y-ward velocity component resolved by the model.

Omon.volcello.cell_methods: area: sum where sea time: mean
Omon.volcello.comment: For oceans with more than 1 mesh (e.g. staggered grids), report areas that apply to surface vertical fluxes of energy. If this field is time-dependent then save it instead as one of your Omon and Odec fields

Omon.volo.cell_methods: area: sum where sea time: mean
Omon.volo.comment: Total volume of liquid sea water.

Omon.vsf.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.vsf.long_name: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water
Omon.vsf.comment: It is set to zero in models which receive a real water flux.

Omon.vsfcorr.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.vsfcorr.comment: It is set to zero in models which receive a real water flux.

Omon.vsfevap.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.vsfevap.long_name: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water Due to Evaporation
Omon.vsfevap.comment: zero for models using real water fluxes.

Omon.vsfpr.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.vsfpr.long_name: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water Due to Rainfall
Omon.vsfpr.comment: zero for models using real water fluxes.

Omon.vsfriver.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.vsfriver.long_name: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water from Rivers
Omon.vsfriver.comment: zero for models using real water fluxes.

Omon.vsfsit.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.vsfsit.long_name: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water Due to Sea Ice Thermodynamics
Omon.vsfsit.comment: This variable measures the virtual salt flux into sea water due to the melting of sea ice. It is set to zero in models which receive a real water flux.

Omon.wfcorr.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.wfcorr.comment: Computed as the water flux into the ocean due to flux correction divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

Omon.wfo.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.wfo.comment: Computed as the water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell. This is the sum \*wfonocorr\* and \*wfcorr\*.

Omon.wmo.cell_methods: area: sum where sea time: mean
Omon.wmo.comment: Upward mass transport from residual mean (resolved plus parameterized) advective transport.

Omon.wo.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.wo.comment: Prognostic z-ward velocity component resolved by the model.

Omon.zmeso.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.zmeso.long_name: Mole Concentration of Mesozooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Omon.zmeso.comment: carbon  concentration from mesozooplankton (20-200 um) component alone

Omon.zmesoos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.zmesoos.long_name: Surface Mole Concentration of Mesozooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Omon.zmesoos.comment: carbon  concentration from mesozooplankton (20-200 um) component alone

Omon.zmicro.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.zmicro.long_name: Mole Concentration of Microzooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Omon.zmicro.comment: carbon  concentration from the microzooplankton (<20 um) component alone

Omon.zmicroos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.zmicroos.long_name: Surface Mole Concentration of Microzooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Omon.zmicroos.comment: carbon  concentration from the microzooplankton (<20 um) component alone

Omon.zmisc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.zmisc.long_name: Mole Concentration of Other Zooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Omon.zmisc.comment: carbon from additional zooplankton component concentrations alone (e.g. Micro, meso).  Since the models all have different numbers of components, this variable has been included to provide a check for intercomparison between models since some phytoplankton groups are supersets.

Omon.zmiscos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.zmiscos.long_name: Surface Mole Concentration of Other Zooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Omon.zmiscos.comment: carbon from additional zooplankton component concentrations alone (e.g. Micro, meso).  Since the models all have different numbers of components, this variable has been included to provide a check for intercomparison between models since some phytoplankton groups are supersets.

Omon.zooc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.zooc.comment: sum of zooplankton carbon component concentrations

Omon.zoocos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.zoocos.comment: sum of zooplankton carbon component concentrations

Omon.zos.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.zos.comment: This is the dynamic sea level, so should have zero global area mean. It should not include inverse barometer depressions from sea ice.

Omon.zossq.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.zossq.long_name: Square of Sea Surface Height Above Geoid

Omon.zostoga.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Omon.zostoga.long_name: Global Average Thermosteric Sea Level Change
Omon.zostoga.comment: There is no CMIP6 request for zosga nor zossga.

Oyr.difmxybo.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oyr.difmxybo.comment: Lateral biharmonic viscosity applied to the momentum equations.

Oyr.difmxylo.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oyr.difmxylo.comment: Lateral Laplacian viscosity applied to the momentum equations.

Oyr.diftrblo.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oyr.diftrblo.long_name: Ocean Tracer Diffusivity Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection
Oyr.diftrblo.comment: Ocean tracer diffusivity associated with parameterized eddy-induced advective transport. Sometimes this diffusivity is called the "thickness" diffusivity. For CMIP5, this diagnostic was called "ocean tracer bolus laplacian diffusivity".  The CMIP6 name is physically more relevant.

Oyr.diftrelo.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oyr.diftrelo.comment: Ocean tracer diffusivity associated with parameterized eddy-induced diffusive transport oriented along neutral or isopycnal directions. Sometimes this diffusivity is called the neutral diffusivity or isopycnal diffusivity or Redi diffusivity.

Oyr.difvho.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oyr.difvho.comment: Vertical/dianeutral diffusivity applied to prognostic temperature field.

Oyr.difvso.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oyr.difvso.comment: Vertical/dianeutral diffusivity applied to prognostic salinity field.

Oyr.dispkexyfo.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oyr.dispkexyfo.long_name: Ocean Kinetic Energy Dissipation per Unit Area Due to XY Friction
Oyr.dispkexyfo.comment: Depth integrated impacts on kinetic energy arising from lateral frictional dissipation associated with Laplacian and/or biharmonic viscosity. For CMIP5, this diagnostic was 3d, whereas the CMIP6 depth integrated diagnostic is sufficient for many purposes and reduces archive requirements.

Oyr.ocontempdiff.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oyr.ocontempdiff.long_name: Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Dianeutral Mixing
Oyr.ocontempdiff.comment: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized dianeutral mixing. Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field.

Oyr.ocontempmint.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oyr.ocontempmint.long_name: Depth Integral of Product of Sea Water Density and Conservative Temperature
Oyr.ocontempmint.comment: Full column sum of density\*cell thickness\*conservative temperature. If the model is Boussinesq, then use Boussinesq reference density for the density factor.

Oyr.ocontemppadvect.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oyr.ocontemppadvect.long_name: Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection
Oyr.ocontemppadvect.comment: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized eddy advection (all forms of eddy advection). Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field.

Oyr.ocontemppmdiff.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oyr.ocontemppmdiff.long_name: Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Diffusion
Oyr.ocontemppmdiff.comment: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized mesoscale eddy diffusion. Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field.

Oyr.ocontemppsmadvect.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oyr.ocontemppsmadvect.long_name: Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection
Oyr.ocontemppsmadvect.comment: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized submesoscale eddy advection. Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field.

Oyr.ocontemprmadvect.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oyr.ocontemprmadvect.long_name: Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Residual Mean Advection
Oyr.ocontemprmadvect.comment: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from residual mean  (sum of Eulerian mean + parameterized eddy-induced) advection. Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field.

Oyr.ocontemptend.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oyr.ocontemptend.long_name: Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content
Oyr.ocontemptend.comment: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from all processes. Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field.

Oyr.opottempdiff.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oyr.opottempdiff.long_name: Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Dianeutral Mixing
Oyr.opottempdiff.comment: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized dianeutral mixing. Reported only for models that use potential temperature as prognostic field.

Oyr.opottempmint.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oyr.opottempmint.long_name: Integral with Respect to Depth of Product of Sea Water Density and Potential Temperature
Oyr.opottempmint.comment: Full column sum of density\*cell thickness\*potential temperature. If the model is Boussinesq, then use Boussinesq reference density for the density factor.

Oyr.opottemppadvect.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oyr.opottemppadvect.long_name: Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection
Oyr.opottemppadvect.comment: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized  eddy advection (all forms of eddy advection). Reported only for models that use potential temperature as prognostic field.

Oyr.opottemppmdiff.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oyr.opottemppmdiff.long_name: Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Diffusion
Oyr.opottemppmdiff.comment: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized mesoscale eddy diffusion. Reported only for models that use potential temperature as prognostic field.

Oyr.opottemppsmadvect.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oyr.opottemppsmadvect.long_name: Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection
Oyr.opottemppsmadvect.comment: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized submesoscale eddy advection. Reported only for models that use potential temperature as prognostic field.

Oyr.opottemprmadvect.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oyr.opottemprmadvect.long_name: Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Residual Mean Advection
Oyr.opottemprmadvect.comment: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from residual mean (sum of Eulerian mean + parameterized eddy-induced) advection. Reported only for models that use potential temperature as prognostic field.

Oyr.opottemptend.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oyr.opottemptend.long_name: Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content
Oyr.opottemptend.comment: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from all processes. Reported only for models that use potential temperature as prognostic field.

Oyr.osaltdiff.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oyr.osaltdiff.long_name: Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content Due to Parameterized Dianeutral Mixing
Oyr.osaltdiff.comment: Tendency of salt content for a grid cell from parameterized dianeutral mixing.

Oyr.osaltpadvect.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oyr.osaltpadvect.long_name: Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection
Oyr.osaltpadvect.comment: Tendency of salt content for a grid cell from parameterized eddy advection (any form of eddy advection).

Oyr.osaltpmdiff.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oyr.osaltpmdiff.long_name: Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Diffusion
Oyr.osaltpmdiff.comment: Tendency of salt content for a grid cell from parameterized mesoscale eddy diffusion.

Oyr.osaltpsmadvect.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oyr.osaltpsmadvect.long_name: Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection
Oyr.osaltpsmadvect.comment: Tendency of salt content for a grid cell from parameterized submesoscale eddy advection.

Oyr.osaltrmadvect.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oyr.osaltrmadvect.long_name: Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content Due to Residual Mean Advection
Oyr.osaltrmadvect.comment: Tendency of salt content for a grid cell from residual mean  (sum of Eulerian mean + parameterized eddy-induced)  advection.

Oyr.osalttend.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oyr.osalttend.long_name: Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content
Oyr.osalttend.comment: Tendency of salt content for a grid cell from all processes.

Oyr.rsdoabsorb.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oyr.rsdoabsorb.long_name: Net Rate of Absorption of Shortwave Energy in Ocean Layer
Oyr.rsdoabsorb.comment: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from penetrative shortwave radiation within a grid cell.

Oyr.somint.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oyr.somint.long_name: Depth Integral of Product of Sea Water Density and Prognostic Salinity
Oyr.somint.comment: Full column sum of density\*cell thickness\*salinity. If the model is Boussinesq, then use Boussinesq reference density for the density factor.

Oyr.tnkebto.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oyr.tnkebto.long_name: Tendency of Ocean Eddy Kinetic Energy Content Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection
Oyr.tnkebto.comment: Depth integrated impacts on kinetic energy arising from parameterized eddy-induced advection. For CMIP5, this diagnostic was 3d, whereas the CMIP6 depth integrated diagnostic is sufficient for many purposes and reduces archive requirements.

Oyr.tnpeo.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Oyr.tnpeo.long_name: Tendency of Ocean Potential Energy Content
Oyr.tnpeo.comment: Rate that work is done against vertical stratification, as measured by the vertical heat and salt diffusivity. Report here as depth integrated two-dimensional field.

Oyr.volcello.cell_methods: area: sum where sea time: mean
Oyr.volcello.comment: For oceans with more than 1 mesh (e.g. staggered grids), report areas that apply to surface vertical fluxes of energy. If this field is time-dependent then save it instead as one of your Omon and Odec fields

SIday.siage.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)

SIday.siarean.comment: Total integrated area of sea ice in the Northern Hemisphere (where siconc > 0). Does not include grid cells partially covered by land.

SIday.siareas.comment: Total integrated area of sea ice in the Southern Hemisphere (where siconc > 0). Does not include grid cells partially covered by land.

SIday.siconc.comment: Percentage of grid cell covered by sea ice

SIday.siconca.comment: Percentage of grid cell covered by sea ice

SIday.siextentn.comment: Total integrated area of all Northern Hemisphere grid cells that are covered by at least 15% areal fraction of sea ice (siconc >= 0.15). Does not include grid cells partially covered by land.

SIday.siextents.comment: Total integrated area of all Southern Hemisphere grid cells that are covered by at least 15% areal fraction of sea ice (siconc >= 0.15). Does not include grid cells partially covered by land.

SIday.sifb.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SIday.sifb.comment: Mean height of sea-ice surface (=snow-ice interface when snow covered) above sea level

SIday.siflcondbot.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SIday.siflcondbot.long_name: daily Net Conductive Heat Fluxes in Ice at the Bottom
SIday.siflcondbot.comment: the net heat conduction flux at the ice base

SIday.siflcondtop.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SIday.siflcondtop.long_name: Daily Net Conductive Heat Flux in Ice at the Surface
SIday.siflcondtop.comment: the net heat conduction flux at the ice surface

SIday.sifllattop.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SIday.sifllattop.long_name: daily Net Latent Heat Flux over Sea Ice
SIday.sifllattop.comment: the net latent heat flux over sea ice

SIday.sifllwdtop.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SIday.sifllwdtop.long_name: Daily Downwelling Longwave Flux over Sea Ice
SIday.sifllwdtop.comment: the downwelling longwave flux over sea ice (always positive)

SIday.sifllwutop.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SIday.sifllwutop.long_name: Daily Upwelling Longwave Flux over Sea Ice
SIday.sifllwutop.comment: the upwelling longwave flux over sea ice (always negative)

SIday.siflsensbot.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SIday.siflsensbot.long_name: Daily Net Upward Sensible Heat Flux Under Sea Ice
SIday.siflsensbot.comment: the net sensible heat flux under sea ice from the ocean

SIday.siflsenstop.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SIday.siflsenstop.long_name: Daily Net Upward Sensible Heat Flux over Sea Ice
SIday.siflsenstop.comment: the net sensible heat flux over sea ice

SIday.siflswdbot.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SIday.siflswdbot.long_name: Daily Downwelling Shortwave Flux under Sea Ice
SIday.siflswdbot.comment: The downwelling shortwave flux underneath sea ice (always positive)

SIday.siflswdtop.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SIday.siflswdtop.long_name: Daily Downwelling Shortwave Flux over Sea Ice
SIday.siflswdtop.comment: The downwelling shortwave flux over sea ice (always positive by sign convention)

SIday.siflswutop.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SIday.siflswutop.long_name: Daily Upwelling Shortwave Flux over Sea Ice
SIday.siflswutop.comment: The upwelling shortwave flux over sea ice (always negative)

SIday.sihc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
SIday.sihc.comment: Sea-Ice Heat Content per Unit Area at daily mean

SIday.siitdconc.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SIday.siitdconc.long_name: Sea-Ice Area Percentages in Thickness Categories

SIday.siitdsnconc.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SIday.siitdsnconc.long_name: Snow Area Percentages in Ice Thickness Categories

SIday.siitdsnthick.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SIday.siitdsnthick.long_name: Snow Thickness in Ice Thickness Categories

SIday.siitdthick.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)

SIday.simpconc.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SIday.simpconc.long_name: Percentage Cover of Sea Ice by Meltpond
SIday.simpconc.comment: Percentage of sea ice, by area, which is covered by melt ponds, giving equal weight to every square metre of sea ice .

SIday.simpeffconc.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SIday.simpeffconc.long_name: Fraction of Sea Ice Covered by Effective Melt Pond
SIday.simpeffconc.comment: Area fraction of sea-ice surface that is covered by open melt ponds, that is melt ponds that are not covered by snow or ice lids. This represents the effective (i.e. radiatively-active) melt pond area fraction.

SIday.simprefrozen.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SIday.simprefrozen.long_name: Thickness of Refrozen Ice on Melt Pond
SIday.simprefrozen.comment: Volume of refrozen ice on melt ponds divided by meltpond covered area

SIday.simpthick.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SIday.simpthick.long_name: Meltpond Mass per Unit Area (as Depth)

SIday.sirdgconc.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SIday.sirdgconc.long_name: Percentage Cover of Sea Ice by Ridging
SIday.sirdgconc.comment: Fraction of sea ice, by area, which is covered by sea ice ridges, giving equal weight to every square metre of sea ice .

SIday.sirdgthick.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SIday.sirdgthick.comment: Sea Ice Ridge Height (representing mean height over the ridged area)

SIday.sisali.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SIday.sisali.comment: Mean sea-ice salinity of all sea ice in grid cell

SIday.sisaltmass.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SIday.sisaltmass.long_name: Mass of Salt in Sea Ice per Area
SIday.sisaltmass.comment: Total mass of all salt in sea ice divided by grid-cell area

SIday.sisnhc.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SIday.sisnhc.long_name: Daily Snow Heat Content per Unit Area
SIday.sisnhc.comment: Heat-content of all snow in grid cell divided by total grid-cell area. Snow-water equivalent at 0 Celsius is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J.  Does not include heat content of sea ice.

SIday.sisnmassn.long_name: Snow Mass on Sea Ice North
SIday.sisnmassn.comment: Total integrated mass of snow on sea ice in the Northern Hemisphere.

SIday.sisnmasss.long_name: Snow Mass on Sea Ice South
SIday.sisnmasss.comment: Total integrated mass of snow on sea ice in the Southern Hemisphere.

SIday.sisnthick.cell_methods: area: mean where snow over sea_ice area: time: mean where sea_ice
SIday.sisnthick.comment: Actual thickness of snow (snow volume divided by snow-covered area)

SIday.sispeed.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SIday.sispeed.comment: Speed of ice (i.e. mean absolute velocity) to account for back-and-forth movement of the ice

SIday.sitempbot.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SIday.sitempbot.comment: Report temperature at interface, NOT temperature within lowermost model layer

SIday.sitempsnic.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SIday.sitempsnic.comment: Report surface temperature of ice where snow thickness is zero

SIday.sitemptop.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SIday.sitemptop.comment: Report surface temperature of snow where snow covers the sea ice.

SIday.sithick.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SIday.sithick.comment: Actual (floe) thickness of sea ice (NOT volume divided by grid area as was done in CMIP5)

SIday.sitimefrac.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
SIday.sitimefrac.long_name: Fraction of Time Steps with Sea Ice
SIday.sitimefrac.comment: Fraction of time steps of the averaging period during which sea ice is present (siconc >0 ) in a grid cell

SIday.siu.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SIday.siu.comment: The x-velocity of ice on native model grid

SIday.siv.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SIday.siv.comment: The y-velocity of ice on native model grid

SIday.sivoln.comment: Total integrated volume of sea ice in the Northern Hemisphere.

SIday.sivols.comment: Total integrated volume of sea ice in the Southern Hemisphere.

SImon.siage.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)

SImon.sialgc.comment: Sum of ice algal carbon component content

SImon.siarean.comment: total area of sea ice in the Northern hemisphere

SImon.siareas.comment: total area of sea ice in the Southern hemisphere

SImon.sichl.long_name: Amount of Total Ice Algae Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Ice
SImon.sichl.comment: Sum of chlorophyll from all ice algal group concentrations

SImon.sicompstren.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.sicompstren.comment: Computed strength of the ice pack, defined as the energy (J m-2) dissipated per unit area removed from the ice pack under compression, and assumed proportional to the change in potential energy caused by ridging. For Hibler-type models, this is P (= P\*h exp(-C(1-A)) where P\* is compressive strength, h ice thickness, A compactness and C strength reduction constant).

SImon.siconc.comment: Percentage of grid cell covered by sea ice

SImon.siconca.comment: Percentage of grid cell covered by sea ice

SImon.sidconcdyn.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
SImon.sidconcdyn.long_name: Sea-Ice Area Percentage Tendency Due to Dynamics
SImon.sidconcdyn.comment: Total change in sea-ice area fraction through dynamics-related processes (advection, divergence...)

SImon.sidconcth.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
SImon.sidconcth.long_name: Sea-Ice Area Percentage Tendency Due to Thermodynamics
SImon.sidconcth.comment: Total change in sea-ice area fraction through thermodynamic processes

SImon.sidivvel.cell_methods: area: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc) time: point
SImon.sidivvel.long_name: Divergence of the Sea-Ice Velocity Field
SImon.sidivvel.comment: Divergence of sea-ice velocity field (first shear strain invariant)

SImon.sidmassdyn.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
SImon.sidmassdyn.comment: Total change in sea-ice mass through dynamics-related processes (advection,...) divided by grid-cell area

SImon.sidmassevapsubl.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
SImon.sidmassevapsubl.long_name: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Evaporation and Sublimation
SImon.sidmassevapsubl.comment: The rate of change of sea-ice mass change through evaporation and sublimation divided by grid-cell area

SImon.sidmassgrowthbot.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
SImon.sidmassgrowthbot.long_name: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Basal Growth
SImon.sidmassgrowthbot.comment: The rate of change of sea ice mass due to vertical growth of existing sea ice at its base divided by grid-cell area.

SImon.sidmassgrowthsi.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
SImon.sidmassgrowthsi.long_name: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Snow-to-Ice Conversion
SImon.sidmassgrowthsi.comment: The rate of change of sea ice mass due to transformation of snow to sea ice divided by grid-cell area

SImon.sidmassgrowthwat.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
SImon.sidmassgrowthwat.long_name: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Growth in Supercooled Open Water (Frazil)
SImon.sidmassgrowthwat.comment: The rate of change of sea ice mass due to sea ice formation in supercooled water (often through frazil formation) divided by grid-cell area. Together, sidmassgrowthwat and sidmassgrowthbot should give total ice growth

SImon.sidmassmeltbot.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
SImon.sidmassmeltbot.long_name: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Bottom Melting
SImon.sidmassmeltbot.comment: The rate of change of sea ice mass through melting at the ice bottom divided by grid-cell area

SImon.sidmassmeltlat.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
SImon.sidmassmeltlat.comment: The rate of change of sea ice mass through lateral melting divided by grid-cell area (report 0 if not explicitly calculated thermodynamically)

SImon.sidmassmelttop.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
SImon.sidmassmelttop.long_name: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Surface Melting
SImon.sidmassmelttop.comment: The rate of change of sea ice mass through melting at the ice surface divided by grid-cell area

SImon.sidmassth.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
SImon.sidmassth.comment: Total change in sea-ice mass from thermodynamic processes divided by grid-cell area

SImon.sidmasstranx.comment: Includes transport of both sea ice and snow by advection

SImon.sidmasstrany.comment: Includes transport of both sea ice and snow by advection

SImon.sidragbot.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.sidragbot.comment: Oceanic drag coefficient that is used to calculate the oceanic momentum drag on sea ice

SImon.sidragtop.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.sidragtop.comment: Atmospheric drag coefficient that is used to calculate the atmospheric momentum drag on sea ice

SImon.siextentn.comment: Total area of all Northern-Hemisphere grid cells that are covered by at least 15 % areal fraction of sea ice

SImon.siextents.comment: Total area of all Southern-Hemisphere grid cells that are covered by at least 15 % areal fraction of sea ice

SImon.sifb.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.sifb.comment: Mean height of sea-ice surface (=snow-ice interface when snow covered) above sea level

SImon.siflcondbot.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.siflcondbot.long_name: Net Conductive Heat Fluxes in Ice at the Bottom
SImon.siflcondbot.comment: the net heat conduction flux at the ice base

SImon.siflcondtop.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.siflcondtop.long_name: Net Conductive Heat Flux in Ice at the Surface
SImon.siflcondtop.comment: the net heat conduction flux at the ice surface

SImon.siflfwbot.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.siflfwbot.comment: Total flux of fresh water from water into sea ice divided by grid-cell area; This flux is negative during ice growth (liquid water mass decreases, hence upward flux of freshwater), positive during ice melt (liquid water mass increases, hence downward flux of freshwater)

SImon.siflfwdrain.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.siflfwdrain.comment: Total flux of fresh water from sea-ice surface into underlying ocean. This combines both surface melt water that drains directly into the ocean and the drainage of surface melt pond. By definition, this flux is always positive.

SImon.sifllattop.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconca)
SImon.sifllattop.long_name: Net Latent Heat Flux over Sea Ice
SImon.sifllattop.comment: the net latent heat flux over sea ice

SImon.sifllwdtop.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconca)
SImon.sifllwdtop.long_name: Downwelling Longwave Flux over Sea Ice
SImon.sifllwdtop.comment: the downwelling longwave flux over sea ice (always positive)

SImon.sifllwutop.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconca)
SImon.sifllwutop.long_name: Upwelling Longwave Flux over Sea Ice
SImon.sifllwutop.comment: the upwelling longwave flux over sea ice (always negative)

SImon.siflsaltbot.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.siflsaltbot.comment: Total flux of salt from water into sea ice divided by grid-cell area; salt flux is upward (negative) during ice growth when salt is embedded into the ice and downward (positive) during melt when salt from sea ice is again released to the ocean.

SImon.siflsensbot.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.siflsensbot.long_name: Net Upward Sensible Heat Flux Under Sea Ice
SImon.siflsensbot.comment: the net sensible heat flux under sea ice from the ocean

SImon.siflsenstop.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconca)
SImon.siflsenstop.long_name: Net Upward Sensible Heat Flux over Sea Ice
SImon.siflsenstop.comment: the net sensible heat flux over sea ice

SImon.siflswdbot.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.siflswdbot.long_name: Downwelling Shortwave Flux Under Sea Ice
SImon.siflswdbot.comment: The downwelling shortwave flux underneath sea ice (always positive)

SImon.siflswdtop.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconca)
SImon.siflswdtop.long_name: Downwelling Shortwave Flux over Sea Ice
SImon.siflswdtop.comment: The downwelling shortwave flux over sea ice (always positive by sign convention)

SImon.siflswutop.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconca)
SImon.siflswutop.long_name: Upwelling Shortwave Flux over Sea Ice
SImon.siflswutop.comment: The upwelling shortwave flux over sea ice (always negative)

SImon.siforcecoriolx.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.siforcecoriolx.long_name: Coriolis Force Term in Force Balance (X-Component)
SImon.siforcecoriolx.comment: X-component of force on sea ice caused by coriolis force

SImon.siforcecorioly.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.siforcecorioly.long_name: Coriolis Force Term in Force Balance (Y-Component)
SImon.siforcecorioly.comment: Y-component of force on sea ice caused by coriolis force

SImon.siforceintstrx.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.siforceintstrx.long_name: Internal Stress Term in Force Balance (X-Component)
SImon.siforceintstrx.comment: X-component of force on sea ice caused by internal stress (divergence of sigma)

SImon.siforceintstry.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.siforceintstry.long_name: Internal Stress Term in Force Balance (Y-Component)
SImon.siforceintstry.comment: Y-component of force on sea ice caused by internal stress (divergence of sigma)

SImon.siforcetiltx.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.siforcetiltx.long_name: Sea-Surface Tilt Term in Force Balance (X-Component)
SImon.siforcetiltx.comment: X-component of force on sea ice caused by sea-surface tilt

SImon.siforcetilty.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.siforcetilty.long_name: Sea-Surface Tilt Term in Force Balance (Y-Component)
SImon.siforcetilty.comment: Y-component of force on sea ice caused by sea-surface tilt

SImon.sigpp.long_name: Gross primary production in sea ice as carbon amount flux
SImon.sigpp.comment: Total GPP of ice algae in sea ice

SImon.sihc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
SImon.sihc.long_name: Sea-Ice Heat Content per Unit Area
SImon.sihc.comment: Heat content of all ice in grid cell divided by total grid-cell area. Water at 0 Celsius is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J.  Does not include heat content of snow, but does include heat content of brine. Heat content is always negative, since both the sensible and the latent heat content of ice are less than that of water

SImon.siitdconc.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.siitdconc.long_name: Sea-Ice Area Percentages in Thickness Categories

SImon.siitdsnconc.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siitdconc)
SImon.siitdsnconc.long_name: Snow Area Percentages in Ice Thickness Categories

SImon.siitdsnthick.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siitdconc)
SImon.siitdsnthick.long_name: Snow Thickness in Ice Thickness Categories

SImon.siitdthick.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siitdconc)

SImon.simass.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
SImon.simass.comment: (in OImon, sim included snow and sea ice mass)

SImon.simassacrossline.long_name: Sea Mass Area Flux Through Straits

SImon.simpconc.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.simpconc.long_name: Percentage Cover of Sea Ice by Meltpond
SImon.simpconc.comment: Percentage of sea ice, by area, which is covered by melt ponds, giving equal weight to every square metre of sea ice .

SImon.simpeffconc.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.simpeffconc.long_name: Fraction of Sea Ice Covered by Effective Melt Pond
SImon.simpeffconc.comment: Area fraction of sea-ice surface that is covered by open melt ponds, that is melt ponds that are not covered by snow or ice lids. This represents the effective (i.e. radiatively-active) melt pond area fraction.

SImon.simprefrozen.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice_melt_pond (comment: mask=simpconc)
SImon.simprefrozen.long_name: Thickness of Refrozen Ice on Melt Pond
SImon.simprefrozen.comment: Volume of refrozen ice on melt ponds divided by meltpond covered area

SImon.simpthick.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice_melt_pond (comment: mask=simpconc)
SImon.simpthick.long_name: Meltpond Mass per Unit Area (as Depth)

SImon.sino3.long_name: Dissolved Nitrate Amount in Sea Ice
SImon.sino3.comment: Mole amount means moles of substance per unit area

SImon.sipr.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.sipr.comment: mass of liquid precipitation falling onto sea ice divided by grid-cell area

SImon.sirdgconc.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.sirdgconc.long_name: Percentage Cover of Sea Ice by Ridging
SImon.sirdgconc.comment: Fraction of sea ice, by area, which is covered by sea ice ridges, giving equal weight to every square metre of sea ice .

SImon.sirdgthick.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice_ridges (comment: mask=sirdgconc)
SImon.sirdgthick.comment: Sea Ice Ridge Height (representing mean height over the ridged area)

SImon.sisali.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.sisali.comment: Mean sea-ice salinity of all sea ice in grid cell

SImon.sisaltmass.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
SImon.sisaltmass.long_name: Mass of Salt in Sea Ice per Area
SImon.sisaltmass.comment: Total mass of all salt in sea ice divided by grid-cell area

SImon.sishearvel.cell_methods: area: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc) time: point
SImon.sishearvel.long_name: Maximum Shear of Sea-Ice Velocity Field
SImon.sishearvel.comment: Maximum shear of sea-ice velocity field (second shear strain invariant)

SImon.sisi.long_name: Dissolved Silicon Amount in Sea Ice
SImon.sisi.comment: Mole amount means moles of substance per unit area

SImon.sisnconc.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.sisnconc.comment: Percentage of sea ice, by area, which is covered by snow, giving equal weight to every square metre of sea ice . Exclude snow that lies on land or land ice.

SImon.sisndmassdyn.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.sisndmassdyn.long_name: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Advection by Sea-Ice Dynamics
SImon.sisndmassdyn.comment: The rate of change of snow mass through advection with sea ice divided by sea-ice area

SImon.sisndmassmelt.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.sisndmassmelt.long_name: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Melt
SImon.sisndmassmelt.comment: the rate of change of snow mass through melt divided by sea-ice area

SImon.sisndmasssi.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.sisndmasssi.long_name: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Snow-to-Ice Conversion
SImon.sisndmasssi.comment: the rate of change of snow mass due to transformation of snow to sea ice divided by sea-ice area

SImon.sisndmasssnf.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.sisndmasssnf.long_name: Snow Mass Change Through Snow Fall
SImon.sisndmasssnf.comment: mass of solid precipitation falling onto sea ice divided by sea-ice area

SImon.sisndmasssubl.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.sisndmasssubl.long_name: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Evaporation or Sublimation
SImon.sisndmasssubl.comment: the rate of change of snow mass through sublimation and evaporation divided by sea-ice area

SImon.sisndmasswind.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.sisndmasswind.long_name: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Wind Drift of Snow
SImon.sisndmasswind.comment: the rate of change of snow mass through wind drift of snow (from sea-ice into the sea) divided by sea-ice area

SImon.sisnhc.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.sisnhc.long_name: Snow Heat Content per Unit Area
SImon.sisnhc.comment: Heat-content of all snow in grid cell divided by total grid-cell area. Snow-water equivalent at 0 Celsius is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J.  Does not include heat content of sea ice.

SImon.sisnmass.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.sisnmass.comment: (in OImon, sim included snow and sea ice mass)

SImon.sisnmassn.comment: Total mass of snow on sea ice of all Northern-Hemisphere grid cells

SImon.sisnmasss.comment: Total mass of snow on sea ice of all Southern-Hemisphere grid cells

SImon.sisnthick.cell_methods: area: mean where snow over sea_ice area: time: mean where sea_ice
SImon.sisnthick.comment: (in OImon, snd was volume per entire cell area)

SImon.sispeed.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.sispeed.comment: Speed of ice (i.e. mean absolute velocity) to account for back-and-forth movement of the ice

SImon.sistressave.cell_methods: area: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc) time: point
SImon.sistressave.long_name: Average Normal Stress in Sea Ice
SImon.sistressave.comment: Average normal stress in sea ice (first stress invariant)

SImon.sistressmax.cell_methods: area: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc) time: point
SImon.sistressmax.long_name: Maximum Shear Stress in Sea Ice
SImon.sistressmax.comment: Maximum shear stress in sea ice (second stress invariant)

SImon.sistrxdtop.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.sistrxdtop.long_name: X-Component of Atmospheric Stress on Sea Ice
SImon.sistrxdtop.comment: X-component of atmospheric stress on sea ice

SImon.sistrxubot.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.sistrxubot.long_name: X-Component of Ocean Stress on Sea Ice
SImon.sistrxubot.comment: X-component of ocean stress on sea ice

SImon.sistrydtop.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.sistrydtop.long_name: Y-Component of Atmospheric Stress on Sea Ice
SImon.sistrydtop.comment: Y-component of atmospheric stress on sea ice

SImon.sistryubot.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.sistryubot.long_name: Y-Component of Ocean Stress on Sea Ice
SImon.sistryubot.comment: Y-component of ocean stress on sea ice

SImon.sitempbot.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.sitempbot.comment: Report temperature at interface, NOT temperature within lowermost model layer

SImon.sitempsnic.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.sitempsnic.comment: Report surface temperature of ice where snow thickness is zero

SImon.sitemptop.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.sitemptop.comment: Report surface temperature of snow where snow covers the sea ice.

SImon.sithick.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.sithick.comment: (in OImon, sit was volume per entire cell area)

SImon.sitimefrac.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
SImon.sitimefrac.long_name: Fraction of Time Steps with Sea Ice
SImon.sitimefrac.comment: Fraction of time steps of the averaging period during which sea ice is present (siconc >0 ) in a grid cell

SImon.siu.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.siu.comment: The x-velocity of ice on native model grid

SImon.siv.cell_methods: area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)
SImon.siv.comment: The y-velocity of ice on native model grid

SImon.sivol.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
SImon.sivol.comment: Total volume of sea ice divided by grid-cell area (this used to be called ice thickness in CMIP5)

SImon.sivoln.comment: total volume of sea ice in the Northern hemisphere

SImon.sivols.comment: total volume of sea ice in the Southern hemisphere
